Reviews.Title: “Good Average option in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: RUMBOAORIENTE
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located to explore the city, certainly not were the actin is but easy access to most attractions. Cons: pricey extras (parking and breakfast) Pros: quiet and family friendly

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chicago2socal
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this downtown LA hotel which I surprised how close it is to the Walt Disney Concert Hall. I will definitely consider staying here if attending an evening concert or event. I would rather stay at an Omni than the nearby Westin Bonaventure. Being a member of their free Select Guest program gets me fresh orange juice or coffee delivered to the door in the morning with the newspaper. I chose orange juice because they had a coffee maker in the room with decent coffee to use. The large flat screen TV was also a nice addition to an already nicely appointed and modern room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and experience - as expected of Omni”
Reviews.Author: Skyler W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during our layover days on the way to Bora Bora (we are from Texas). I am an Omni select guest because Omni never disappoints. Upon arrival we were upgraded to the Omni floor 17 Club. This is a private floor with a lounge that serves free alcohol in the evenings and free food all day as well as great views of the city. The service was top notch as always, hotel was clean, and all employees were very courteous and respectful. Free town car service in a 3 mile radius beats paying for cabs and you ride in style. Nothing negative to say, Omni always does it right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: Edward M
Reviews.Content: Excellent "downtown" hotel, great stay! Within minutes of my call, the hotel sent a town car to LA Union Station-at 10 o'clock on a Sunday evening. Front desk staff was efficient and personable, my room was exactly as requested and very comfortable-I'd like to buy one of their King size beds! Attractive and friendly bar, and breakfast in the restaurant was wonderful-a little pricey, but expected at a facility of this class. The hotel is adjacent to the LA Museum of Contemporary Art, and a block from the Disney Theatre. Overall, a very good hotel at a fair price. Recommended highly!

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: jher12
Reviews.Content: this hotel is located by restaurants and stores that are open during the week. pretty much on the weekend, most of the places are closed. the hotel parking is expensive so we had to park a block away in a paid parking lot. very nice architecture around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good but rooms are not soundproof”
Reviews.Author: LuvSLO
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in January while on a business trip. As succinctly as possible, it's a great location in downtown LA and a beautiful hotel. The rooms are nicely appointed, large, and featured very comfortable beds. The fitness center was a decent size and had most of the amenities required for a good workout away from home. I appreciated that Omni Select Guests get free internet. My one gripe is that I stayed in an adjoining room and the door musn't be sound proof because I found the noise level to be ridiculous for a hotel of this caliber. I heard every conversation and bodily function from my neighbors and there's really no excuse for that. My recommendation would be to stay in a non-adjoining room, if you have the option, to ensure you have a pleasant night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you're attending a concert at Walt Disney of the Music Center”
Reviews.Author: Elise M
Reviews.Content: We spent only one night here in March...took the train up from San Diego to see a concert (Keith Jarett, jazz pianist) at the Walt Disney. I would have liked to have stayed longer... The staff were great--from doorman to reception to room service to housekeeping (I managed to break a glass, and they came right away and vacuumed and replaced the glass). Our room was on the 6th floor with a bit of a view (two high-rise condo buildings across the street blocked most of the view). The room was large, with two double beds, a comfortable wing chair, a desk with desk chair and a bureau containing mini-bar, drawers, coffee service, ice bucket and glassware. Atop the bureau was a 48" (?) Panasonic TV. The furniture was walnut. The beds were fitted with thick mattresses with pill-top and wonderfully soft linens and duvet. Very comfy. The decor was pleasing--muted tans and off-whites. Nice art work on the walls. Temperature could be controlled by thermostat. The bath was spacious; it had a glass-enclosed, nicely tiled shower as well as a separate bath tub. The vanity was contemporary in style with marble top, etc. The bath amenities were high quality. Plenty of plush towels too. We dined at Kendall's in front of the Dorothy Chandler Pavillion and therefore did not sample the cuisine at Noe's in the hotel. We did pass by it, and it looked very inviting. However, our room service lunch (a curried chicken salad and a soup du jour) was tasty, generously sized, and at the right temperature (hot soup, cold salad.) It was a bit pricey, but what isn't these days? It was important to use to be close to the Walt Disney Concert Hall. We needed only to exit the hotel on the third floor onto Grand, walk a block and change, and voila! We were there! However, a big plus it that the hotel offers a town car for shuttling to nearby venues. (When we left the next morning for Union Station, we were offered a shuttle, but there would have been a 10 minute delay, and we were running late, so we took a cab.) WE had no complaints, enjoyed all aspects of the hotel that we sampled, and will no doubt return. (The $40 parking fee is overboard, but we did not drive there.)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel ,Such helpful staff, delightful resturant and amazing music.”
Reviews.Author: Caroline H
Reviews.Content: Large clean and modern room. Giant bed with soft bedding, As we had never been to LA the staff helped us to plan a trip. We had a delishous evening meal in their restaurant and fine jazz music playing outside. A great place to stay on our honeymoon. Brilliant location right in the middle of the business district.We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic property, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Person2
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, great staff. Every single person in the hotel seemed trained to solve problems. Wonderful shower and toiletries. Beautiful lobby and comfy beds (pillows might have been better). Delicious food in Noe and at breakfast. Was attending a conference, and the Omni staff went above and beyond for us to have a wonderful meeting, even though we were competing for space with an NBA team staying in the hotel. I don't normally get my hopes up about conference hotels, but the hotel absolutely exceeded my expectations, and everyone at the conference raved about it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: kfitzy7
Reviews.Content: The is the best of the LA hotels I have stayed in recently. The rooms are beautiful and clean and recently updated. The hotel seems to be a little quieter than some of the others in the area (in a good way) but still has the same amenities and feel. I would recommend, and will stay here again when visiting LA!

Reviews.Title: “Quality 4-star with a few extra perks”
Reviews.Author: rsulliva
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family for combination business / vacation. The rooms are large and the beds very comfortable. The front of desk staff are all very efficient and courteous. The pool / exercise center is clean and well-appointed. No hot tub or sauna, unfortunately, and the pool is outdoors so it can get cold and windy. The milk and cookies provided every evening was a great touch, and adds to the family-friendly appeal of the hotel. We didn't eat in any of the restaurants but relied heavily on a late-night convenience store with a wide array or prepared foods. Again, a family-friendly alternative. The hotel provides a town car service for around downtown, which can be convenient especially since parking is insanely expensive and, like most of Los Angeles, you do need to drive to get anywhere. The hotel is right on top of MOCA and the Disney Concert Hall, which can have its drawbacks especially if a special event is booked (as it was when we were there, and the noise was deafening). Other nearby points of interest include Calle Alameda, an outdoor Mexican market, and Little Tokyo. The Staples Center is nearby as well. The downtown core is no longer the cultural wasteland it once was, and this hotel offers a convenient and very comfortable place to get to know the area.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible experience!”
Reviews.Author: CLEMS0N91
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Omni for her birthday getaway. Everything about the hotel was first class. The service was outstanding...from the front desk to the cleaning staff. The hotel even sent up a small birthday cake! The Omni Club was a great surprise. Both restaurants, Noe and the Grand Cafe, were outstanding as well. Walking distance to the Ahmanson Theatre if you feel like walking. If not, the hotel even offers complementary town car service to the shows.

Reviews.Title: “Service Outstanding, Facilities at a 4-star level.”
Reviews.Author: Nyquist
Reviews.Content: I just want to highlight the excellent service from everyone here, which was above and beyond a normal 4-star hotel. The staff at breakfast was really pro, and I even saw the chef coming out to inspect the buffet and make the slightest changes. There is also a nice bar with good service, but it can't shake the business hotel bar vibe. The bellmen were happy to hail cabs, take luggage and provide directions with a smile. When I missed a bus to the convention center they rolled up the hotel car and drove me there. Outside of the great service, it is a stock 4-star hotel infrastructure. Rooms were very pleasant and clean though not remarkable. But it is distinguished by the people there. I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Customer Service...comfy sleep :0)”
Reviews.Author: Desertbrat4now
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real find. Beautiful, yet not stuffy. Good first impression from the doormen to the front desk personnel..very warm and welcoming. Our room was lovely, but a little noisy from outside traffic. I called the front desk and was immediately upgraded to a Club Level room on the 16th floor. I had one minor problem in the room, and it was taken care of with appologies and a smile in record time. The Grand Cafe had wonderful yummy food and great service. We had an awesome lunch there (try the chicken burger). We were on business/pleasure and had a party to attend at the Standard Hotel...we were treated to a ride in the hotel complimentary towne car...now that's service. FYI...very happy to be at the Omni rather than the Standard. Thank you Omni for a great stay. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Souris
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on business, March 5 â€“ 8. As Marriott Platinum Rewards members, we always try to stay at a Marriott, but we couldnâ€™t get a room anywhere downtown, and grudgingly stayed at the Omni instead. Wow! What a pleasant surprise this was. Although we are not members and havenâ€™t stayed at an Omni in over 20 years, all of the staff, from the front door all the way up to the Concierge Lounge, treated us as old friends. The service at this hotel is absolutely top-flight. The Concierge Lounge at this Omni is truly â€œconciergeâ€� style. Unlike at the Marriott, alcoholic drinks are complimentary, mixed for you, and served to you at your table. In the evening, the Concierge Lounge staff always offers to make dinner reservations for you and to help in any way they can. The hotel had a very nice bar area on the 3rd floor. We found the restaurant NoÃ© to be highly overrated, but it was slightly better than most hotel restaurants. Our room (1724 Club Room) was tastefully decorated in warm shades of beige, taupe, gray, & charcoal. Although the bed was very comfortable, it was too high for me (5â€™2â€�) to easily get in & out of. We appreciated the extremely light duvet, which enabled us to sleep comfortably. There is a thicker duvet draped across the bottom of the bed if you need it. Lighting was excellent & bright. There was a large desk with comfortable leather chair, and an armchair with ottoman. The view was over Olive Street at the front entrance of the hotel. The bathroom was large enough in which to comfortably move around and had separate shower stall & bathtub. In addition to the usual shampoo, shower gel, conditioner, lotion and soap, there were also Q-tips, cotton balls, sewing kit, toothpaste, mouthwash, razor, shaving cream, shoe mitt & shower cap. The bar of soap was much larger than normally found in a hotel, which we very much appreciated. I have only a few minor complaints. (1) We originally booked (in October) 5 nights at $284 on the hotel website, but due to changes in our business appointment schedule & flight changes, we had to reduce our stay to 3 nights. (These changes were made a week in advance). The hotel did change the reservation, but bumped our nightly room rate to $379. (They told me the price had gone up because the hotel was fully booked)! However, at the same time, I also reduced the stay to 2 nights for a colleague traveling with us, and his price stayed the same. Go figure! (2) We arrived in the room to find a used towel on the floor of the shower, so we were not convinced that the shower had been cleaned after the previous guest. We called this to the attention of the front desk, and housekeeping did come to take care of it. Still, it was a rather yucky thing to see upon arrival. Otherwise, housekeeping was generally good & pleasant. (3) The location was a bit far from the Convention Center. We had to take a taxi to & from everyday, costing us $9 plus tip each way. Also, it was quite a climb up a steep hill to get back to the hotel on evenings when we went out to eat. The escalators between 5th & Hope Streets do make the climb back to the hotel a bit easier, but we were told they stop running at 9 or 10 pm. These minor complaints account for my lower rating in Value, Location and Cleanliness. The lower rating for Sleep Quality is due to to extreme height of the bed. Nevertheless, it is a 5-star hotel. All in all, we enjoyed our stay and were very pleased with this Omni Hotel. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best service; excellent follow-through”
Reviews.Author: fireplug80
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel several times a year when I attend performances nearby. Location is great and staff always very professional. Last month I left a folder with important info in the business center, then left for airport. Called when I got home and Juan at front desk had it and sent it by FedEx to me next day. Unfortunately I gave my po box, so it was returned to the Omni. Then Blanca, the Loyalty Ambassador followed up and Charles in security called to let me know they were re-sending. I felt pretty stupid and regret being so much trouble, but they could not have been kinder.

Reviews.Title: “Very luxurierst Hotel in downtown of LA”
Reviews.Author: aida_b1
Reviews.Content: I was there alone for 5 days. The Location is very Bad. But the Hotel is very Good and clean. I wont suggest people to Rest in downtown LA. It's a scarry area. Be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Very posh! hehe”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn J
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay here in september 2010. We thought it was really nice and it's very close to the 'underground' station so travelling around LA was really easy. We went to Hollywood, Univesal Studio's and Long Beach on the underground and we felt safe though some of the charaters there were quite unusual. The hotel is suited to business types but we did enjioy it. There is a nice bar behind the hotel whcih serve the BEST nachos we've had EVER had and is full people having after work drinks who loved the fact we had English accents and were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully newly renovated”
Reviews.Author: Candiland-Love
Reviews.Content: Beautifully newly renovated hotel. A great home away from home in downtown Los Angeles. The king bed was so comfortable and the furnishings were beautiful. The hotel restaurant is great too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Downtown Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: mrbear
Reviews.Content: I have been travelling to Los Angeles for about 35 years. In the past, any level-headed visitor would avoid downtown Los Angeles at any cost. With the building of LA Live! this has changed. Downtown LA has come to life, with people on the street after dark, interesting restaurants, well-preserved architecture and the very convenient subway. The Omni is smack in the middle of all that is interesting in downtown LA...it is definitely the best value for money available anywhere in the greater LA area. The hotel is beautifully fitted, the staff and service excellent and the room comfortable. The only issue is the cost of valet parking at the hotel...as high as $40 per day during the week...but this is not unusual in LA...for those staying on the weekend, parking is permitted on the street...and is free. The hotel is very, very highly recommended...would not stay anywhere else in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: route66stan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business February 5-7. If you desire to be in downtown LA, this hotel will afford you the modern, highly functional hotel you are looking for, without having to pay super-steep prices for a room. The Omni chain will frequently offer discounts for AAA, AARP, gov't rates, etc., so take advantage of those if you can when reserving online. Moreover, just joining the Omni Select Guest program, which is free, provides you with complimentary internet in your room. There is no reason not to do this. I found the wi-fi to be a dependable service here, just as I had when I stayed at the Omni in Cancun a few months earlier. By checking in online before your arrival here in downtown LA, you will completely bypass the registration desk. My valet/bellman handed me my room keys as I first entered the lobby and promptly ushered me upstairs; my luggage followed me up the elevator. I was very pleased with my comfortable, clean, modern, attractive guest room. My requests for a high floor with a view overlooking California Plaza were honored, and I found the king bed to be quite comfortable, with several extra pillows. The "Classic Deluxe" guest room and the bathroom were both sufficiently spacious (384+ sq. ft.) and well-appointed. The bathroom had both a small tub and a shower stall. Both were sparkling clean. There was plenty of hot water and water pressure each morning. The usual assortment of lotions / shampoos / conditioners were there for my use. The in-room safe with programmable lock combination worked perfectly, and it was large enough for my laptop and accessories. Bathrobes, clothing iron and refrigerator were well placed and worked great. The housekeeping service was excellent and also consisted of one or two polite visits to my room each evening to see if I needed anything, such as more ice, etc. The flat-screen TV worked well. The TV did not have a plethora of stations, but it did have most of the local and national stations/networks. The pay-per-view movie service had some but a limited number of choices. The newspapers I requested for morning delivery when I made the reservation were both placed in the hallway right at my door each morning. Express check-out is conveniently and efficiently handled. I found the bell staff and the valet staff to be very professional and capable. I had driven my own car to LA and had no qualms at all leaving it with this valet staff. I did feel that the price of $40 per day to park was a tad high, even though I realize this is downtown LA. $20-$30 I wouldn't have even blinked at. I just thought $40 was a little high. But I have zero complaints about the quality of service I received. These guys are good, and they are knowledgeable for providing you with local driving directions, if you ask them. Getting here and getting back onto the LA freeway system are relatively simple if you stay at this hotel. LA's downtown is actually pretty easy to navigate, and it served my business purposes to be here. The hotel's concierge desk is usually staffed. There were a couple of things I inquired about with which they were not able to assist me, but they were very polite and at least tried. I felt that the hotel's spa was somewhat "hidden" on an upper floor. When I finally located it one evening, I found it to be closed; apparently most of their service is done by appointment only, rather than on a walk-in basis. The staff at the hotel's front desk were always cordial, professional and helpful. Since I was in the hotel during the early portion of a work week, the lounge seemed a little quiet. The place was beautiful, with a nice big-screen TV and a basketball game showing, but no other customers that I saw. The staff on that shift were ready to serve, however. I would imagine that the lounge receives more business later in the week and whenever the hotel is full. It was not full during my stay. I really loved the hotel's breakfast buffet in the 'Grand Cafe' on the third floor. The buffet opens at 6:30 a.m., and I found it to be a very enjoyable breakfast experience. The price was reasonable -- I tipped well and still got out of there for under $30. The made-to-order omlette was one of the best I have had in years. There are plenty of hot food items, and they change them up from day to day. There are several cereal choices; the milk was cold, and I found the fresh fruit and pastry assortments to be ample. The dining area is large. When I was there, it was fairly quiet, and I could enjoy my morning newspaper. Just outside the Grand Cafe and down the hallway a few feet is a "to-go" coffee and pastry venue, if you don't have time for a sit-down breakfast. The Grand Cafe serves meals throughout the day, but I dined elsewhere for lunches and dinners, so I cannot speak to their menus or services at those times. In conclusion, I was very satisfied with my stay at the downtown LA Omni. I will stay here again and do recommend you give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Omni Los Angeles downtown...Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Maynards
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed February 2 to 6 at The Omni Los Angeles at California Plaza. I read many of the reviews posted on the Tripadvisor and decided this would be a great hotel choice for our first stay in downtown LA. In the past we stayed in the West Hollywood area and loved the Magic Castle Hotel for friendliness, location and overall retro feel. We were not disappointed in The Omni and my husband stated each day wow you found a great hotel! Pros: It's all pros! Beautiful room with a king bed, sofa and chairs. A desk with great fast speed connections for my husband to keep in touch with our company at home in Canada. A previous reviewer recommended joining the Omni Club for extras...great advice! We were able to check-in on line so when we arrived our room keys were waiting. Check out is just as easy! The staff were all so friendly and helpful. Having a courtesy car that drives hotel guests within 3 miles of the hotel was perfect for a downtown stay...we didn't need to rent a car for this trip. This trip was about exploring downtown and the hotel is in a great location. The hotel bed was so comfortable and we had no street noise...outstanding in a hotel located downtown in a large city! Third floor offers a full breakfast restaurant or Starbucks for a quick coffee and morning snack if on the run. We enjoyed the option of both. The hotel's main restaurant looked inviting and on our next visit we will book a dinner and also enjoy the wonderful bar patio! We will definitely stay at The Omni again....lots more to say but not enough space...a very well kept and clean hotel ...not one negative to say! We visit LA at least 2 to 3 times a year and when downtown this is my new first choice!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel in an Equally Superb City”
Reviews.Author: luckik30
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Omni Plaza hotel this past January for a few days. Immediately we were greeted warmly upon check-in and looked forward to our stay. Our king room faced California Plaza and we enjoyed looking out at the MOCA as well. The valet attendants were always a pleasure and anytime I had a question for the front desk it was answered quickly and professionally. Being a member of the Omni Select Guest Program is strongly recommended (it's free) and makes for extra touches that are really appreciated during your stay. Our room was always freshly turned down and smelled great. Every morning we awoke to our complimentary beverage, and even splurged on our last day for a reasonably priced croissant with jam. Beautiful hotel with some greenery nearby as well. It is true that there isn't too much nearby other than the museum and Disney Hall but the dining in the hotel is quite yummy as an alternative to trekking around Los Angeles. Basically, if you can swing it, stay at this fantastic hotel. You definitely won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: MaryFolsom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to see the opera at the Dorothy Chandler Pavilion. Hotel was reasonably priced, clean, convenient and lovely. Bed, sheets, pillows all very comfortable, staff was very welcoming and friendly. The Dorothy Chandler Pavilion was just a couple of blocks walk away and although the hotel did offer to drive us there and pick us up in their town car without charge, we felt we could handle the 2 blocks ourselves. Highly recommend this hotel. We had absolutely no complaints and I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Basiluzzo
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel. It's across the street from my company's LA offices so it's incredibly convenient for me, but really if you need to be anywhere in the northern end of downtown (Bunker Hill/City Hall/Disney Concert Hall) it's a short walk. Even in other parts of downtown I would choose it because it's quiet, elegant, comfortable, clean, with excellent service. I've never eaten in the restaurant but the attached bar is excellent with a menu suitable for dining by yourself. My only criticism is that there is a fee for the wifi - I wish the US hotel industry would get over it and stop charging for that. Not sure it would be the best tourist hotel as downtown isn't where tourists want to be, but as a business hotel, it's great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you are in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: StarliteAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as I am a member of GHA Discovery and wanted to try another property. My room was beautiful, very well appointed. Some things however felt a tad off from my experiences with other hotels in the Association. I enjoyed the Bar area. And the concierge was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in LA”
Reviews.Author: comfytravel
Reviews.Content: Convenient location with pleasant views. Although downtown LA is not the liveliest place, the hotel is close to subway, train station, and has valet parking if you drive. Comfortable rooms, though no mini-bar for some reasons. Great service, good breakfast (by American standards), charming lounge with live music. WiFi in the lobby. May be there was a sale, but we had it for very reasonable price. We really enjoyed LA, so much to see! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “location is the only advantage”
Reviews.Author: statestreet96
Reviews.Content: If you have a meeting near by its great but the rooms are dated and difficult to find electrical outlets. You have to search and crawl under furniture. Room service is terrible. There is not much around to eat at later in the evening so if you come in late like i did you have to rely on room service. Twice they could not get a simple cheeseburger correct. Fitness center is okay Walls in rooms are paper thin so don't except a good night sleep. Connection to the internet was difficult and took a couple of calls.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!Only a couple miles From art district!”
Reviews.Author: Jcool54
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel accommodations. Loyalty members can get a "speedy" check in upon arrival. Rooms are large with designer bathroom ( granite, separate bath/shower). There is a small starbucks on the third floor near the lounge/restaurant thats convenient. The lounge has live music at night and was quite packed for a wednesday night. Definitely plan on returning here when I have business in LA. However, The hotel's Valet parking is a bit pricey - $40

Reviews.Title: “SUPER RUDE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sophia G
Reviews.Content: One thing for sure, I will never stay in this hotel!!!! The software is fairly ok, but the front desk staff is atrocious! What the management needs to do is to change the entire lethargic and completely ignorant staff; The manager, I think his name was Robi or Robert or Robie was enormously unpleasant and perfectly oblivious about my concerns in regards to AC. The night before, I came down to talk to FD. It was 2am and I couldn't sleep because the room was freezing. The front desk agent was texting on the phone for almost a minute before even noticing me. But that was nothing to Robi who was supermely rude, the next day! How do these people get a job??? Stay away from these people!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Nice additions but implementation need to be ironed out”
Reviews.Author: prozerran
Reviews.Content: $140-150 standard double/night Pros - Location is good. Near the financial district, 4min walk to Pershing Square Metro station. The hotel is located between 2 streets (Olive St is the main entrance, but you can enter from Grand St or even California plaza). 7min walk to the financial district and very close to Central Markets (on Hill st). - Spacious and clean room. Sign up for Omni membership to get free wifi otherwise $10/day. Apparently you can also use the complementary sedan to get to places within 3miles of the hotel - I did not use this. -Nice decor Cons - Reception Staff not overly helpful or welcoming. - Apparently I should have received complementary morning beverage with my Omni membership but there was no form or anything to request this. Overall a very nice hotel in the middle of downtown. Omni membership was suppose to make the experience more special but it was just another hotel membership.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: VinoBambinos
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night while in town for a meeting. Have stayed at Omni hotels in the past (Chicago) and have always been impressed with the level of customer service provided, however the service at this Omni exceeded any previous stay. Check-in was quick and friendly (not stuffy), and they met all my booking requirements. After unpacking we decided to look for a sushi bar nearby, the concierge was quick to recommend Takami Sushi and made reservations for us, when we asked for directions he insisted we use their towncar service (free) and we were immediately escorted to the car. The driver Eswin gave us his card and told us to call when we were ready to return. After a nice dinner we paid the tab and called, when we stepped off the elevator the car was waiting for us. The next morning we met for a breakfast meeting at their restaurant Grand Cafe, which offered an excellent buffet. We will stay here on return trips for business.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel Right In the Middle of L.A.”
Reviews.Author: WalnutBaron
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed an extended weekend in Los Angeles and loved our stay at the beautiful Omni. The first thing I'll say is that we were able to stay at a very affordable rate through a promotion offered through the Omni Hotels website. Our room was spacious, with a king size bed, a large sitting chair, desk, small refrigerator, and flat screen TV. The room was exceptionally clean and well-maintained, and the maid service was polite and thorough and included turndown service and a filled ice bucket each evening. If you're a member of Omni's frequent guest program, they'll also polish your shoes and bring hot coffee or juice to your room each morning--a genuinely distinct display of excellent guest service and appreciation. While the hotel does require valet service for your car, they don't overcharge for parking as is so common at downtown hotels in large cities. The valet service was prompt and efficient. We had two meals at the hotel--lunch in the casual dining room (which serves only breakfast and lunch) and dinner in the more formal dining room. Both meals were very good, with menus displaying a variety of offerings and--quite typical of L.A.--a large variety of vegan and organic foods as well. We made frequent use of the gym--a truly excellent facility. The gym has elliptical machines, treadmills, free weights, and a few weight machines. The best part was the ice cold, citrus-infused water available after a workout. The location of the hotel is right in the downtown area, with great access to the Disney Concert Hall, the Dorothy Chandler Pavilion, the Los Angeles Museum of Modern Art, and many other attractions. We really enjoyed our visit and look forward to returning someday.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: EmptyseaNZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Omni twice, once in December and again in January. Before our stay I had some questions so used their online help - I was contacted by a great CSA, Kim, who was very knowledgeable and extremely helpful. She recommended that we joined their free Select club to get free wi-fi during our stay. The Concierge Daniel also confirmed a trip for us prior to our arrival. Staff were friendly and helpful, from Reception to Room Service, to Valet parking. Because the hotel is downtown there's not a huge variety of places to eat at night - but the in room dining was perfectly acceptable. The pool was great and so warm! The decor was modern, the bathrooms clean and the rooms spacious. All in all a good hotel, with friendly helpful staff at a reasonable rate. Make sure you join their Select club.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect them to wake you up!!”
Reviews.Author: lawnut2002
Reviews.Content: Wake up calls were a joke for this hotel! They do not have a automated wake up call, so they rely on a human being to do it. I stayed their several days, and requested a wake up call each day. They never called on-time, as late as 15 to 20 minutes. I would even ask for a follow up call and they couldn't get that right either. They called so late one morning that the person didn't even say "this is your wake up call"; instead, she said "oh are you up?" I said who is this? She said "I'm sorry I meant to call you for your wake up call. So I wanted to at least make sure that you didn't oversleep!" Of course, I had since it was nearly 45 minutes late!!!! I was very upset. I had a 3am and 4 am call set for the next morning and called to cancel it. Wouldn't you know it--they called at 3am and 4am on the dot!! I screamed to say, I CANCELED THE CALL!!!! I left there and went to the Omni (Pittsburgh) the following week, and wouldn't you know it--they did the exact same thing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: bredcats
Reviews.Content: Truly enjoy my stays at this hotel. The staff is wonderful, the view of the Plaza makes you want to sit in front of the window in that comfortable chair, read and have a glass of wine.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty close to a five star, minor issues”
Reviews.Author: Marius40
Reviews.Content: I normally write reviews promptly but have been waiting for two weeks to try to resolve a minor issue that is pending (more on that later), Despite traveling 30 weeks a year on business and for fun, I have never stayed at an Omni. In doing my due diligence, I learned from other TA reviewers, that it is beneficial to join their loyalty program which I did before booking. One of the things that concerned me (even though it is work's money) was the $40 a night valet only charge. I usually find street parking or a cheaper lot (both are available nearby though street parking is very limited and the car must be moved by 8:00 a.m. or towed. Interestingly, the $40 valet is for weekdays only, weekend guests are only charged $20. (Can you say expense accounts?) Surpisingly, I was only charged $20, which I am guessing but do not know for sure was that I was there on a government rate. The hotel itself is very nice, staff very friendly, room stylish and clean. The loyalty program previously mentioned exceeds any other loyalty program I am a member of, though admittedly, it is the cause of my minor issue. By being a loyalty member, you get two items pressed (ironed) for free as well as your shoes shined. Very, very nice. You also get free internet (though it should be free anyway), and a choice of coffee or juice delivered to your room each morning. Nice touch! I should also mention that I was given a king bed, corner room. Now to the minor issue. The first night I had two items pressed and the second night I called the front desk and asked if there was a charge to have two more items pressed. I was told on night one, that two items are free and each item after that was $5.00. However, it was not clear whether this was two items a night or for the whole stay, which is why I called the front desk before I got the shirts pressed. The young lady admittedly didn't sound sure about this fact; asked someone else, then told me that I could get two more items for free. When I checked out, there were no charges for this; but two days later I received an email with a $10.00 charge added for the pressing of the items. I immediately called the hotel, left a message for the customer service rep, and...........nothing, no call back, no email, nothing. in reading the reviews, i see that management usually responds to reviews, so here goes. You have a great hotel; I look forward to staying there again, but not responding to a minor customer service issue is the difference between a four and five star rating. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Berenice
Reviews.Content: We go to Los Angeles a couple times of year for the symphony and opera. We usually stay in Santa Monica but the driving and traffic to and from downtown LA is stressful and time consuming. This time we decided to stay downtown at the Omni and were very pleased. It is one block from the Walt Disney concert hall and MOCA, and a relatively short walk (albeit uphill) to some of LA's best restaurants. The public areas and guest rooms are nicely done and comfortable, in typical business conference hotel decor. We also took advantage of the hotel's complimentary car service which takes guests to and from any place within three miles of the hotel. Because the hotel is located in the financial district, it becomes deserted and lonely on Saturdays and Sundays, but its proximity to the music hall and theaters is a bit advantage, as well as the very reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: holidayer80
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for five days in January. I booked through hotwire, and got the hotel for $125 per night. For this price, the hotel was good value. The rooms were very nice, the beds were the most comfortable I have slept on, and the spa (I had the BEST massage ever) and work out room were nice. We had a room right by the elevator, which could not be changed (according to the lady at check in) because the hotel was at capacity. Unfortunately, the sound carried into the room from people waiting for the elevator and at times, it felt like there were strangers talking in our room talking. The sound travelling from room to room was very bad. We could hear the conversations our neighbors were having in the bathroom in the morning, and we could hear the opposite room's occupants talking about the hockey game in the evening. Bring ear plugs to block all the noise out and you will have a nice sleep. Parking is a little steep from Sunday - Thursday (fourty dollars a day). There is a car park a block away for 8 dollars a day, which I would recommend. I parked the car with the hotel valet for one evening, as I had a race the next morning and wanted the car parked in the hotel for convenience. Unfortunately, my car was parked behind another car, and the valet could not find the keys to the other car to move it. So, I waited for half an hour until this was sorted out. Because of this, I almost missed the road race. It was very frustrating. Check in and check out was a breeze. Housekeeping was a little lack luster and they actually woke us up one morning at 8:15 to clean the room. The towels for the bathroom were not always topped up, as well, the shampoo and conditioner were never replaced once they were used up. The location of the hotel is not the best, as there is not much to do downtown...but that is not the hotel's fault. The noise and valet issue aside, this hotel is definitely worth the 125 dollars a night...but not much more.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: jennamack
Reviews.Content: Pros: -very nice rooms -great restaurant for breakfast -very nice bar & bar food -lots of good casual lunch places to walk to for lunch (esp. Mendocino Farms--awesome) -great concierge (Daniel) -looks like a great place for a conference Cons --housekeeping shoddy & doesn't appear until late in the day even when requested earlier

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: palmnz
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights but wish we had longer. The staff were friendly and helpful. They booked two sightseeing tours for us at very short notice. The room was very clean and had everything we needed for the short stay. The evening restaurant was superb - the service and the food. The breakfast and lunch restaurant was equally good. Great selection of food. The location was ok and we were picked up from the hotel for our tours. If we had been given a map on our arrival it may have made our stay better so remember to ask for one if they forget. We walked to the jewellery district but got overwhelmed with the shops as far too many so didn't end up buying anything. It was very easy to walk a couple of blocks in the wrong direction and then feel uncomfortable in the grotty surroundings so take care when walking. The hotel itself is in a nice safe location and we would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Impressed!!!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea L
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Omni Hotel California Plaza from 12/30/2011-1/2/2012, in addition to us celebrating the New Year, the 30th was his Birthday. We checked in late Friday evening after a long flight from Connecticut, we were greeted with excellent customer service, upgraded to a Premier Room upon check-in and a complementary glass of white wine after the front desk staff that assisted us saw how exhausted we were! As a woman who is finicky about everything imaginable, I was sooooo pleased with the cleanliness of this Hotel, the plastic that was placed daily on the wine glasses and drinking classes, I didn't feel like I had to wear shower shoes in the stand alone shower, which is huge for me, the bathroom excellent size, only drawback ladies not enough counter space. Room service was excellent, I have to say we experienced none of the issues the patron did with breakfast trays being left in the hallway, we ordered room service Saturday Night left the tray outside the door the next morning within the hour it was gone. I was impressed with the fitness Center, no issues there either, excellent equipment options, loved the basket of complementary brand new ear buds you could use, however I brought my own. I am back and forth from home to LA at least 3 times a year, so I agree Downtown LA isn't the best place for Restaurant options, I mean come on your in LA, venture out, We dined at Katana's Friday evening, we tried to make it to Fogo de Chao Saturday but had to get ready for New Yearâ€™s Eve Party, so ended up eating at the Grove, Sunday it was Bossanova excellent Brazilian food. Near by the Omni there is an Ice-skating ring and many areas to walk around to see during the DAY or early evening of Downtown LA. Last I am a Starbucks fanatic and when I attempted to grab a caffine jolt before my evening began Saturday I was told by the worker at the cafe' located in the hotel on the 2nd floor that the machines were being cleaned, they were suppose to close at 8pm, it was 7:40pm needless to say I was not a happy camper.

Reviews.Title: “Truely deluxe!!”
Reviews.Author: Creasians
Reviews.Content: After having stayed at the various LA downtown hotels, surprisingly, I found myself at this hotel and can only say this place is incredible! Highend, expensive is one thing but if you are able to find govt or discounted rates, you'l be sure to find yourself in the laps of comfort and class all together! Their complimentary towncar service is great too if you wanted to swing around the downtown for work or pleasure. I am truely impressed. Wish I could have stayed here before rather than wasting my time at other closer places like the Westin and Marriott!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't seem to get it together”
Reviews.Author: freqtrav3
Reviews.Content: My first clue that there might be a problem with this hotel was the multiple breakfast room service trays still in the hallway at 3 p.m. when I checked in (they were still there at 9 p.m.). I didn't check my room closely on arrival, just dropped my bags and went to meet colleagues for dinner. When I returned, exhausted, I discovered that neither the bed nor the bathroom had been cleaned (lots of long black hair, I am blond). First offer was to send housekeeping to clean, but after I insisted, I was moved to a new room. New room was clean. Got up at 5 to use the fitness center, which was full. One treadmill was not working, so I went and reported that to the front desk. They assured me it would be safe to run outside, in the dark, around the hotel-yea, right, I'll just jump over the homeless guys sleeping on every corner. I am from a big city, and fairly brave, but this is NOT an area for a single woman to be out at 5 a.m. Never did get a treadmill, the fitness center remained packed and I had to leave to go to work. As others have pointed out, restaurant options are very limited in the evenings in this area. Overall, staff seemed pleasant but unaware of the service level one would expect in this type of hotel- for example, no offer to bring me keys to new room or to help me move. And I'm an Omni "select guest."

Reviews.Title: “if you have to be downtown this is a good choice”
Reviews.Author: newro
Reviews.Content: Ok spent four days here while going to the rose bowl.Hotel itself very nice clean rooms.Pleasant staff though a little overwhelmed at least attempted to provide excellant service.The surrounding area while ok during the day is a little sketchy at night.Which leads me to the point.Restaurants in the area are no better and in some cases worse then the two at the hotel.So basically eat at the grand or noe.In closing i could find no fault in my stay a small billing discrepancy was handled promptly so again if you have to be downtown stay here

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: mokigrand
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while in LA to attend the Rose Bowl. The Omni was part of our charter package. It is the third Omni I have stayed at and this one did not disappoint (neither did the others). First, our check-in experience was excellent. Easy! While the rooms weren't ready (we did arrive prior to normal check-in) our bags were stored and we were able to get into them upon return later. The concierge was incredible. She obviously loves her job because she was not only excellent but couldn't fake that smile and enthusiasm. The Omni has a courtesy car to deliver you short distances around the hotel. We took advantage of that to get a ride to Union Station and back. Fast and super friendly drivers. We called housekeeping to get an extra set of towels. They were delivered within minutes...and not just one set, but several. While we never ate in the restaurants, we did frequent the coffee shop each morning. Friendly, helpful outstanding service. I would absolutely recommend this hotel for top notch service, comfortable rooms and out all around wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni Experience - not a fault to find”
Reviews.Author: misspiggy65
Reviews.Content: Ok so we had just spent a week in Vegas, and wanted to relax, downtown LA is a place we have stayed before in other hotels. Booked up to New Year at the Omni, through Priceline. Absolutely lovely, we had the std king room, bedding, surroundings, furnishings etc, to such a high standard. This hotel was so quiet, and the staff courteous and attentive. Dream shower, and a mini bar key if you want it - we just used it to cool our own champagne. The valet parking was brilliant at only 20 per day (we paid 38 at the Westin Bonadventure and that hotel is quite frankly horrid)! Happy hour for three hours in the evening offering lovely food, and really good drinks at great prices, and the restaurant really rates. We will always use this one when we go to LA now. We really appreciated. Nice and close to Grand Central Market for that local food experience.

Reviews.Title: “If you have to stay in downtown LA...”
Reviews.Author: just up and go
Reviews.Content: I had to attend a business meeting in downtown Los Angeles in December and the Omni was the closest hotel to the meeting. I was very pleasantly surprised with this hotel. First, when I booked online, i joined the loyalty program. I think that was essential, as it included several "extras" such as express check-in, free newspapers, and free morning beverage delivered to the room. Also, the rate that I booked was very favorable, and included parking and breakfast. I was put in a corner room, which was large and bright. The bed was extremely comfortable - pillow-top mattress, firm pillows. The bathroom was large, had a separate shower and had nice bath products. Room service was quick, efficient and good. Had the buffet breakfast not been included in the rate, I probably would have passed on it and gone to a nearby Starbucks. There were a lot of choices in the buffet and the food was pretty decent quality. The fitness facility was on the small side, but was clean and had well maintained equipment that was in very good condition. I would definitely stay here again if I had to be in downtown Los Angeles, and if I was able to get a good rate. It's a very nice, well maintained hotel with very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: Mauibuilt77
Reviews.Content: Beautiful! Great service no problems no hidden charges ... Will be staying here from now on...

Reviews.Title: “Good experience for our stay”
Reviews.Author: chioi1922_2
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed here for five nights. Very friendly staff. My daughter's mobile phone was accidentally left behind in the floor of our rental car while the hotel's valet parking staff helped us parked the car when we proceeded to check in at the counter. The staff picked up the phone and returned it to us while we were queuing for the check-in. He also advised us to check our other personal belongings before returning the car to the rental company. Other good points included spacious bath room, comfortable bed and bedding. A piece of advice here, don't forget to join their loyalty membership so that the internet charges can be waived. You can join after you have checked in. Otherwise the daily internet charge is 9.95 USD if I remember correctly. Our two young children got the kiddie-bags welcome goodies which was very nice. Since we did not drive in Los Angeles, the Metro Red Line and bus stops were just 3~5 minutes away. There is also a couple of convenient stores located in the plaza so we could buy our snacks and fruit drinks etc. California Pizza Kitchen was located in the next building across street (I believe it is located inside Wells Fargo Centre). Final say, I'm not sure it is good for family travelers; but it definitely suits for business traveler; especially if your meetings are in the downtown financial area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Omaima
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel, quite rooms. breakfast is good. Very freindly staff and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean - recently renovated hotel in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: NYHokie
Reviews.Content: I travelled to LA for a meeting in late November and had to stay in downtown LA. I did my research on Trip Advisor. The reviews I read were very helpful and they turned out to be very accurate. The hotel recently was renovated, the room I stayed in was very clean and spacious. The hotel is home to "the most romantic downtown restaurant in LA - 2011" according to a local LA newspaper. The restaurant was nice, but I haven't spent enough time in other downtown LA restaurants to confirm or rebuff the claim it celebrates. The Omni offers a free black car ride to anywhere in the downtown LA area (i.e. within 3 miles radius from the Omni). I took advantage of this free service to have dinner at the L.A. LIVE complex (where the Staples Center and Nokia Theater are located). There are several restaurants in the L.A. Live complex - definitely worth checking out - rather than paying for a $30 one way cab ride to other LA neighborhoods. If you're in downtown for business - I definitely recommend the Omni for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to it's website”
Reviews.Author: JaiLane
Reviews.Content: This hotel lives up to every review I read while searching hotel sites. As well as the website's amenities and photos. The staff friendly and helpful. The rooms stylish, clean, comfortable, and the carpet didn't creep me out. Comfy beds. Oh and the best part the window opened. Great bathroom with tub and separate shower. Loved the light on the make-up mirror next to the sink. It made for a great night light. USA Today at the door every morning. Very pleasant cafe restaurant, and small Starbucks to-go store. Complementary cookie and coffee station in the lobby. A comfortable bar and lounge, the drink prices not bad for a hotel. Didn't use the gym but it looked well equipped. Too cold to experience the Pool. From my window it looked like the picture. Lobby computers available for a hefty price, bring your own. Free in room Wi-Fi. Good Valet Service, never had to wait. this too is little pricey, but I guess it's comparable to similar Hotels. Be sure to check rates, the are weekday and weekend rates. Good downtown LA location for business trips. Very accessible to Freeway and Main crosstown Streets. We had no major issues. One of 2 phones in the room didn't work. Didn't much matter we only used it to call Valet. The first night was unseasonably cold and there seemed to be a Capped temperature on the thermostat. Found a good rate on a Discount Hotel site. I would recommend this hotel, it's well worth your money.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jsnyder02
Reviews.Content: I travel to LA frequently for work. It's always a treat when the Omni is offering a rate that falls within our expense guidelines, occurring twice so far. The rooms are excellent, location is prime, and amenities are out of this world if you simply sign up for the rewards program. Free shoe shine, free shirt pressing, free wifi, free morning beverage delivered to room -- all unique in my experience and really improve the business travel experience. I really have only good things to say about this hotel - my only complaint is that I wish they always offered rates which permitted me to book here!

Reviews.Title: “Needed a hotel near USC”
Reviews.Author: CruisenFamily
Reviews.Content: We picked this location because it was near USC - but far enough away that we thought it was a safe neighborhood. The staff here is AWESOME! Room was comfortable - we didn't hear any street noise. Convenient little coffee stand/store on site. Nice piano lounge in the evening - on site. They have a property car that took us to our dinner reservation and then came and picked us up - which was great because we didn't have to deal with traffic. On site parking can be pricey, but hey, it's LA. Would recommend this hotel and stay here again if in Los Angeles. We joined their club and got free WI FI, newspaper, on-line check in, and coffee in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in financial district”
Reviews.Author: jayarrscott
Reviews.Content: Nice 5* in quiet area in financial district (fairly quiet but next to Walt Disney Concert hall and also art museum). Bit of a walk into old LA where there are good value diners. Room good quality and comfortable. WiFi costs unless you sign up as "regular user" (or something like that) Good table d'hote dinner. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rpt319
Reviews.Content: I just got back from this hotel and can't wait to go back. I spent 4 nights here over the US Thanksgiving weekend and have nothing but great things to say about it. I had signed up for their Loyalty Program and what a great idea that is. Right from the word go, they make you feel special. I arrived on Friday after a long flight and dealing with LA traffic to get down to the hotel. I pulled my rental vehicle into the driveway in front of the hotel and immediately a bellman came over and helped with my luggage. They have mandatory valet parking here, so I gave him the keys to my rental and was handed a ticket in return and off he went. I went inside to the front desk to check in. I mentioned my name and the front desk clerk looked me up and said since you were a Loyalty Member and we had your credit card on file it is done. The cards were sitting there in alphabetical order just grab it and go. Some people might hate this, but this was fantastic to me. I always hate standing there with my luggage for 20 minutes being checked in. A nice little bonus, the front desk appeared to have an elevator button as there was an elevator waiting for me with the door open. No waiting at all. This little thing with the elevator happened everytime I returned to the hotel. I found that to be the cherry on top of their service. The room itself was one of the nicest I have ever been in. I travel quite a bit for business and have never stayed in such a nice hotel. The room is quite large and features a flat screen LCD TV, granted they do not have HD channels in the rooms, but this is an improvement over many hotels that still have the old tube TVs. The view is great of downtown, I faced South Grand Avenue and had a great view of the MOCA, Disney Concert Hall and the towers on Grand. I love giant office towers and big city downtowns, so this was great for me. The bed was amongst the most comfortable I have ever had in a hotel. I actually had a great sleep, which is usually the problem when I travel. The bathroom was big and spacious and actually has a walk-in shower stall and a bathtub. Would be great if I had been traveling with other people and needed to use both. The perks of the Loyalty program are great too. It gives you free Wi-Fi, which if you don't have the Loyalty program cost you $9.95/day. In addition, it also gives you complimentary morning beverage service. You can opt for tea, coffee, juice or soda. They give you a little card that you fill out and hang on your doorknob by 2 AM. You can specify the time you want it delivered and whether you want them to knock and leave it outside your door or serve it in your room. I opted to use them as an alarm clock and would have them knock and leave it outside the room. The other nice thing is that they allow you to specify which newspaper they deliver. I had asked for a local paper in my online profile, so they would deliver that day's LA Times and that day's USA Today complimentary. Also, each evening they would deliver two bottles of water to the room as part of the Loyalty Program. Very nice touch. Apparently, the hotel has an outdoor pool and a spa. I didn't seek these out, so I cannot comment on how good or bad they were. I also did not eat specifically in the hotel. I did order room service one night (as the LAPD's chopper was hovering nearby due to the Occupy LA eviction and keeping me awake) and the burger I ordered was fantastic. The hotel is located very centrally in downtown LA and is easy to get to and from. I rarely had any issues finding my way around from the hotel. The local area has a small shopping area in California Plaza, but the majority of things are only open during business hours. There is a convenience store called Famina!! that was decent, it is a Japanese chain that carries your regular US sodas, beers and snacks, but it also carries Japanese snacks. Also, they have fresh Krispy Kreme donuts there every morning. Across the street is the Wells Fargo Building and it has a California Pizza Kitchen in it. In addition, the hotel also has a towncar service that will take you in a 2 mile radius around the hotel. It has limited service to Staples Center, but it gets you across the street from the edge of L.A. Live, so that is good also. Overall, I will return and stay at the Omni next time I am in the Los Angeles area.

Reviews.Title: “High end business travel”
Reviews.Author: GG1620
Reviews.Content: A truly excellent hotel. I booked it because it was within 10 miles of my business meeting in Commerce, and the surrounding area can be a bit dodgy. It was a five-star hotel for a modest premium to the others. No regrets. However, it irks me when hotels nick you for things that should be standard - like internet connection and bottled water. I'm not paying $5 to drink a bottle of Panna water. Could you just supply a bottle of Arrowhead water for free? And, high-speed wireless should be like air-conditioning by now. $40 for parking was steep, too, but this isn't a business overnight hotel, per se. It is a high-end, really nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great bar and a stone's throw from MOCA (Museum of Contemporary Art)”
Reviews.Author: clrWashngton_DC
Reviews.Content: Great rooms--BIG, well furnished, separate walk-in shower, wi-fi, courtesy car to local sites (3 miles)--What more could you want. The Noe bar is definite a place to go. We had a short visit (arrived late, left after lunch) so we did not at Noe--I suspect with missed a treat. We had lunch in the cafe--great curry chicken salad. MOCA (Museum of Contemporary Art) is literally next door. If you enjoy Contemporary Art don't miss it. Back to the Omni, they will bring coffee in the morning to the room--free! Best price I know. They sell Starbucks on the third floor for the addicted--I am more addicted to Starbucks' scones. Noe bar was a real treat...9 ounce glasses of wine! Great outdoor tables--I can spell romance.

Reviews.Title: “Aside from being hustled a little bit, great property!”
Reviews.Author: Boomstar
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 3 nights in various areas of Southern California, the idea was to bid each night on priceline based on the area I was staying. Being in downtown LA before, I was actually hoping to get the Westin property since I`ve been there before and knew what to expect, was a bit disappointed at first when I got this one but after staying here I can easily say that Im happy that I did as this beats the westin in everyway. Just about everything with this hotel was great. Location worked very well with my plans and easy to find. Staff were friendly and the room itself was very clean and up to par as was the whole hotel. As I pulled into this hotel on a Thursday night, I was told parking was $40 (for reference this place charges $40 for parking sun-thr and $20 for parkin fri-sat). As I gave the guy my keys for the car, he told me he would only charge me $20 for the night. Appreciating the good gesture I tipped him $10. Checked out the next day and to no real surprise I was charged the full $40 for the night. As I didnt get the guys name and its clearly posted the costs for parking, I didnt even bother to dispute the charge. Only reason I could come up with why he said he would reduce the parking price was to up his chances of getting a tip, which worked.....but who knows for sure. This is probably the only reason why I`m not giving it a full 5. Either way still a great properly and I look forward to returning one day.

Reviews.Title: “Especially if the company is financing stay”
Reviews.Author: smarteconomist
Reviews.Content: Moderately hi-priced modern 17-story on Bunker Hill. Muted pleasing Japanese/Art Deco eclectic styling. Targets expense accounts, Asian visitors, and splurging romantics. PROS: walk to Arts Center, MOCA, Court Complex (on a nice day.) Attentive staff. Make 1-2 cups of coffee in room. Cafe has classy breakfast. Real valet laundry. Great restaurant for the $$$$. Do not disturb signs work--housekeeping will not insist on coming into your expensive space when you are trying to sleep or you-know. Stay 10 nights get 1 free night in loyalty program. Classy lobby. Always a taxi outside entrance. You know how many concrete buildings run the HVAC so as to give static electric shocks when touching metal, this one does not--a great relief. Free Wi-Fi with loyalty program. Could not hear elevators. Plenty electric outlets for gadgets. CONS: Plays detuned idiosyncratic music in common areas. Somewhat noisy: usual streets of major city's cars and the low E of commerce, corridors are almost all hours filled with vocal staff/guest yakking or machinery (!) sounds, can hear TVs through walls more than expected. Had to ask for bathrobe promised in brochure and nobody even mentioned any "car service." (Fortunately downtown buses are almost free.) Was charged for an Honor Bar item somebody purchased when was out of room in another part of town--of course instantly corrected by desk. Can't say views were of anything except concrete/asphalt/buildings in standard rooms. Business Center costly. Hate to think what parking+tax would run. 2 of 4 lights in room were unlabeled capacitive touch switched, turning down/off when not expected.

Reviews.Title: “what a surprise !”
Reviews.Author: helen s
Reviews.Content: When my travel agent chose this hotel for me, I had no time to read guests' reviews, and hoped for the best. Now I want to move in permanently ! The staff should be made official Ambassadors of Los Angeles, as they all managed to change my previous ho-hum attitude about their city. Everything and more has been said by previous guests, you just can't believe how clean, efficient and welcoming, this hotel is. In particular, I am not one to fuss over the toiletries, but the presentation of these is just beautiful..and where can I buy that facial bar from.. it's absolutely tops! Daniel, the concierge, drew me clear directions for all public transport, and although I am a single older female, I had no qualms about travelling alone from the hotel. I applaud everyone concerned with the Omni, many of whom work very long shifts and remain positive at all times, I recommend this hotel with utmost honesty.

Reviews.Title: “Best of LA”
Reviews.Author: TrvlngAngyl
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed @ the Omni for my first visit to LA. I absolutely love this hotel. It's conveinently located within driving distance to most parts of LA. It's literally footsteps away from MOCA and Disney's Museum, which my 11th floor room had a perfect view of. I received exceptional service throughout the hotel, whether I called for room service, called the front desk and entered/exited the hotel. The restaurant/bar Noe, located on the 3rd floor, is definitely worth a visit. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great service, luxury accommodations and reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay for business or leisure”
Reviews.Author: Ama418
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni Hotel for my first visit to Los Angeles for a work seminar. The service was amazing. They offer a towncar that will take you to several nearby places free of charge. They were able to take us everywhere we needed to go during our stay which saved us A LOT of money. They unfortunatley do not offer service to and from LAX but the towncar is still a great asset. Concierge service was amazing! A man by the name of Daniel was the most helpful concierge I have ever come in contact with. He really helped to make our stay enjoyable and stress free. The others at the desk were also very kind and friendly as well. The rooms were great always clean and fresh when we returned at the end of the day. If I ever need to come to LA again, this is absolutely a hotel that I will stay at. TIP: If you plan to eat at the hotel's restaurant, NOE, be sure to make a reservation in advance!

Reviews.Title: “superb staff, superb room, would stay again and again”
Reviews.Author: jennkk
Reviews.Content: Not our first time in LA, first time at the OMNI - I have nothing but great things to say about the hotel - there is nothing that could have been better, and we wished our stay was longer... Staff are very helpful, approachable and efficient. No problem with check-in/out, etc. Door men deserve a special thank-you/notice - really went out of their way to make sure bags were taken care of, offered extra water bottles for us (very appreciative surprise) during check out, friendly, efficient. Represent the brand very well. Bed was very comfortable, clean, soft, and bathrooms were sleek, modern, and with great shampoos, conditioners, etc. You really felt taken care here. Will and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The room was great but....”
Reviews.Author: xtina0987
Reviews.Content: This is a late review (stayed back in May of this year) but I remember the details because it was a special occasion:) The customer service/billing of this place is horrendous. The boyfriend and I came here after our second date. It was my first time here, but as it was a four star hotel I expected it to be cushy. I purchased the room through Priceline's "name your price" deal, so for the quality I definitely came up on a bargain. Driving around Downtown L.A. sucks. The hotel also didn't have a sign visible from the street so it took me nearly 10 minutes to actually find the place! I was tired and ready to get to the room. Fortunately, there was no line and I was able to get there in minutes. I don't like how the halls are arranged-there weren't signs immediately once you got off the elevator telling which way the rooms were. But once I found it, I was pleasantly surprised. The bed was HUGE and full of pillows, just like I like, the TV was HUGE (flat screen) and the bathroom was HUGE! Walk in shower and tub! I think the walls were soundproof (I hope they were) as I didn't hear noise from other residents...or we could have not been surrounded by anyone. Anyways, our stay was quiet and private, just perfect. I know this hotel had some of their own specials that had late check out-a shame that they don't give it to everyone. We actually got lucky and the front desk guy let us leave later the next day as we had missed the original check out time. Now for the parking situation. I was aware that parking wasn't included in the hotel price. Because my boyfriend and I came in separate cars, I parked in a lot that was half the price of hotel parking and he parked at the hotel. It was $30.00. They don't give you your car back unless you pay first. We paid cash upon check out and were on our way. About 6 months later (October) I get a mysterious $30.00 charge on my bank statement. Confused, I do some research to see where it's from and find that it was from this hotel I had stayed at back in May. I call the hotel to get it straightened out. At first they weren't trying to refund me because they didn't think it was their error. After a few threatening calls, however, they realized they had messed up and refunded my money. It was just an inconvenience and unprofessional to charge me for something I had already paid, and then do it more than 6 months later. If you stay here, be sure to keep receipts, and/or just pay for everything with them (hotel and parking). Or just don't use their parking at all! Save $30

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Nice Rooms, Good Fitness Center”
Reviews.Author: SightSee-ers
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I have developed a prejudice when walking into hotels - one based on experience - that the nicer the lobby the least welcoming the staff will be. So I was a bit on edge when I walked into the Omni -- it looked elegant and sophisticated, so I braced myself to feel less than welcomed. However, I could not have been more wrong. Everyone - from the people behind the desk, to the people controlling the traffic out front - to restaurant - to the bar - to the little shop -to the people cleaning the rooms - to the people working room service -- everyone was welcoming and helpful. Like they were glad I was there and they wanted my stay to be the best it could be. In addition the rooms were clean and comfortable and the fitness center was one of the better ones. And the room service pizza with tomatoes and garlic spinach was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Visit”
Reviews.Author: mrbear
Reviews.Content: I have always been partial to the Omni hotel chain. Properties that I have stayed at have been very pleasant and comfortable. The rooms at the Omni in downtown Los Angeles are a good size and very well appointed. Quiet and extremely clean. While some visitors to LA might not want to stay downtown, the area has undergone a lot of changes. The hotel is only a few minutes from LA Live (Staples Centre, Grammy Museum, Nokia Theatre) and around the corner from the beautiful Disney concern hall. Service was excellent...the only downside is the expense of the valet parking...something that prevails throughout LA. The Omni is a great value for the calibre of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travel v
Reviews.Content: The beds were very confortable and the service was great. It was worth it. I would come back many times. The room service was also delicious.

Reviews.Title: “good option in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: msudlik
Reviews.Content: First time staying at the Omni - or any Omni hotel that I can remember. Check in was quick - room was very very clean and comfortable, and room service was very good. The gym was good too - new and large enough. Only small complaint is I didn't receive the wake up call I ordered - but I was up anyways so it didn't affect me at all. I don't normally stay in this part of LA, but next time I do I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad word to say!”
Reviews.Author: Ziggy20007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in September as part of a road trip. This hotel was excellent from start to finish, the chap checking us in was friendly and helpful. When it was discovered that our travel agent had not changed our stay from 3 nights to 2 (we had paid for 3 up front - grrr) he was as helpful as he could be and offered to comp our breakfast. The room was very good, well appointed and in honour of our anniversary trip - a card, chocolate strawberrys, champagne and water had been left for us. Such a nice treat!! The bed was extremely comfortable and the toiletries of a very good standard. The room was very peacful as a whole, but strangely in the bathroom - you could hear the neightbours... Only downside was lack of local shops/bars on the Friday evening but this is something you have to accept when booking a hotel in the financial district. All in all, a great stay and I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Extreme Make-Offer Pays Off”
Reviews.Author: Art046
Reviews.Content: I had not stayed at the LA Omni for awhile. It actually is an Omni now. Terrific hotel make-over, new "everything" including staff attitude and exemplary service. Disney Concert Hall just down the street which is a treat in itself.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel if you need to stay Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: ajbawa
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Well appointed rooms. Reasonably good food. Downtown LA is not my favorite area but this is a very good option of you need to be there.

Reviews.Title: “Big, comfortable room.”
Reviews.Author: elilip
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni for one night while on business. I found the room to be spacious and well-appointed and the bed was comfortable. Check-in/check-out was quick and easy, and front-desk staff were pleasant. Parking valets were pleasant as well. Room was very clean and had a bathtub as well as a shower stall. The only thing missing was a desk-level outlet to charge computers and other devices. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not very good location”
Reviews.Author: Alsinan
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is nice the conceirge was so helpful, we asked for universal adapter because our phone charger input is different but they didn't have one. The location is not good but they offer you a very good service which is a car drop you any where u want with in a 3 miles and when u finish u can call them to pick you up back to hotel. I would go again but it will not be my first option

Reviews.Title: “Classy, Clean, Safe and Polite”
Reviews.Author: JJDARNELL
Reviews.Content: My title says it all. The hotel is updated and very clean. Bathroom was huge, and beds were VERY comfortable! I was in town for business in the heart of Downtown Los Angeles. This hotel was on the edge of town in a very clean and located on the nicer side of town. (Bunker Hill area I believe) The valet was quick and all the guys working that area were fun and polite. The Bar (NOE') was quite nice. We stopped in to check it out before going out for dinner and stayed there for the evening. Ended up with their hamburger/Fries. Way above the top! Excellent in fact.

Reviews.Title: “HERE "EFFICIENCY" MEANS RUDENESS”
Reviews.Author: Gundisalvus
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for vacation in September because the hotel is close to Disney Hall and LA Opera. Big mistake. This hotel is not for leisure travelers. When I dialed 0 for a service request, the woman hanged up on me several times before I could open my mouth. After I could yell "don't cut me off", her answer was "I just want to be efficient". So here "efficiency" borders on rudeness, and it seems to work only in one direction. The first day, I noticed that my safe was unattached to the wall so that anybody could take it away. It was 1pm and I had to leave immediately for a tour. I called to request them to fix the problem. 20 minutes passed and nobody came. I called again, and she said that the maintenance guy was busy with another job. Give me then another room I said, I need to leave now. "Wait until 3 pm", she said. Finally the guy came and seemed surprised by my request: "nobody is going to steal anything here" he said. So much for their "efficiency" toward guests' requests. Noise insulation is poor and noise travels easily from room to room. I was kept asleep several times by the periodic clunk of a medical device in the next room.
