I'll thank only the waitress in the Cafe (thank you Amy) and the maids. They were nice and helpful. But I'll not stay in this hotel next time in LA.

Reviews.Title: “First Class...”
Reviews.Author: cheekychopz
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my wife on a stop over before we headed off on highway 1. The service was excellent. The staff were very professional. As we were celebrating our anniversary they even sent up to the room a bottle of champagne and a fruit and cheese board. Very nice touch. I would not hesitate staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Emmy weekend celebration”
Reviews.Author: CanadaSunshine58
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the omni hotel for 4 days celebrating a friends 50th birthday. it was the weekend of the emmys and although it was very busy everywhere, we had superb service both in the hotel and restaurant. The bed was wonderful, king size and very comfortable. Location was easy to get to anywhere. staff were professional and eager to please.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Hildakay
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights 16th & 17th September - would highly recommend it. Beautiful room with everything you could possibly want. Very clean, quiet, comfortable and luxurious. Helpful and friendly staff including courtesy car. Downtown is a good area to be in with good bus and tube connections. Had no problems getting about day or night. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel and the area its in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: ShutterbugTraveler
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived we encountered nothing but experienced, friendly, customer-focused staff. From the valet to the servers in the lounge to the front desk, everyone had a smile and did what they could to make us feel comfortable and be helpful. One specific instance was that we had purchased tickets online to a Kings game and needed to print them out. Rather than paying for more business office time than we would ever need, I was able to foward the file to the front desk and they printed it for me without a charge. Another example is that the valet went out of his way to give us specific walking instructions to a restaurant, even though he wasn't as familiar with it himself. We not only didn't encounter any less-than-friendly staff, we didn't even encounter anyone who didn't seem to genuinely enjoy their jobs. Having stayed an a lot of hotels, worldwide, I have to say it was sincerely impressive. Beyond the excellent customer service,the room was very comfortable, clean and updated. If you join the loyalty program you receive free wifi and free drinks in the morning (coffee, OJ, milk, etc.) which was nice. The parking rate was standard for downtown LA. The only real detractor from this property is that there's nothing close to it that is open after 7pm. We arrived late and wanted something quick to eat, but there was nothing around. We ended up in the lounge for a quick bite. This is a great property if you are in town for a sporting event or something at the Disney theater or for any business in downtown LA. It was accessible to Hollywood and the surrounding areas, as well, but not in the middle of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Pricey Parking”
Reviews.Author: KoKonutGirl
Reviews.Content: Very nice location if you need to be downtown. There's no place walkable to dine after dark. We stayed in the "13 series" room and loved it because it's a corner room and it was close to both ice and elevator. The rooms were clean and quiet. Bathroom has both tub and shower stall. The young man the checked us in was friendly and professional and assured me my 2 reservations ( I had to add an additional night under another conf #) would be linked together with no break. After two nights, we got locked out on the 3rd additional night. On top of which they charged me for another room night (which I had already prepaid) for a price that was considerably less than what I had prepaid. Everything got straightened out to my satisfaction. Parking is pricey. It's listed as $30 which is on the higher side of average but that's the weekend rate. The weekday rate is $10 more! Like another reviewer wrote, this hotel can be pricey but you can sometimes get a good price depending on when you book. Join their preferred club and you get free wifi and morning beverage delivered to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great luxury hotel in downtown location”
Reviews.Author: GGW135
Reviews.Content: Easily accessible to trains, buses, car rentals, banks, museum, Disney Arts Center, LA Times. We stayed in their "35 Series" room and loved it, (the rooms on each floor that end in 35, e.g. 1435). The staff is ultimately professional and friendly. Nice city view, sunny rooms, great restaurants. Central to greater LA north or south. Why pay triple to stay in Malibu?

Reviews.Title: “Not grand, but very nice, efficient and affordable.”
Reviews.Author: SantafeSlim
Reviews.Content: As the business I visit is almost next door, I choose to stay at the Omni. The rooms have recently been redone. The restaurants are quite good. The staff is extremely efficient. You are adjacent to MOCA, and a block from Disney Hall and REDCAT. This is a great value if you need to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: tlovestravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni LA at California Plaza for the second time in 2 months. The location was very convenient to USC. We've now stayed at four different hotels in downtown LA, and the courtesy and efficiency of the hotel staff has far exceeded the other three. We were looking for a nice hotel to return to for our frequent visits to the area and have found it at the Omni!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KarinaGerman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two days. The room was spacious and clean. The staff was nice and helpful. They even have a shuttle which takes you everywhere in a 3 miles radius. Also, they have a huge variety of hygiene products in the rooms. Amazing time

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in downtown”
Reviews.Author: mad.nomad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights during our recent holiday. Most of the TA comments from others are all correct. I booked it based on those and was not disappointed.Make sure you become Omni Select member. You get free wireless and many other small perks. Free coffee/juice and newspaper in the morning as a room service was nice. The rooms are very nice and well decorated. Separate bath and a shower. Let me mention a couple of downsides. The pool is small and outdoor and has saline water. If you go there in the evening, after the sunlight has gone from the pool, it can be very windy. Also no real changing room there. The valet parking is compulsory and costs $40/night during the week. We looked for an alternative parking but most of the parking around is open space and closed after 7 pm. I suggest you use the valet parking. The concert hall and the arts museum are just next door and the plaza behind has lots of restaurants and free music concerts at night. ( not to everybody's taste of music though). The hotel is located very close to freeway and Universal studios and Hollywood are very easily commutable by car. On the whole our stay was really memorable and my adolescent boys had a whale of a time there!

Reviews.Title: “Not as Impressive as I thought it would be”
Reviews.Author: soloTravellerGirl
Reviews.Content: I only spent one night here before i left for San Francisco. I flew from Australia to Los Angeles, I was able to check-in early. The reception guy Dingo was really nice and helpful! The room was large and spacious. The bed was fanstastic and soft. Upon arrival my room was quite stuffy and hot. The air con wasn't left on. I didn't use any of the pool/gym facilities but i did get room service. I had a pizza and a cheesecake... it was tasty. There was a function and from my room you could hear the noise from my room. I don't know I think I was just expecting more and wasn't super impressed. Although the car was service was a bonus the next morning- it took me to union station but as roberto my driver told me that I could have rung the hotel and they would have picked me up from union station as well. Too bad they didn't mention that when i made the booking. It was a nice place but I don't know if I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Large, quiet comfortable room, a great value (if you don't count the parking fee)”
Reviews.Author: dcbird
Reviews.Content: There was a lot to like about the Omni Los Angeles. We booked it because we got a very good deal on Hotels.com -- although the $40 per day parking fee somewhat took away from the bargain aspect. Still, we realize we got a 5-star hotel room at a 3- or even a 2-star rate. And any downtown hotel would have charged us a similar fee for parking. We had a beautiful view of the plaza from the 8th floor. While we loved the room, and felt the hotel staff members were nice and helpful, we do want to note that the hotel isn't the best choice for people who like to wander around a city on foot. We realize now that the downtown area is not the kind of place where people wander out at night and randomly select a restaurant for dinner. The front desk recommended a few places, but advised us to use the free hotel car that will transport guests anywhere within a 3 mile radius. We felt like walking, although in retrospect, should have taken the car. But hey, it's LA, and we should have thought more carefully about that before we booked. (And should have stayed in Westwood, if we wanted to do a lot of walking around). A lot of nearby restaurants were lunch only and closed in the evenings. As far as nearby tourist attractions, you have the Museum of Contemporary Art and the Disney Concert Hall (spectacular). So my recommendation is if you want a large comfortable room and have a way to get around beyond downtown, this hotel is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: acmorris
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Omni for a night when our building's central air conditioner was broken. Overall, we really liked this hotel. :) This hotel has a long list of pros: + WONDERFUL sound insulation from the street. There was no traffic, no concert sound, no sound at all coming from the outside. + The rooms are in good condition. Maybe a little dated, but spotless nonetheless. + The beds are comfy. + The restaurants are good (we've been there separate times). They are extremely popular during the week, but + Free juice | coffee in the morning, free paper, etc. Lots of attention to detail, high marks here. The only downside to our whole visit was really our mistake; we forgot to specify that we didn't want an adjoining room. As a result, and some inconsiderate loud teenagers yelled a long time and ordered room service. Our room smelled like burgers around 2am. =\ However, this wasn't the hotel's fault. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexJeffery
Reviews.Content: Omni hotel is an amazing hotel with excellent service, you can really tell the staff are all willing to go that extra mile to make there guests happy. No complaints whatsoever! However as i am only 21 and went with 8 friends of the same age, the location was not great for what we wanted from our stay in LA, which ment we had to get cabs pretty much everywer, recommend anyone looking for the nightlife of los angeles to stay in santa monica.

Reviews.Title: “I give this 4-star hotel FIVE stars”
Reviews.Author: Lori M
Reviews.Content: For travelers not afraid to drive in Los Angeles, this is a best bet hotel! Perfectly quiet at night, steps away from the Museum of Contemporary Art and the Gehry-designed Disney Concert Hall. If you are there on a Saturday, take an LA Conservancy walking tour of downtown. Walk out of the hotel and take the Angel's Flight railway (twenty five cents each way.) The hotel has valet parking with in and out privileges - the nicest valets anywhere (who put fresh bottles of water in the car!) yes, you have to pay for parking, but whre don't you? Anyway, hop in your car and you are 10 minutes from Hollywood, museums, or Dodger Stadium. Take a longer drive and get to the Huntington Library in Pasadena. Santa Monica and Venice are 20 minutes away, less at off hours. The staff at the Omni Los Angeles is impeccable; pleasant, helpful and always ready to guide you to your destination. My main point, great hotel that is centrally located with amazing staff. Grand Cafe has a great breakfast buffet that will keep you full all day. Excellent fitness center, small but tidy pool. Housekeeping responded to my requests instantly. The newly renovated rooms are quite tasteful, brand new bed was super comfortable, and the AC worked easily and quickly. The desk was plenty big, outlets aplenty at the desk and near the bed. Select Guest members get free wifi and free morning beverage service (and it is free to sign up!) I recommended the hotel to friends attending the same event and they were well pleased. I loved my stay, I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: debnath
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. The hotel is near to the MOCA (Museum of Contemporary Art), Walt Disney Concert Hall, and the City Hall.It is about 15 mins drive to Hollywood and 10 mins drive to Universal Studios. However, the hotel appeared to be more suitable for business travellers .Parking is very expensive at the hotel. Try to park at one of many parking garages nearby. The rooms are OK .

Reviews.Title: “Class, elegance and style in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: yoginimichele
Reviews.Content: Took my niece and her cousin here for a belated 16th birthday present. Opted for the Omni because, well, I had points accrued and it was a freebie. The girls LOVED it! We were upgraded into an adjoining suite which gave the girls the feel as if they had their own hotel room. Since I enjoy such a nice level with Omni Select Guest, one night we were regaled with a dessert tray which was both visually exquisite and delicious. The rooms were large, comfortable and the bathroom amenties fantastic. The service, which I have come to expect from Omnis in general, was impeccable. Although this is a downtown hotel and not, say, beachside, it still provides a central starting point to all of Los Angeles neighborhoods because of the direct connect to the major freeways. The Omni Los Angeles at California Plaze was a treat. I would stay there again in a heartbeat. It is particularly convenient if you are doing to do anything Staple Center or LA Convention Center oriented. It is close enough but also a comfortable distance so as not to be disturbed by crowd noise, etc. Loved it....my niece and her cousin STILL talk about it!

Reviews.Title: “Kid Friendly !!”
Reviews.Author: Big_BroLeuven
Reviews.Content: We had a very warm welcome at the reception desk and were offered a choice of rooms due to the fact that a summer concert was to perform that evening on California Plaza : If we would like a quiet night after our intercontinental flight they would be more than happy to relocate us to another room. We loved this attention to detail. The breakfast buffet was very elaborate with an extensive choice and an egg/waffle cooking station. The restaurant staff is very friendly and helpfull. A complimentary courtesy car is offered on a first-come first-served base for rides in the immediate vicinity (+/- 5 miles), which comes in handy for restaurant visits in the area. Just a minor glitch : the helpfullness/friendliness of the valet parking staff (who also manage the courtesy car service) is very much based on the amount of (initial) tipping they receive. This adds another 25% to the already expensive valet parking service ($40 weekdays/ $20 Weekend nights). A blamage for this otherwise great hotel. The pool area is rather small and mostly shaded with surrounding views of the residential buildings, which doesn't really contribute to your privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, not so nice for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Jeannette2000
Reviews.Content: Upon entering a beautiful hotel. Nice people, nice hotel bar. Probably perfect for the business traveler. For families on vacation some disadvantages: the beds are too small to sleep in with 2 people and they wiggle. If one turns around, the other person is shaking in the bed. This was somewhat resolved with a wooden board under the mattress, after we had complained about it, but it still did not sleep really well. The location is not optimal, outside the tourist center, so you miss the fun and have to go looking for attractions. With the car all within 15 to 20 minutes. The neighborhood east of Broadway, a few blocks away, is not really good. The Parking (valet) is expensive, $ 40 per 24 hours and $ 20 on weekends. We have looked for a cheaper parking nearby, but when the owner of one of the car parks recommended to not leave the car after 11 hours at night, we kept in the valet parking. It is very quiet, even at night and the mall next to it is convenient and there are some nice restaurants. The pool is small and shallow and is much in the shade. We did not use it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families and tourists”
Reviews.Author: tlh02
Reviews.Content: My family of four, which included 2 young daughters, stayed in LA for a weekend in mid August. We were looking for a quiet location that was close to Dodger's Stadium and also Universal Studios. The Omni was a perfect choice. We were only a 12 minute drive to the Dodger's game and a 20 minute drive on a Sunday morning to Universal. Hollywood was only 20 minutes away in traffic. We requested and received connecting rooms. The rooms were very large, with comfortable, beautifully decorated furnishings. The bathroom was also an impressive size. What impressed us about the hotel besides the cleanliness and accommodations was the service. The desk clerk was very helpful, the valet staff was fast and friendly, and the cleaning staff did a nice job as well. I can see why tourists would be skeptical about staying in downtown LA. While it's not in the trendiest part of town, the Omni offers a great rate and is close to the airport and major highways. The downtown area can feel empty on the weekends but restaurants are opened and we were able to find places to satisfy us as well as the children. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni has been revamped and upgraded decor since my last stay, while the once bleak location offers many more activities fro”
Reviews.Author: dv8r
Reviews.Content: I was hoping to get the Westin Bonaventure as a Priceline bid, and the Omni was where I ended up. It turned out to be a blessing in disguise. I noticed a great deal of minor improvements in the decor + amenities, and helpful staff and free Starbucks coffee available in the lobby helps a 6am departure along. The neighborhood around the hotel was way more poppin' on a Friday night than a couple years ago as well. Not only was there the Disney Concert Hall, but free live performances at the California Plaza, and a couple punky dive bars just down the hill. Aside from the once lonely California Pizza Kitchen nearby, the food choices were better, ranging from hipster restaurants with outdoor cocktails, Asian to Pizza.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Accommodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: Celicia
Reviews.Content: The Omni at California Plaza is conveniently located downtown L.A. only a few minutes from the Staples Center. The rooms are spacious and clean. The hotel has a nice aroma when you walk in and is beautifully decorated. In the lobby there's always fruit infused water and apples for the guest. The concierge is great at recommending nearby restaurants and activities. The hotel even offers a car service to take you anywhere in the nearby area free of charge. Parking at the hotel is very expensive. You can park a block away for half the price, however most lots do not offer overnight parking and then you must find street parking, which we didnâ€™t' have a problem doing. My only complaint would be the bathrooms do not have vents. The mirror fogged and the bathroom became very hot every time I showered. However, I did love that the shower and tub was separate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent downtown hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: tastefirst
Reviews.Content: There are quite a few hotel choices in downtown LA for business. We decided on Omni for longer-term business accommodations and we are glad we did. While the rooms are not technologically on the cutting edge, they are quite spacious nicely decorated and very well furnished. Service has been quite reliable and friendly so far. The hotel restaurant, Noe, is quite good for a hotel restaurant, and we like the indoor/outdoor bar (especially outdoors, around a little fire to take the chill out at night). The gym is well stocked with new machines. We appreciate the proximity to California Plaza, which has nice gardens and an open-space concert area. There are abundant restaurants for all pockets in the area, a museum (MOCA) and the Symphony. It's far from the "happening" areas, but we found those areas as devoid of people as the rest of LA. Overall, OMNI LA is an excellent business choice for downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Great location”
Reviews.Author: rpmotocross
Reviews.Content: Very happy with our stay. Nice rooms. Beautiful hotel. Great location. Complaints were: AC did not remove humidity in room and as a result the room felt clammy. Parking mid week is horribly expensive. Half as much on weekends. Also I hate bathrooms with no ceiling vent/fan. Steamy shower added to the already "moist" room. Minor complaints. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and quiet, but not quite suitable for families with children.”
Reviews.Author: adventurersCumbria Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: It would have been good to have some information on local places to visit and restaurants in the room. The hotel had a restaurant but it wasnt very child friendly food wise. We ended up walking the streets to find a more suitable venue to eat in.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it !”
Reviews.Author: suejanethomas
Reviews.Content: The Omni style was definitely complimented by the helpful staff. Our corner positioned room was fantastic; a rollaway bed not limiting the spaciousness or the lovely 'feel' of the room. A welcome to return to after busy days around LAX with my 2 teenagers. We caught the local bus ( I think # 14 ) to the end of the route for shopping - not in the main centre but across at the great value/finds to be hunted through - at Nordstrom Rack, Ross dress for less ( extra suitcase purchase a steal ) Navy etc. The Omni provides transport (to 3kms) to restaurants & local spots. Conciege great value even searching internet for our request to find less commercial areas sought by my son. Close to Station with 24/7 bus transport to the Airport if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Not much to do”
Reviews.Author: schnjf
Reviews.Content: I traveled to LA on business and stayed at the Omni. The hotel was ok overall. There wasn't much to do in the surrounding area. I wouldn't recommend eating at the hotel's restaurant. Very expensive with mediocre food. Instead, head to the second floor of the hotel and walk to the "back" of the hotel. Cross the street (I think you'll be crossing Grand Street) and head to the building that has the McDonalds and California Pizza Kitchen in it. Lots to eat and great people watching. The Museum of Contemporary Art nearest to the hotel is a waste of time. No good artists on display. You're not too far from Chinatown and it's a nice walk. It's safe during the day for a woman who is alone. Great deals on clothes! If you have time, take a bus that offers tours around the downtown area. Start early. It's worth the $35. The bus does go into Hollywood where you can get on the next bus and tour Beverly Hills and Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Solid location for business trip to Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: GShermanWong
Reviews.Content: If you have to do business in the downtown LA area, this is a solid choice. Rooms are clean and pretty basic... Beds were comfortable and bathroom was decent. To me, this is more about the location. I do like this spot better than some of the other downtown LA sites (Bonaventure, Biltmore)... Although some would say the area is too dead... To me, it's tucked away a bit, so it's a little quieter and calmer. Plus, you have still have access to some of the restuarants and cafes in the downtown area. California Plaza has good choices during the day -- ranging from a salad and Starbucks to high-end sandwiches at Mendocino Farms... For business dining - Nick and Stef's and Water Grill are walking distances... MoCA is right next door for art lovers - and Music Center and Disney Hall are right down the street as well... Short cab ride will get you to LALive... For the more adventurous, you can check out the slightly seedy, but trendy spots on Main Street and Spring Street. All in all, a good, central spot if you are doing business downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Not the place for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: Sedins
Reviews.Content: I got a good deal for this hotel so I gave it a try. Lets start with some of the positives: -downtown, so short commute if you work in the area -courteous staff Issues -LOCATION: not near any of the big tourists locations (except the disney hall which was definitely worth seeing) -expensive parking ($20-40), but there are some cheaper alternatives in the area -nothing is open at night in the neighbourhood -not exactly safe to walk around (huge homeless issue downtown) a side note: wifi is 10 dollars a day, but its free if you sign up as a free member. that is exactly what i did, but they still charged me for 5 days anyways. I am still waiting for a refund, so i would confirm the membership before using it Its not a bad hotel by any means but i would recommend something by hollywood or beverly hills

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay near downtown Los Angeles. We will return.”
Reviews.Author: Karen52024
Reviews.Content: The premises are lovely; lots of art. Situated in California Plaza next to Museum of Contemporary Art and a couple of blocks from the beautiful Disney concert center. The room was clean and comfortable. Window that opened. Staff were competent, helpful, and friendly. I judge hotels partially by how happy the staff seem to be - this place wins in that area. The restaurant Noe had a great piano player/singer performing and the food was good. Lovely cocktail lounge.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pobol
Reviews.Content: we had an excellent stay here, great rooms and staff, lovely food, excellent location right next to MOCA

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - great central location”
Reviews.Author: L52094
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best on our 9 day trip. I think it's fine for tourists that have rental cars, it's a central location so easy (if no traffic) to get all around the great expanse that is LA. Went for the X Games at the Staples center and this place couldn't be beat. Just far enough from the crowds at LA Live, but close enough to use the hotel's free car. The room was clean and modern. The bed was very comfy. Loved the bathroom too. I have absolutely no complaints and I'm pretty picky. If we ever return to LA, this will be our hotel of choice! Thanks OMNI!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Hotel, Good Area”
Reviews.Author: Kik2kik
Reviews.Content: This review is to recommend the hotel, which is a very nice hotel (it seems brand new) and to commend the staff which are excellent. We arrived at 1PM and were given a late checkout as well, the staff were helpful, fantastic in so many ways that I can't really describe except to say that we were completely jet-lagged (coming from Japan), we had a car service that screwed up an they helped us, and we were cranky and they were understanding. It's a great hotel with great people, another Omni success, keeps us coming back to this brand above all the rest. Only negative is that the area is downtown... Come to find out that isn't really near anything you want.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Debbiestravels
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in almost all of the downtown hotels ... the Omni is def. one of my top choices. Pool, gym, beautiful rooms, I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good city hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: Burywood
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the last leg of our California holiday. It turned out to be better than we thought and the beds were very comfortable and the room a good size (for two adults and two kids). Lovely bathroom with probably the best shower I have ever been in. We got a bit caught out by the fact that there was nowhere to eat or drink in the hotel until 3pm in the afternoon, which meant we had to venture into downtown LA to find lunch (which turned out well in the end, but more by luck).

Reviews.Title: “Very good services, great room, excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: FrenchRiviera06
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff, very good location, beautiful hotel and room, very clean, thanks! The hotel is well located in Downtown area & very good value for money. Free internet in lobby and room. We found it was within walking distance of some shops, and we were given a map and clear instructions by the front of house staff. It is a fantastic hotel, and worth a detour if you are in Los Angeles. They also gave us complimentary juice/ bed tea/coffee in the morning delivered to your room at your choice of time.

Reviews.Title: “courtesy car awesome, nice hotel, not a good location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: vanessa m
Reviews.Content: this was a nice hotel spacious room and bathroom, clean, comfy and well decorated. loved the courtesy car shuttle which will bring you within 3 miles, we went to LA LIVE staples centre and they dropped us off 1 block away and called after dinner for a ride back which was fantastic we walked about 3-4 blocks to the subway which was very convenient (1.50$ one way or 5$ a day) and brought us to Hollywood/highland where all the Tours departed and where the action was If you are planning on doing Touristy things I would not recommend downtown LA area unless you have a car. either stay in West Hollywood, LA LIVE or Santa Monica for the beach. although this part of downtown felt safe and clean I felt we were out of the way to come back and there was nothing to do at night the buses seem to be frequent, so if you don't have a car do some research ahead of time on bus routes and the metro as we didn't see much info and had to try and figure out the maps and destinations

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bchood
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night on our cross-country drive. This is a huge hotel, but very nice. We were tired from our drive so we stayed in the room most of the time. The rooms are spacious and nicely decorated, and the bathroom was very clean. We had our small dog with us and walked him around the area, but there is not a lot of green space around the hotel for dogs. We ordered room service for dinner which was very yummy. Overall a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: oliviaroses
Reviews.Content: I love staying at the Omni hotels. Our room was beautiful, clean and roomy.The service was top notch. The pool was great too. A good location in LA and you can walk to Little Tokoyo if you like. I would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love LA”
Reviews.Author: OZ2020
Reviews.Content: As a first time visitor to LA I was pleasantly surprised tith the level of service and comfort from this hotel. Even though I rented a car, I also took advantage of the Subway which is about a block away. I can't wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome !! Great hotel in Downtown...... Super stay!!”
Reviews.Author: REDCARPETINDIA
Reviews.Content: Unlike most american hotel... we were pleasantly surprised with a huge room. I being a Travel Agent from India looked & judged any hotel pretty sharply. But this hotel exceed our expected. We managed an early check in. The lobby is huge. The hotel is well located in Downtown area & very good value for money. We stayed there for 3 nights & loved it. Though I feel as a tourist all action is towards santa monica & venice beach which is 1 hr from direct bus from this hotel. Free internet in lobby... & may be room if you are lucky............. The hotel is uphill & climbing up & Down can be a challenge but this hotel has an awesome service of Complimentary pick & Drop within 3 kms of the hotel. Which is like WOW.....!!!! They also gave us complimentary juice/ bed tea/coffee in the morning... all delivered to your room at your choice of time......... WOW ... WOW...!!! (these innovative services made this hotel stay really amazing).............. GO for it.....! No Second thoughts..............

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: JakeKennedy
Reviews.Content: Loved it had a great experience - really enjoyed the staff and the great lengths they take to make you feel at home

Reviews.Title: “Pampered by the Omni”
Reviews.Author: HikaruDragon
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here during Anime Expo 2011, as this was one of the top-rated hotels giving a convention discount. We were fortunate to be upgraded to a Club Level room on the 16th floor with access to the lounge on the 17th. The breakfasts and cocktail hour that are included with the Club Level rooms were so bountiful that we were able to skip some meals. We enjoyed the view of the Disney Concert Hall and California Plaza from the top floor, especially in the evening. If you're tired of restaurant food, the Grand Central Market is within walking distance, providing a wide variety of fresh produce, as well as stalls touting a variety of ethnic meals at a decent price. Quite by accident, I stumbled upon the Farmacia y Botanica Million Dollar AKA the Million Dollar Pharmacy @ 301 S. Broadway. Since visiting pharmacies and grocery stores are my favorite shopping spots while on vacation, I had to stop in at this most unusual pharmacy. If you are looking for candles, oils and sprays to bring back lost loves, lost money or good luck, you are in the right place! Back to the Omni--what I most appreciated was the friendly and helpful staff. Despite the crazy cosplay costumes, we were treated as honored guests from the bell staff at the front doors to Jose in the lounge on the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate to stay downtown”
Reviews.Author: Albina75
Reviews.Content: I was a little upset about the location of the hotel, when I did the reservation, but considering the promotional prices for the 4th of july holidays, we decided to stay there. The club floor is worth every dollar you pay. Fantastic ! At the end of the afternoon, drinks and appetizers and the most kind hostess making the end of the day just perfect for a tired tourist! rooms are large, confortable and very clean. If you have a car to drive around, do not hesitate to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was a tonic for tired travellers.”
Reviews.Author: E_C_S55
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first night of our holiday in California; arriving jet lagged and tired. The first impression the hotel gives was a tonic, and it was followed up by friendly desk staff and an impressive room with 2 enormous, comfortable beds. The bathroom was a great size. We had a fantastic view of downtown from the floor to ceiling windows, and we all spent a large proportion of the night enjoying this as our body clocks were still on GMT. I appreciated the extra touches in the bathroom, such as good lighting and mirrors, and lots of soap, shampoos and conditioners. There were lots of fluffy, white towels for the 4 of us to use. We stayed one night and did not use any of the other hotel facilities. We found it was within walking distance of some shops for the provisions that we needed, and we were given a local map and clear instructions by the front of house staff. Next morning we walked to catch the Amtrak service to Santa Barbara, and must recommend Union Station to all travellers. It is a fantastic building, and worth a detour if you are in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, bad location and untrained staff”
Reviews.Author: HassanJuma
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 8 nights in July 2011. The rooms are nice however the house keeping, Concierge services need lots of improvment. Staff are not motivated and they lack training and procedures. In couple of instances they were having heated arguments in front of the guests. It is unlikely that we will stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: toonces47
Reviews.Content: Beautiful contemporary rooms with comfy beds. Lovely service. Decent room service, with California Plaza and Grand Central Market right there for loads of food options. An oasis in LA's Downtown. Their internet rates often are quite reasonable too. My only criticism is that parking is exorbitantly expensive. Avoid a car and use their shuttle service if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LPir
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Omni for 4 nights and then another 3 nights in July. Beautiful hotel; extremely clean. the location is a bit off from downtown and main attractions however this also ensures the quiteness. No problem if you have a car. The front desk was very helpful; though they made some mistakes which were corrected immediately after reminding. The rooms are excellent amd the beds are extremely comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest hotel experience.”
Reviews.Author: tennisfanVail_CO
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems nice when you first walk into the lobby. The check-in process was efficient, and the agents at the front desk couldn't have been nicer. Then we got to the room, and realized the hotel is just.....not really that nice. The double/full size beds were so soft and pillows were so worn out and thin that I woke up with a sore neck and back the next day. The water pressure in the shower was a joke. The restaurant wasn't serving their normal menu when we got down to it (8:30pm on a Sunday), just some terrible-sounding "meatloaf n mashies" family-style deal. The only way we found that out was by reading a chalkboard, because there wasn't anyone there to greet us. After waiting for about three minutes, we walked out to talk to the concierge about other restaurants in the area, and got a reply of "Hmmm, well, ya know, almost everything will be closed, except this 20th floor sushi restaurant on top of an office building about 20 blocks away." We bailed on that idea, walked about 4 blocks west to discover that restaurants do actually still serve meals at 9pm in downtown LA (imagine that, largest city in CA and all!). So, overall, not impressed with the place.

Reviews.Title: “Very sophisticated hotel for travellers with business events in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: AlfiaNN
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, pretty close to all major business offices and convention center. Absolutely adequate for business travellers in downtown LA.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Great value”
Reviews.Author: CamLovesSun
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for my 6 day trip and the whole hotel just smells so good!, I loved my Club room on 16th floor, loved the breakfast and evening cocktails served in the Club room and loved the flavoured water in the lobby. I was travelling alone but visiting friends, originally I was a little worried that the location would be too far out for me as I was mainly in the Beverly Hills/West Hollywood area however it was fine. I had a car and the times I was travelling I experienced no traffic. It did not feel like an effort or too out the way at all. The room, bed, bathroom, and service were all perfect I have not a bad word to say. The wifi is free if you signed up to the select guest program which I recommend as its free to do so! Otherwise I think it is $15 per day. The valet parking is a little steep at $30 per night but I think that is pretty much the same for most LA hotels. It was a fantastic trip, great value for money and I would definitely stay again on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ventura11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni Los Angeles this past weekend, and it was amazing. Our room wasn't ready when we got there at 2:30, but we walked next door to the MOCA and entertained ourselves for an hour until they called us. Our luggage was stored at the front desk, and then later sent to the room. Had a corner room...so nice! Beautifully appointed, huge bathroom, soothing decor, and comfy beds to die for! Got a taxi (the hotel towncar was busy) to a nearby restaurant (Drago's...yum!) for dinner, and then a shuttle from the restaurant to the Ahmanson to see Les Mis. ( Many of the nearby hotels offer shuttle service to the theaters) After the show, we noticed that there wasn't a taxi stand nearby, so we called the hotel, and they sent the towncar to pick us up. I had mentioned that it was my birthday, and when we got back to the hotel around 11:30p.m., we found that in addition to a lovely turndown service, someone had delivered a "Happy Birthday" mini raspberry cheesecake..what a treat! Morning beverage service was right on time, and we were given a late check out of 1pm. Did not use the pool, but it looked wonderful. Breakfast at the cafe was good, and on the weekends, valet parking is only $20. All in all, a wonderful experience...thank you, I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: D_Ross_Bradley
Reviews.Content: Currently on my penultimate day at this hotel of a 4 night stay (waiting for a conference call to start and thought I would right a review). This is a fantastic hotel right in the middle of downtown LA and certainly lives up to its 4 star rating and most certainly not a 4 star price for the location. I am a solo traveller, I started my LA visit in long beach for a conference and did not want to rent a car during my stay downtown as I hate driving in other countries particularly when own my own without a local guide. The hotel itself is very clean, rooms have all the required amenities; - descent wireless - free if you join their reward scheme (which is also free and can be done when your there) - in room safe - which is fundamental for any international traveller but very few hotel in LA seem to have them - a proper power shower (not a stupid bath/shower low power thing), a bath as well - maybe I was on a "quiet floor" but I never heard any noise from the adjoining rooms or hallway. - high taste/standard of food in the restaurant - Starbucks in the hotel on the 3rd floor, which is always good - All the staff are super friendly and very polite - from the reception, concierge to cleaning crew. The hotel and surrounding area feels very safe at night with a high visibility of security staff - not sure if these are hotel security or from the california plaza in which the hotel is located. Some eateries located on the plaza just outside the hotel, during the weekend there was some live bands in the plaza which was great and quite a diverse sound on each of the nights. Also the angels flights which is pretty impressive is located on the plaza and worth checking out - particularly if you have read the book by Michael Connelly. One of the friendly staff pointed out the bench from 500 days of summer which is visible from the hotel ( haven't seen the movie so I don't know if this is a big deal or not) Walt disney concert hall is visible from all rooms on one side of the hotel (2 min walk) and the museum of contemporary art is just outside the hotel plaza entrance - worth checking out even if you are not an art guru. This hotel is a 2 minute walk from the civic centre metro (red line) - which is a great way to check out many of the sites without a car - which is not required. I was staying at the Hilton Long Beach for a week before this - good hotel too - but does not rate against this.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in an up and coming area”
Reviews.Author: yankinoz
Reviews.Content: My husband, 13 year old son and I stayed here just a few days ago. I understand that it was recently renovated and it is really lovely. The service here is exceptional - from the ground floor staff to the concierge and others in the Club level lounge to the servers in the Grand Cafe. We were told that the downtown area has improved markedly over the past 5 years. The hotel's proximity to LA Live, the Staples Center, the Disney Concert hall and its next door neighbor, the Museum of Contemporary Art, make it a desireable property. And the fact that it offers a free car service within 3 miles is a real bonus. We stayed on a Club level because it seemed to be great value for money and it turned out to be so. The room and bathroom were very spacious and the bed extremely comfortable. The breakfast at the Club lounge was delicious and more than sufficient and even offered hot food - the french toast was perfect as were the pancakes. The Club lounge was a lovely place to just sit and read the paper in the morning or have a drink in the afternoon. We loved it! The fitness center is an adequate size and had equipment that I like to use. There are elliptical machines, bikes, recumbent bikes and treadmills as well as weight machines and free weights. I would have liked a rowing machine, but I get the sense that rowing machines are not that popular these days in general, so I wasn't entirely surprised or disappointed that there wasn't one there. The one thing that it lacked that I really wished it had was a bigger area for stretching, but everything else made up for this.The pool also isn't enormous, but is a very good size and enjoyable to sit around. Overall, it is a really wonderful property, especially if you have a car so that you can get to places like Hollywood, West Hollywood and Beverly Hills. But, there is a lot to do here as well, as Sunday, the Club Lounge concierge so helpfully pointed out. She also recommended many restaurants near by and we went to El Cholo. Her enthusiasm for the area around the hotel was truly infectious. If you are in LA between May and October, I would highly recommend El Cholo's Green Corn Tamales. I am still dreaming about them, they are to die for!! Thanks Sunday!!

Reviews.Title: “It was a pleasure to stay there... highly recommanded...”
Reviews.Author: Mushu94
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 days while visiting L.A. Front desk: friendly and helpful - possibility to buy some tours, directly at the concierge desk (but it's a bit more expensive than buying tickets directly at the Chinese Theater's Office). Every day, the hotel provides some fruits and aromatised water in the entrance (it's free). Room: modern, clean and quiet. The mattresses were more than comfortableâ€¦ Area: Downtown. A bit far from Hollywood attractions, Sunset Bvd, but quite easy to access by Metro line (Civic Center or Pershing Square station). Tips and tricks: for those who want to use Wi-Fi, it costs around $10/day. But, by enrolling their Select Guest Program (on their website) you can have free Wi-Fi, a bottle of water and some newspapers every day. I enrolled it after my booking but at the front desk, I mentioned the program and give my number, and it was ok. Next time, I will chose this hotel again...

Reviews.Title: “Excepional Room in downtown location”
Reviews.Author: molloygolf
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights when visiting LA. The hotel is located near Pershing Square in downtown LA. The room we had was exceptional and the massive bed was the comfiest ever! The room also boasted a large bathroom, sitting area and big TV, with free newspapers delivered daily. Being a visitor to the city i used the hotels valet parking facility. This service worked fine and the staff very nice, but at $30 per day + tips i felt this was unnecassarily expensive. If returning to LA, i think i would stay at a different hotel which is closer to the tourist features of Hollywood/Beverly Hills. The valet parking fee could be put towards getting a suite in another hotel who provide cheaper/free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: chrisandun
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel and were given a key to the room, we found it had not been cleaned. We returned to the desk and explained the situation in a joking manner. The receptionist was dismayed and upgraded our room immediately. - lucky us! This room was extremely comfortable and tastefully decorated and overlooked the hotel swimming pool. This hotel was elegant and their dining section enjoyable. I would certainly return there. Parking at the hotel was very pricey but, then again, parking in LA is expensive anywhere. Front desk staff were extremely helpful even to the point of printing my boarding pass as I was flying home earlier than my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recomended”
Reviews.Author: kenbut
Reviews.Content: Good location in Plaza in Downtown LA. Friendly staff (mostly) and comfortable rooms. Join loyalty club for free internet and other goodies

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Westin Bonaventure Better”
Reviews.Author: Chringram
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights to celebrate an anniversary - the staff was kind, but it just didn't match up to the time we stayed at the Bonaventure which is also downtown LA.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel superb service”
Reviews.Author: stevekathybithell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni on our honeymoon trip around Califormia We got a nice upgrade when the reception found out it was our honeymoon. The hotel staff were all so efficient and the room service was so quick when we ordered a sandwich. Situayed in the business part of downtown, the hill back to the hotel can be a bit taxing on you legs. The restaraunt meal was great and they had a pianist in the bar area who was very good. We had a good value breakfast one day in the grill room with nice views and plenty to eat and drink. The valet service parking was excellent. All in all a great place in downtown LA

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: caz1950
Reviews.Content: We loved the Omni. The staff were extremely helpful and the concierge went out of his way to help. Our rooms were excellent, clean and spacious. You can have light meals in the bar area and these were excellent and well priced. Breakfast too was excellent. They have a complimentary car that will drop you to shops and restaurants within a 3 mile radius, and then pick you up when you call. This is an amazing service and very much appreciated. Unfortunately my husband left behind a belt and cap and we emailed the hotel within a day or two of leaving, but didn't ever receive a response. This would be the only disappointment from this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: MacBoyPro
Reviews.Content: Words can not begin to express how much I love this hotel, from the free drink service in the morning, to the comfy robe in the closet. The beds are amazing, and the service from ALL the staff members is top notch, everyone greets you with a smile and says "how are you today" Omni hotels has my business where ever I stay on all of my vacation from now on. P.S. Sign up for the free Select Guest program for free wifi in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: UCFGrads
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni LA last week and had a great stay. The hotel is within walking distance to many great attractions including the Museum of Contemporary Art, an outdoor theatre right below the hotel, and some other independent theatres. There are no vending machines in the hotel (?) but there are several restaurants and stores just outside the hotel doors. Little Tokyo and Chinatown are about a mile away. We walked everywhere but the Omni has a courtesy car as well. Friendly staff and concierge service was great. I'd stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Will come back again”
Reviews.Author: margaseg
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, great service. Only stayed for a couple of days but I had a very good overall experience. Booked over the phone and got a very good deal. Parking is 30 dollars but you don't feel bad about it because the valet service is fast and very polite. I never waited more than a couple of minutes. Wish I stayed an extra day to enjoy the spa. Menu was attractive and you can get a 60min massage for 110 dollars If I get another good deal, I will definitely come back to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Hotel and would stay here forever!”
Reviews.Author: ParadiseValey_Ann
Reviews.Content: My business in Los Angeles kept me there for 7 weeks (with a couple of trips home to Phoenix). The staff at the hotel really looks after their guests. They will bring coffee to your room in the morning at the time you want it. They also come around in the afternoon with water and ice. You can request a refrigerator and microwave. The delivery service from the restaurant is fantastic. They have always arrive before they said they would and the dinners have been hot and good. The front desk has very helpful personnel to look after your needs. I had a room without a shower and they immediately sent someone up to move me into a room with a shower (I now have a bathtub and a shower). The beds are extremely comfortable after their remodel. The whole place looks great. They have a conciere that is wonderful and will get you to where you want to go and back again. They also have complimentary ride service within a 3 mile radius, which was enough to get us to the movies and back.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: travler019
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip, to attend a conference in the downtown area. I don't know that I would recommend staying in downtown LA as it's like a half hour drive to most anywhere you'd want to be in LA, but downtown LA does seem to be undergoing a bit of a resurgence and there are some cool places and good restaurants in the vicinity, if you want to explore it. If you are choosing to stay downtown, this hotel was great. Huge rooms, very clean, nice bathroom, fairly quiet (though that really depends on your neighbours.), free, mostly quite good breakfast, nice restaurant attached to the hotel, free wifi, and very helpful and attentive staff. And for all that I thought the price was extremely reasonable. Again, the only downside is it's physical location, as it is not super close to most sites in LA, but it is like a two minute walk to the LA Disney Concert Hall (which is an amazing building), and some cool restaurants/bars in the (not too far) neighbourhood. It is a sketchy area for sure still, and dead for the most part at nights/weekends, given that it is basically in the financial district, but as a hotel I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great view, free drinks, great value!”
Reviews.Author: DTM555
Reviews.Content: Context: 30s professional couple on honeymoon, first time to LA. Rating reflects our expectations for this class/price of hotel. LA is so huge we werenâ€™t sure where to stay so went for downtown as was central. Our travel company booked us a double room, which turned out to be 2 singles, wonâ€™t use them again... (onhotels.com) Hotel staff were polite and gave us alternative options, we went for a king room on the top floor inc breakfast and evening drinks (great selection of beers/spirits) for $40 extra a night, which was an incredible bargain! Room was clean and with a great view; metro is round the corner - great for hollywood. Next time though we would stay on the beach - Santa Monica looked ace - as has more going on in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Jtr61067
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, modern, very clean and location not too bad but not as central as some hotels. Overall, a quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel!!! but no internet free in lobby”
Reviews.Author: gabriela_ghe68
Reviews.Content: I stay in may at this hotel and was wonderfool, everything...rooms, location,beds..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: manhatten15
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 1 night whilst visiting LA. It is in a great location. Very close to the Staples Centre and many other attractions. The staff are very attentive and helpful. They did make the mistake of charging me twice for parking but after realising their mistake they fully refunded me and gave me a free meal. The lobby is very nice with free ice lemon water and fruit. The pool, spa and gym are very nice and clean. I must admit I was shocked when I opened the door to the room. It was amazing, really nicly decorated, very sophisticed and elegant. The bed was so comfortable and the place was spotless. The bathroom was fantastic with a bath and seperate shower and lovely toiletries. After about 15 minutes a maid knocked the door and gave us a cup of milk and two large cookies as we had a child. That was a nice touch. I thought that $30.00 a day parking fee was a little too much but as I was only there one night it wasn't too bad. I loved this hotel so much so that I have booked to stay at the NY branch later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable luxury, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: zuari
Reviews.Content: We had a deluxe room for a 4-night stay in January for a conference. Because we were busy, we didn't get a chance to appreciate the hotel's amenities. Internet was free, fast and trouble-free. The entry was glamorous; the bed extremely comfortable, the room good-sized, closets well set-up. Best of all was the delicious morning coffee and fruit actually delivered at the exact time requested each morning. Made getting out of bed each morning far easier!

Reviews.Title: “Good option in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: Janice037
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the start of a round the world trip. We had excellent service from all of the staff at the hotel, especially Sunday who was our hostess in the Club lounge.The bed was one of the most comfortable we've slept in. We had booked a club room and were not disappointed in the extras - lovely breakfast served in the Club lounge, evening cocktails, wine and substantial canapes (didn't need a starter for dinner). Sunday recommended and booked an excellent restaurnt for us. The hotel was a good option for a stay in downtown and we found it easy to get around from there, though taxis were a bit expensive. There is a tube station a few blocks away for trip to Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Island of calm in remarkable central LA”
Reviews.Author: brooklynsheldon
Reviews.Content: We attended a conference for 3-4 days that was based out of the Omni Los Angeles, downtown. The staff was attentive and courteous, the hotel was beautiful, our room was spacious and the bed was extremely comfortable. We especially liked the maple syrup-blueberry sausages for breakfast; great way to start the day! The hotel's proximity to Angels' Flight, Central Market, Chinatown, Ahmanson Theater (where we saw James Gandolfini, Jeff Daniels, Hope Davis, and Marcia Gay Hayden, in "God of Carnage"; William H. Macy, his wife Felicity [Desperate Housewives], and Dick Van Dyke were sitting behind us), etc., was an extreme plus. Our only recommendations would be that the spa/exercise room were more spacious, and that there would be more and more readily accessible electrical outlets in the room; we're geardo's, so we have lots of gadgets that need charging.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - aimed at business traveler”
Reviews.Author: kath_GC
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel in downtown LA. Large, pleasant room. The town car was a great advantage, I used it to get to Union Station in order to return to the airport and was advised that I could have rung the hotel and asked for the car to pick me when I arrived as well. There were lots of door/conciege staff and I found that they were a little over-attentive in trying to offer services, but some people may appreciate the high level of service where I'd prefer to walk down and get my taxi from the nearby rank.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a stay in downtown Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: cnalsc
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of downtown Los Angeles, near the Music Center and MOCA, this is really quite a nice hotel. Wonderful public rooms, great gym, well appointed rooms, pleasant and friendly service. If you get a room overlooking the Plaza, you might even be able to avoid the street noise. Conveniently located for downtown activities, but not difficult to get to Pasadena and/or Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room and view”
Reviews.Author: Nomad033
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for three nights to stay here with my mother in a twin doubled bedded room, there was a bit of confusion about the rate as I booked direct with the hotel on the Omni website after being given confirmation by the hotel I was entitled to a discounted rate, the lady at the front desk at check-in was not very welcoming though. Other than the unwelcoming check-in I couldn't fault the hotel. The room was a good size, beautiful, comfortable beds, a flat screen TV and looked out over Angels Flight and California Plaza. The bathroom was beautiful, it's better than the picture on the website. We didn't eat at the hotel but had a few snacks at the shops at California Plaza, there's Starbucks, a pizza cafe and various other eating places where office workers eat lunch during week days, at the weekend the area is quiet. i used the well equipped qym at the hotel once, the swimming pool is smaller than it looks on the Omni website. I also used the hotel car that's complimentary to guests to use within a three mile drive. The driver took us to a nearby theater and offered to collect us which was nice (but don't forget to tip the driver). Our room was quiet and the house keeper did a good job of keeping our room nice. I signed up for the Select service which provides complimentary internet but didn't use it as I didn't bring my laptop in the end. I did notice a extra charge made to my card a few days after leaving the hotel, I contacted the hotel and they said it was for the mini bar. I didn't use the mini bar and they have now offered to refund this extra charge. I recommend this hotel but do check your statements for extra charges.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in LA”
Reviews.Author: TaherAlbaghliJulian
Reviews.Content: Great hotel,comfort,helpful staff,speed internet, near pershing metro station. large room, excellent decorate,good pool. the price are great. i do not like the area becuase the resturant & shops close early .

Reviews.Title: “All-round great quality and value”
Reviews.Author: Davo_Fido
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Omni LA for three nights after reading the glowing reviews on TripAdvisor and we were not disappointed. The staff are excellent - very friendly and helpful. The quality of the building and all furnishings and fittings is first rate. Our room was very comfortable and quiet and our bed was excellent too. We thought it was well located above California Plaza where there are numerous eateries for breakfast and lunch, a good convenience store for water and other consumables and a great bar for dinner. it's also next door from the Museum of Contemporary Art, across the road from the Disney Concert hall and near the metro train station which we caught out to Universal Studios. I'd recommend this hotel to the fussiest of travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: meowkapow
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Omni Los Angeles. The hotel was clean and the staff friendly and helpful. We ate at NOE as well as ordered room service, we found the food to be quite good! While you might have to take a tour bus to see the more touristy areas, there are some great things to see and do. If you're into street art, check out the Art in the Streets at the Geffen Contemporary MOCA, and when you are done you can visit the other MOCA right next to the Omni using the same ticket. While in the Little Tokyo area, line up outside of Sushi Gen and get some amazing sashimi! Fugetsu-do has delicious mochi. Architecture geeks, this hotel is walking distance to Frank Gehry's Walt Disney Concert Hall! The Los Angeles Central Library is also a nice place to visit, their gift shop has some great literary geek gifts. Angels Knoll is a nice place to relax and Angels Flight railway is a cute experience. If you are nervous travelers make a point to explore during the day as it does get quiet in the area of a night time. All in all we found the Omni a great place to experience another side of LA in addition to the touristy places we saw on tour.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a bad location.”
Reviews.Author: Dasscotts
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here for 3 nights in late November 2010. We found the hotel to be very luxurious for the price and the staff were very friendly. We stayed in 3 other Omni brand hotels and we found the Omni Los Angeles the best. It's a shame that the location is not good as there is a lack of good dinning places during the week nights and the area does not feel safe during the night (and day). It is also difficult to get to other tourist areas, would be good if they offered more alternatives in regards to transport.

Reviews.Title: “extremely good”
Reviews.Author: awdub
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised by the Omni. The rates were pretty good, the room was impeccably decorated and furnished and was a decent size, the linens, bed and shower were all top-notch, and the front desk service was excellent. I quickly agreed to join their frequent guest program for get the free internet service and breakfast beverages. The room service dinner was a fair price, quickly delivered, and very tasty. The internet service was fast and good. I have just one quibble, and although it isn't enough to knock this otherwise perfect property down to a four star review, it was annoying. You get the free breakfast drinks (tea or coffee, and a choice of a juice, I thought) by hanging the card on your door, and I did so at about 10pm. You can also add a bagel, english muffin, etc. - the theoretical price is another $3 or $4, so I added an english muffin for $3. Well, when I checked out in the morning (10 hours after I put the card on my door), there was a generic charge for in-room dining which I thought included dinner and breakfast, but a few days later, the hotel added a charge for almost $8 to the bill, and when my assistant called to ask about it, they hold her that the charge was for the breakfast. I would probably stay there again, but it left a very bad impression.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, relaxing”
Reviews.Author: AmyMR
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean, the beds are very comfortable. If you join the free rewards program, the kids get free cookies and milk at night, free beverage service in the morning. Felt very pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel & great service”
Reviews.Author: johnrosejohn
Reviews.Content: My wife, two sons and i stayed at the Omni for two nights at the end of our kids' CA spring break trip. Of the four hotels (mostly Marriotts) we stayed at during our week long trip throughout Northern & Central CA, this hotel was clearly the best! The hotel was clean & modern (most of the rooms appear to have been renovated during past year) & all hotel staff treated my family professionally! I would especially recommend reserving a Club Room (these are rooms on the top two floors of the hotel). Renata, THANK YOU for your help in getting us into one of these club rooms --- it made our trip extra special!! John

Reviews.Title: “great value luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: coniferman
Reviews.Content: most comfortable bed, service excellent, room with good view, handy for metro rail and buses,all for a very reasonable price. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “All the amenities and service you would expect. The Omni does not dissapoint!”
Reviews.Author: Jared_Sinclair
Reviews.Content: As an business we have been trying to find a sensible priced hotel in LA that is in downtown LA that has all the amenities and service you would expect from a luxury hotel. The Omni does not dissapoint! The staff are friendly and helpful, and the rooms could not be faulted. Free internet is available if you are prepared to sign up for the Omni Hotel Card which has other pleasant and free benefits (all for the sake of an email address, so why wouldn't you!) I always struggle with street noise what ever hotel I stay in (I am used to no noise at night being a country boy), but my work collegues slept well. The restuarant was pleasant enough but a little limited in choice and a little too quite for me. Instead jump in a taxi and head for LA Live which is only 5 minutes away for much more choice (4 or 5 US chain restaurants) or better still if available the hotel offer a free courtesey car (within a 3 mile radius!). Anyway enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: hookedonvacation
Reviews.Content: just stayed three nights at the omni los angeles hotel - they just completed a renovation and it looks great! Most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Service was excellent, very friendly and anticipated your needs. Had a superb dinner in Noe!

Reviews.Title: “Always a Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Juan M
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here three times in the last year, and it's always a great experience. The staff is very quick to respond to any requests I have, and the rooms are very comfortable. The renovation has brought in nicer furniture and flat-screen televisions (at last!), but the rooms still had a pretty strong "new paint" smell, which will pass in time. The location is great for downtown, superb for the Music Center, and also very close to the Pershing Square subway station.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: Dan90024
Reviews.Content: I'm usually a very mellow person and I spend a lot of time and money traveling. This is the first time I have ever felt compelled to write a review because this was the worst hotel/travel experience I had and I don't want others to get scammed. I booked the Omni 9 months before the LA Marathon using Hotels.com. Obviously, I made sure it was refundable since things can change in 9 months. 3 weeks before the Marathon I realized this location was too far from where I needed to be, I tried to cancel and get a refund online. Hotels.com allowed me to "cancel" online, but now in fine print said it was a "nonrefundable" reservation. I did not realize that by "canceling" I was essentially giving my room away even though I had paid for it in full. When I called them to tell them about my mistake and get my room back or get credit, Hotels.com said I had to get permission from Omni. The Omni said I had to get permission from Hotels.com. This started 3 days of hell trying to call Omni and Hotels.com trying to get my room or money back 3 weeks before my reservation! One costumer rep told me my reservation was refundable, the other said it wasn't. I was confused and angry. Both Omni and Hotel.com went out of their way to be totally unhelpful, rude, unaccommodating, blaming each other and made no attempt to keep a good costumer. I ended up staying at a cheap local motel, finished the Marathon, and will never use Hotels.com nor the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni Los Angeles has set the bar for all my future hotel stays.”
Reviews.Author: ndv1981
Reviews.Content: This hotel has more than exceeded my expectations, and it hasn't even been a full 24 hours! Because I signed up for their membership program when booking (do it--it's FREE), I was greeted with free door cards that treat members to free beverages in the morning, then not 30 minutes after I'd been in the room, I was brought a complimentary bottle of spring water, nuts and fruit. There is a complimentary car service, which took me to my dinner destination after getting a recommendation and reservation from the friendly concierge, and I came back to find my turn-down service had been handled--my bed was remade, my ice bucket was filled, another bottle of spring water was left, and the bathroom was tidied. Oh, and I had a personalized note waiting for me on my bedside table. I couldn't be more pleased with this hotel. I've never felt compelled to rate a hotel, except when something's gone terribly wrong, but I had to share this excellent customer service. Thank you for making this rainy stay in LA as pleasurable as possible, Omni!

Reviews.Title: “Skip this one if you can, the employees have lost interest in their jobs!”
Reviews.Author: Trankkis
Reviews.Content: Sometimes bad things happen at hotels. Sometimes unfortunate chains of events can destroy a visit. That's ok. If the employees show total negligance of it and tries to pretend it didn't happen, and even intentionally sabotages your stay, that is not. Not even if they compensate it by offering free parking. Me and my wife were staying three nights in the beginning of our holiday. We asked for an upgrade and bought it for 50 dollars a night, including breakfast. Unfortunately the room was dirty when we arrived - no bottled water and a thick layer of dust. We asked to change and were told that a room has been booked for us on the top floor but we have to wait for housekeeping. We waited, and after almost 24 hours we were told there were no king-size bed rooms available anymore on the top floor! We explained that one was booked for us and suddenly one was available. After our dinner the 2nd night, we couldn't get into our room. It turned out the door malfunctioned, not the keys! We were offered a worse room instead and decided to wait to get in, missing the Conan show. For this, the staff offered a free valet parking. The following morning we didn't receive any newspaper, despite speficifally writing what we want on the 'coffee card'. The internet didn't work, it claimed we couldn't spell our surname or didn't stay at our room! In the afternoon the 2nd day, we couldn't get into our room again. The front staff claimed we didn't stay at the top floor at all! It turned out that the worse room we were offered was the one registered for us instead of the one we were actually staying at. Fine. The last morning, the breakfast on the top floor wasn't available, since 'the person who makes it seems to be late'. Nothing was offered in return, and I suggested we have the 3rd floor breakfast instead. After breakfast, we had received the bill - it didn't have the discount valet parking! This hotel must have the worst service in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hotel”
Reviews.Author: tillyhorn
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in August 2010 sharing a twin room with a friend. Booked through Trailfinders. The hotel was in a good location, about ten minutes walk to the nearest metro station, however, we got used to walking most places in downtown LA. The only nagging point was that we couldn't find any convenience stores close to the hotel and the nearest shops/restaurants were generally over ten minutes walk away. Room was clean; a very generous size and the beds were extremely comfortable. The bathroom was the biggest I have come across in all the hotels I have stayed in around the world. There was also air-conditioning, a mini-bar and TV with satellite/cable. The hotel has a small fitness suite and swimming pool, which were free to use. The food in the hotel's restaurant was good but average. In general the staff were very helpful although they seemed a bit reluctant to look up train times and other related information for us. A very impressive hotel and one to recommend in downtown LA if not the whole of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, delicious food and wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: fvrbtmn
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in a while to stay in downtown LA - I usually stay in Santa Monica. I am happy to report that my stay at Omni LA was wonderful. The staff was great and the room was spacious and comfortable. I had dinner at the Noe Restaurant and the food was just delicious. BTW, the Noe Bar screen was definitely a "cool" scene -check it out! The next morning after breakfast, the staff arranged a complimentary car service to take me to my meeting. Nice touch. "I will be BACK!" AC

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Downtown Area”
Reviews.Author: domer2007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni for the fourth year in a row while in town for business. As usual, the hotel was clean, nicely appointed and contained all the amenities one would expect. A recent renovation was completed and our room had new furniture, bedding and decor. The room is large, contains a nice work-desk, a comfy reading chair and a huge bathroom. The staff here is particularly helpful. Our visit overlapped with a large youth theatre event which took over many of the public areas of this hotel. The staff ensured that the meeting room we required was cleared of traffic and kept noise to a minimum in the hallways outside our meeting. Additionally, when we required the aid of a doctor to treat one of my colleagues, the hotel found an on-call physician and the courtesy car service was able to take me to a 24-hour pharmacy to pick up the required prescription. Room service here is only so-so but the restaurant and bar serve excellent food and drinks. (Selections at both are slightly higher priced than other downtown eateries but the food is quite tasty and the atmosphere and convenience account for the higher price.) Overall, I was pleased with my stay at the Omni and look foward to visiting again next year when business takes us to LA. Be sure to sign up for the Omni Select Guest Program which includes both free internet access and free beverage delivery each morning. (Our drinks and reduced-price breakfast items never failed to arrive on time during our stay!)

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: 1qt4u2nv
Reviews.Content: My friend and I visited LA for NBA All-Star weekend. I automatically assumed this was going to be a busy weekend and the hotel service was going to reflect that. I was absolutely wrong with my assumption. When we arrived, we were greeted by friendly hotel staff. The line to check in was moving at a rapid pace, we were able to get our room upgraded, and the hotel honored our AAA discount (10% off). We were upgraded to the 17th floor (club level), which featured a lounge, where continental breakfast was served daily and drinks and appetizers were served in the evenings. The hotel was clean, the staff were very helpful, the decor was exquisite, the rooms were modern and comfortable, and the view was awesome. The hotel is located in the heart of downtown LA so getting around was very easy....unless you have a cab driver that refuses to drive in traffic!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: topaznight
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the Omni without a car, just to visit LA and have a relaxing few days. Hotel is impecccably clean and 4 star rooms. Elegant, clean and very comfortable. The only detractor is that the location is not good unless you have a car. In walking distance there is very little in term of entertainment, restaurants and nightlife. Hotel is in a financial and business hub area, mostly you'll see banks, skyscrapes, offices and if you want to get elsewhere it will be a long distance by foot.
