Recommended for business travel, business conference, working, or for someone who has a rented vehicle or transporation at disposal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: iac0n
Reviews.Content: Los Angeles is a strange place. I had a lot of trouble pinning down a central location on where to stay. I wouldn't call this place central but having had 7 days in LA I still couldn't tell someone a great location that is central. The hotel was a nice place, I think it is more aimed at business people. Nice room, friendly helpful staff and good food. The hotel is Downtown and the area around was a real eye opener to say the least, I couldn't really believe how run down some areas were. I am a bit adventurous at the best of times but had concerns for myself being out in the dark. The subway was very easy to use but limited in where you can access, it covers less then half the city. I couldn't get to Santa Monica without getting a bus, something I avoided! I do recommend this place but it really depends what you want to see, came away from my trip thinking I needed to return to LA and plan it better.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, not a great location very isolated. Unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Nomisimo
Reviews.Content: Would stay closer to sunset or beverly hills next time, great for business perhaps

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: bbeelner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay in LA for a little romantic getaway and decided on the Omni based on their rates, and proximity to the Disney Concert Hall which he had tickets for. The staff was very attentive, friendly and prompt. Their courtesy car was able to get us to LA Live at no charge for dinner reservations and then picked us up to take us to the Concert Hall in plenty of time for curtain. The Sunday breakfast brunch was very good, with a wide variety of healthy food. This may become our go to place when we want to get away and is only 30 minutes from our home in Orange County. The rooms could use a little updating, but they were still very clean and plenty of amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel in an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: ioliesym
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Its location was excellent, the staff was extremely helpful (it even had a free taxi for the residents for locations within 5km distance from the hotel). It was extremely clean, the rooms were new and comfortable and generally it was an excellent accommodation. I would definitely recommend it to anyone that wants to visit Los Angeles

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on Olive St.”
Reviews.Author: sweintraub
Reviews.Content: I don't normally review bad experiences but I need to get this clusterf*** off my chest. The hotel itself is nice enough. The beds are soft, the bathrooms are great and there are quality fixtures all around. There aren't any restaurants within blocks but it is downtown LA so it is what it is. My wife is in town for an MLA professor interview and our door key stopped working before her interview. We weren't late but we needed to get our things and take off to give her a comfortable window of time. We went downstairs politely and asked if there was an issue. They redid our keys and we tried again. Still didn't work. I went downstairs and asked the guy at the front desk to elevate it to the next level. He said he'd call the workshop (which I found out later wasn't open). I went back upstairs and waited with my wife, camped out in the hallway with our toddler. Nothing for 10-20 minutes. So we went downstairs and and asked for help. The guy downstairs wouldn't pay attention to me even though he knew we couldn't get into our room. Repeatedly ignored me and saw other guests. When I addressed him directly, he said "I'm the only one here!" So I lost my s***. I told him to call someone with a key and have them windsprint upstairs immediately. He went into the back and got someone else to come upstairs. By that time my wife was sobbing because our neighbor came out and yelled at her because my toddler was making too much noise. HE had a blow out diaper in the time when we were camped out in the hallway. No way to prepare for the interview that we came to LA for in the first place. Both the manager and the crewman weren't able to get into the room. I can't imagine what would have happened if there was a fire in there. Luckily the woman in the room next door was just coming back from her workout and we asked her nicely to let us through the suite door. Finally we were in. Now wife is a mess and interview that brought us to LA is going to be started with a late excuse. The guy downstairs was nice enough to give my kid a play toy afterwards which was nice. They followed up but the door still doesn't work. We're looking into alternate arrangements after the interview. Other notes: Typical gouging on internet $10/night. Skip the breakfast. Way overpriced and crappy service. I had to pour my own drinks because the servers were too busy talking to each other to notice we didn't have our ordered drinks. $30/ night to park car when lot down the street is $12/night. My first and last Omni hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: oahufrog
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Los Angeles for the 2011 Rose Bowl (Go Frogs!) was pleasantly surprised with the Omni Los Angeles. I've visited Los Angeles many times and would certainly recommend this hotel - everyone was friendly! Oh, the room service was excellent, too!

Reviews.Title: “great location, otherwise just OK”
Reviews.Author: flipper314
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omnif for 2 nights over New Year's. The best attribute is the location: a block from the Disney concert hall, walking distance to lots of sights, easy walk to the Metro. But otherwise this hotel was just OK, and for $250/night, I expected more. Our room was fine, but the carpet was dirty (however, it looks like they're in the middle of remodeling whole floors, so this may shortly be a nonissue). The pool is small, underheated, and worse, there's no spa. There were no towels out by the pool... I guess they didn't expect anybody to use it. The Grand Cafe was closed by 7pm, and then it didn't seem to be open in the morning either, so we could never eat there (but there are lots of other eating opportunities in the area). If we ever visit downtown L.A. again, I'll probably check the Omni for a good rate, but I'll also look for other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaFreeze
Reviews.Content: Easy access to downtown locations and metro. Staff is very good. Always use name on the phone and say hello when you pass them. They always answer 'yes' first. Unlike so many other hotels that ask your room number first before answering you to gauge your rate. The parking staff was quick and very nice as well. Pool was closed and that was not on website.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: VickieSingapore
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Omni for 6 nights in Dec 2010. It was a nice experience. The room was clean and there were a lot of small touches, e.g. free internet access, morning drinks, turn down snacks etc. My kids love the hotel so much and we felt like going back home whenever we return to the hotel everyday. THUMBS UP!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: BobLind
Reviews.Content: I split my stay in LA in two. For the second part I decided to stay in Downtown LA as I wanted a nice hotel not to far away from attractions and near Dodger Stadium (at the same time). The hotel is beautiful. I have no complains at all. I found a promotion through Omni's website to stay three nights and pay only two. The room was spacious and the bathroom had a shower and a bath tube. Hotel staff was helpful. The only downside is parking... there are many parking lots around but they close during the night and they have no in/out privilege. And you really need a car in LA, specially in Downtown during the night. Nothing bad happened, but I would not recommend to walk around during the night... It's deserted and you need a car o take a taxi to go to a restaurant. Back to the hotel, I ended up using the hotel's valet parking, which was great, but very expensive for me (around USD 30 per day with in/out privileges). I didn't use the pool... It seemed nice but small. Overall, I was happy with the hotel, but I would not recommend staying in Dowtown LA unless you go there for a specific purpose or event.

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect. Great room, bed, bath, and best of all the crew.”
Reviews.Author: fabiocaribe
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasent stay, because of the location, the wonderful room, and the best crew ever. WeÂ´d like to congratulate the crew because they were the best. Certanly when we be back to LA, we would like to be there. Thank you for everything that you done to us. Happy holidays to all of you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business or Music Center Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scottca075
Reviews.Content: The Omni is one of three or four hotels I regularly book in downtown Los Angeles when I am in town for business or the theater. It is well located for the courthouses and the financial district and walkable for the Music Center, but since there are shuttles for that, you don't need to. There are some good restaurants nearby, but you are up on Bunker Hill and the new heart of downtown, LA Live is a good long way, still walkable if you are in good shape, but still a good mile and a half. The rooms are modern and comfortable and the pool just big enough so I can lap swim. Overall, if you have to be in downtown for business or the theater, I think this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, good location, good services.”
Reviews.Author: PritiLucknow_India_
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The hotel has a very good location in downtown, the nearest station- Pershing Square- is only 5 minutes away from the hotel and opposite to the station is Subway where one can have breakfast before catching up a train. The hotel is neat and clean ( the linen of the bed was not very fresh on the first day though). They provide room-service in the night as well, so good for those suffering from jet-lag. The hotel staff is very helpful in offering any kind of assistance such as contacting your tour-operators, finding out restaurants of your preference or sorting out problems related with the room-amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Service - Par Excellance”
Reviews.Author: Woodinville_Diner
Reviews.Content: We visited Los Angeles for our first overnight in the metropolis, and chose the Omni for proximity to the event we were attending. Little did we know that we were about to encounter a level of service which can go head-to-head against any of the competitors. Special call out to the concierge staff: Daniel and Amy - who truly made our visit special and provided us with the tidbits of info we needed. Restaurants, transport, directions, facility, etc. We are looking forward to the updating of the rooms, and will be visiting the Omni whenever an overnight in Los Angeles is in the books.

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets”
Reviews.Author: Noel-Birkner
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really value for money, it's as good as it gets. Nice staff, great food and spacious rooms and lobbies. The guys and girls at the frontottice are wonderful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: glynnrieckhoff
Reviews.Content: The room and bathroom were nice and spacious, the only down side was no free internet and it was expensive if you wanted it. There are some nice restaurants close by and the Disney Concert Hall is within walking distance as is the metro. Very convenient for getting to Hollywood. The hotel opens up to the plaza, which is a nice outdoor courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for business downtown”
Reviews.Author: lawmom611
Reviews.Content: Business brought us to LA, but there was a large leisure component. The Hotel was perfect for a downtown conference; it was convenient, and had all of the bells and whistles. The room was large, clean, and comfortable, and the staff was cheerful and attentive. We also found that the location was a great base for accessing sites and activities in and around the City. Nothing to regret. We had a great stay, and would return!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in mediocre location”
Reviews.Author: MarkHamburg
Reviews.Content: Upside: The hotel is easy to reach from LAX airport and after business hours there is ample free parking on the street in front of the hotel. Downside: There are hardly any shops / restaurants / bars / sights close by. Rooms are quite big, stylish and offer all the usual amenities of a five star hotel. Good sound insulation, curtains close out the light pretty well, mattress on the hard side (I like it that way) so quality of sleep was excellent. They offered two different flavours of scented water in the lobby while I stayed. Apart from that, the hotel left a rather impersonal impression on me - maybe an L.A. thing rubbing off on the hotel... I think I should have stayed somewhere near Hollywood instead - the reason for my stay was a last day of sightseeing before flying home and downtown L.A. didn't have that much on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Option”
Reviews.Author: avodoc
Reviews.Content: I believe the real test of a hotel is how they handle the unexpected. We arrived at the hotel around 1:00 PM. We had called ahead and asked if we could have early check in and they said it would be no problem. After receiving our room key we proceeded to our room. When we opened the door it was clear that the room had not been cleaned. We called the front desk and they apologized and said they would send someone up with a new key to a new room. After about 15 minutes and still no key, we decided to go back down to the front desk. The woman behind the counter apologized profusely and immediately gave us an upgrade to their premium floor, which included free cocktails in the evening and breakfast the next morning. So, they won our loyalty from that moment on. The rest of our stay was fine. Nice quiet, comfortable room with a very comfortable bed. Big bathroom with lots of little extras, like shaving cream, tooth paste,cotton balls etc. A couple of small gripes: we had an older tube-type TV in our room. It seems that a hotel of this caliber ought to, by now, have flat-screen, HD, TV's. Also, they charge $10 a day for wireless for each computer you use in your room. We stayed in a $100 a night Holiday Inn the night before that had free wireless. Otherwise we had a delightful stay.

Reviews.Title: “I hate this hotel! I should have stayed at the Standard.”
Reviews.Author: TechGnome
Reviews.Content: I hate this hotel! I should have stayed at the Standard. 1. Asked for 2 beds when i got here the lady nodded yes like she had the entire time at counter, very little English spoken. Got up to room 1 bed called desk couldnâ€™t understand her. She spoke to someone else to translate for her since I could not understand her. No other rooms available with 2 beds, fine whatever thatâ€™s what i reserved. 2. valet guy couldn't speak English either and it's $30. 3. 845am after long night I was working on a spreadsheet quietly trying not to wake the 2 girls in my bed smoking a cigarette in the smoking room i requested. Then some idiot starts banging on my door demanding i let him in, claiming to be security. I told him I was naked and he demanded I open the door, then I had to wake the 2 girls up and make them put on their clothes too so this idiot could come in to tell me i can't smoke. He couldn't tell me that outside the room so I did not disturb the ladies? Needless to say, he freaked then out so much this morning was not as happy as I had hoped it would have been. 3. the printer didn't work and that was a selling point on this hotel so I had to go to kinkos. Of course, no one at the hotel knew what to do or could bring me a replacement. 4. Never offered key for mini bar, I wanted drink went to open it it was locked called down to front desk lady had to transfer me to operator who was putting me on hold and going back and forth to get me answers. Which was she screwed up so I decided they did not deserve the extra revenue and drank bad LA tap water. I am a 35 year old professional that travels all the time and have traveled as part of my job for 6 years. This is the first time I have ever had an encounter such as this and I am so upset I am scared to talk to the manager right now because I may start freaking out. The security guard made my girls get out of bed and MADE THEM put on their clothes. Was this guy trying to get some cheap thrill? Did someone see me come in with them and he was told to come check out how beautiful they were or something cause he sure did keep looking at them. Why would your website offer smoking if they are not going to honor it and then act like Iâ€™m smoking crack with preteens or something crazy? I am a professional that is in charge of a 100 million dollar company that operates on a Billion dollar property in Las Vegas. I know the hotel industry inside and out and our hotel see absurd things. I deserve my hotel refunded and will be finding all the review sites I can to warn other of how terrible the service is here.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: mrrfrost
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before (and reviewed before). The hotel is only a few min from Pershing Square metro station which, without a car in LA, is a blessing though the metro doesn't go to all the places you want to. Hotel is nice, beds are very comfortable, OK gym, rooms are very clean. Service and staff was generally very good apart from the concierge one time wasn't that helpful in giving me bus directions and advice. There are a quite a few cafes, convenience stores located next to hotel for snacks, drinks, etc.. You can get to the hotel in less than an hour by public transport. Take the bus which runs every 1/2 hr to Union Square then it's only 2 stops to Pershing Square on metro and a 5 min (uphill) walk. This costs less than $10 in total - much cheaper than the $60+ taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: UCONN2284
Reviews.Content: Friendly service, lots of amenities, decent location in downtown Los Angeles, valet parking, spacious workout room, great (but expensive) restaurant

Reviews.Title: “beyond my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: travelsonceinawhile
Reviews.Content: the accomodations were beautiful but the service was what I thought made this hotel stand out. This was my first trip to LA, so I was a fish out of water. All I had to do was ask the staff where things were and how to get there, and they practically held my hand! I didn't even use the concierge! I asked if one of my destinations was to far to walk, and they said "why don't you use our courtesy car?" SUPERB!!!!! And beautiful California Plaza right there!!!! AWESOME!!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel at a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: kkk666
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. The outdoor swimming pool has warm water with little salt. The room is clean with nice view. The only down side is the night shift representative of the counter is not very helpful and friendly, when I pointed out that there was a mistake on my bill. The issue was not solved until the day shift manager gave us a hand. Overall, our family enjoy the stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni was very comfortable and perfect for a stay in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: danchel465
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my son who was moving to LA within a block of the Hotel. He stayed with me until we set up his apartment. The hotel was very quiet, situated so that you could enter from the street or on an upper floor from a lovely walkway that connected it with other buildings on that block like the contemporary Art Museum and a music school. We had room service which was ok, but really enjoyed the breakfast in the restaurant. We also had a very nice dinner in the fancier restaurant with very nice service. The room was sufficiently large for both us, with a very nice bathroom, and comfortable double beds. It possibly would have been better to stay 2 blocks down the hill as for New Yorkers we found it difficult to walk to nearby places. However we had a car, and took cabs so we overcame that issue easily

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else in LA”
Reviews.Author: AndrewJBell
Reviews.Content: We'd a wonderful 4 nights in the Omni in September, the hotel had everything we were looking for, for our city tour, especially, a great attitude, from all their staff. I'm glad we picked to be in Downtown, because we may never have visited it, had we stayed in the likes of West Hollywood, and Downtown has some great galleries and restaurants. LA is SO large though, and we found ourselves with a lot of expensive taxi (cab) rides. Would love to go back to the Omni soon.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected pleasure”
Reviews.Author: miamirita
Reviews.Content: I was tried upon arrival having traveled across the states to Los Angeles. I was met by a friendly valet and front desk staff, easing the burden of long distance travel. Check in was quick and it seemed like they were expecting my arrival. The standard rooms are large for a downtown city location and the baths are well stocked with toiletries. I ordered a late night meal from room service, which was served in less than 20 minutes and was unusually tasty. I was disappointed that there was a charge for internet and had difficulty using my wireless card in the building.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay with some problems.”
Reviews.Author: rainyred
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel is clean and nice enough for a business trip, but given a second chance I'd probably stay someplace else. I requested an in-room workout kit advertised in the hotel guide, but never got it in spite of asking for it twice. I received someone else's wake up call in addition to my own, which was disruptive. Worst of all, room service pounded on my door and called my phone at 6am and I didn't order room service, so really they just woke me up for no reason. Otherwise, the staff were nice and the facilities were fine but nothing special. The room service staff and house keeping staff were especially wonderful- So friendly and gracious!

Reviews.Title: “Superb..”
Reviews.Author: Gilly-bean0779
Reviews.Content: The Omni Los Angeles was a wonderful place to stay for first time visitors as the bus stops and train station (Pershing Square) were within a 5 minute walking distance. We stayed for 3 nights and would have stayed much longer if we had known the true beauty of the city beforehand. You can read as much as you want about a place but it actually takes the reality of a visit to really feel its heartbeat. The lobby was large & welcoming, all the staff friendly & helpful, our room wonderfully luxurious, the bed extremely comfortable and the bathroom was a really nice size (for a change)!!. My only complaint would be the non-delivery of newspaper or early morning drinks as promised with Omni Select Guest. The sights, sounds and multi-cultural people of Los Angeles were really what make this city "tick". Everyone & everything that we encountered were just amazing and made for a truly memorable trip. I would highly recommend both the hotel & the city as places to really enjoy a vacation to its fullest. Well done..

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CDinNI
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Omni for 2 nights last month with my wife and grown-up daughter. This was the start of a Californian holiday and what a start. The staff were very helpful and the hotel is deserving of the high rating on this site. The room was excellent and we enjoyed the 'extra' service associated with the Group Loyalty Scheme. The big detractor mentioned in various reviews on TA is the $30 (per night) charge for car parking. By any measure this is exorbitant and to me was a slight blot on our stay. I had planned to park nearby (at less than half the price) but in the event found the convenience, not to mention the hill, the persuasion one needed. This hotel will not suit everyone on holiday though given its down town location but we knew about that prior to booking.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel during our trip to the USA”
Reviews.Author: busybeemk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel at the beginning of August, with three friends. We had prepaid for two rooms with twin beds but unfortunately when checking in they had informed us that only one room had twin beds and the other was a king bed with a pull out sofa, for the trouble they gave us complimentary vouchers for the Grand Cafe buffet breakfast that was a nice touch and we really appreciated it. On advice from previous reviewers on trip advisor I joined up the Select Guest program and would recommend it, I was able to use complimentary wireless internet we were delivered bottles of water on arrival and complimentary beverages each morning. I used the Gym each morning it had a great range of equipment. We had a great view from our room of the Disney Concert Hall and Plaza the room was spacious, very quiet and clean and super comfy beds, my only complaint was the old TV, I would of expected a flat screen for such a nice modern hotel. I also have to praise the wonderful Concierge one of the best I have ever come across, they booked a wonderful tour of LA and also helped me when I had forgotten to confirm a booking for the Lux Bus I was in a panic and asked if they could help me as I could not get through to the booking telephone number on my confirmation email, they looked up some other numbers and told me they would contact them for me, after a few hours they left me a message on our room telephone and then called me again to make sure i received the message. I was relieved and very grateful so Thank you very much for the wonderful service. I will definately stay at this hotel again when we return to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Guest30
Reviews.Content: 1st time in LA - hotel customer service was excellent - check in ,check out, service, valet , room . beds and bathroom etc. join loyalty scheme for free wi-fi and morning drinks delivered to your room - iced water provided in reception valet parking is dear at $30 per day but the valet service is impeccable and multi in-out access is included and does save hassle of finding space down the road. Only stayed two nights and good rate found on expedia. Ideal for city centre location - you do need a car in LA though as city is so spread out.

Reviews.Title: “Smashing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: loves-to-travel50
Reviews.Content: Great location lovely big rooms. The bathrooms were very roomy and have separate shower. Great for getting to Universal or Hollywood Boulevard both only $1.50 each way on the red line metro from Pershing Square which is very near the hotel. You can also get a bus direct to Santa Monica Pier one street down from the hotel it is the 720 and takes about an hour and is still on $1.50 each way great value and it passes through Beverely Hills so you get a tour thrown in. The only down side is that the nearby restaurants close quite early as it is the financial district so they close about 9.30pm. The Californian Plaza right next door is very nice and there is a shop there which is open really late for all your essentials. Would definately return and recommend this hotel as it made our stay in LA special,

Reviews.Title: “dated rooms, TV circa 1983”
Reviews.Author: robg9000
Reviews.Content: THe hotel lobby is nice, the valet and front desk are friendly. We paid for a club level room and before the gal noticed that she offerred to upgrade us for free. So I said she can lower my rate instread and she didn't. Bad form. At any rate, the room was quite dated but clean. I have an issue with bathrooms without night lights - it's a simple little thing. Do you want to have hospital bright lights when you need to use the restroom in the middle of the night? Worst of all was the really really old TV - it was actually embarassing to see in 2010 that a property with the brand of Omni didn't have a flat screen with HD. Big mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and very nice property”
Reviews.Author: AnewMunsterfan
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference and selected the Omni based on Trip Advisor's reviews. I was not disappointed. The hotel staff went out of their way to be accomodating and friendly. The hotel limo was service for our dining out. Almost every single employee was pleasant, had a smile, a greeting and made my stay enjoyable. Great out door bar. Restaurant food was good as was room service. I look for comfortable beds and quiet. This is a must for a hotel in my book. A very limited selection in the gift shop. Not sure what that was about.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: KFDG
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice staff, delicious restaurant and room service. Small pool area was ok. Spacious room with a great comfy bed! Beautiful building inside and out. My only gripe was that the television barely had any channels, and getting ready in the am and going to bed I like having a selection of programs. That was non-existent. Great value though!!!! Parking is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Los Angeles!!!”
Reviews.Author: Man33years
Reviews.Content: The hotell is downtown LA. It's easy to take the Metro from Pershing Square nearby to attractions in LA. The rooms are big and clean. The hotell has a gym that has all you need for a little shape up while on vaccation. I would reccomend this hotell to all who are searching for a hotell in central LA. I'm very glad we didn't stay at Santa Monica or in Hollywood... Only drawbacks; you have to pay for internet and for car-parking.

Reviews.Title: “fab fab fab”
Reviews.Author: val9199
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni in LA for 5 nights and it was excellent. The hotel is lovely very clean and in 100 degree temps very cool. Staff were excellent.,the pool was great. Top tip is to join the select guest before you go and receive lots of goodies. Free internet,free coffee /tea every morning etc. And the best bit of all which came as a surprise at 6pm everynight milk and cookies were delivered for my son it was wonderful. The staff were very helpful nothing seemed too much trouble. The only down side to the Omni was i had to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff made up for minor screw-ups”
Reviews.Author: rcc_travels
Reviews.Content: after reading about this hotel on tripadvisor, i decided to stay for my birthday weekend. i booked (and was very excited about) their romance package. upon arrival, none of the details of my package were discussed so once we were settled in the room i decided to call the guest services agent to make sure we were going to get our welcome amenity and our rose petal turndown (and obviously we were assured both were taken care of). well, we had to call down an hour and a half later to make sure they hadn't forgotten our welcome amenity and then, after the second call, it arrived shortly thereafter. then, around 11 pm we returned to our room expecting the rose petal turndown but were sad to see it wasn't there. i guess this is the point where things could have turned sour, but the front desk manager (i believe his name was Jeff), was fantastic in handling the situation. he has impressive customer service skills and more than made it up to us. so what could have been a disappointing evening was saved and we wound up having a great time. i know i said it in the title, but the service at the hotel is really something special. the entire staff is very friendly (particularly the valet staff) and seem genuinely happy to assist you. the location is great. valet service was prompt. the food was delicious. the musician playing at the bar on saturday night was wonderful. the room itself was nothing terribly special in terms of furnishings and decoration, but the bed was very comfortable. all in all a great stay and (thanks to jeff), i plan on staying again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice; great service”
Reviews.Author: patsychom
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for five days which was a wonderful experience. The rooms are spacious, very clean, well serviced. The restaurants and bar provide great food and excellent service. The best part are the staff - they are truly exceptional. Professional, knowledgeable, efficient and warm and friendly. I truly felt like a guest at all times. Amy, the concierge, was exceptional. She made the visit that much better as I had limited time and her suggestions and advice were spot on. If all Omni's are like this one, it has become my favorite hotel. Only downside is not a great choice of things to do in the area after 5:00pm - be prepared to leave the area for entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: plarner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and found the reception service and concierge (Amy) to provide outstanding help and advice. The room was very good and although downtown was out from the traditional tourist areas we had a car so it made no difference.

Reviews.Title: “Omni even better on second trip this year”
Reviews.Author: Phoebe059
Reviews.Content: The front door staff, especially the supervisor, were extremely helpful during our 4 night stay this month. We love the location next to MOCA and near downtown restaurants and the Metro. The hotel is very comfortable and handsome. I just wish they would clean the exterior windows. Although the Grand Cafe is a little pricey for breakfast and lunch, the food, service and ambience are all very good. The courtesy car for trips within 3 miles is definitely a strong bonus at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, outstanding customer service and a wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: KittyRPV
Reviews.Content: Our son was married at The Cathedral of Our Lady of the Angels, in downtown Los Angeles, August of 2009. Since we live about 45 minutes from the cathedral and had family and friends from out of town, we decided to stay near the cathedral for convenience. We booked a block of rooms at The Omni and are so happy we did, we had a wonderful experience. The rooms were clean, which is extremely important to me, and comfortable. The customer service was outstanding and the hotel was very accommodating. There are many fast food and nice restaurants within walking distance which was extremely convenient. When booking the block of rooms the hotel waived the daily parking rate which was much appreciated by our guests, and the hotel upgraded the bride and groom to a beautiful suite to spend their wedding night in. They provided endless information on everything from limo service, taxi service, places to eat and things to do. I would recommend the Omni Los Angeles at California Plaza highly as they made our stay comfortable, enjoyable and stress free.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel in the Downtown Area”
Reviews.Author: Daniel_Rust
Reviews.Content: What a hotel! They define service and have set new heights. From the valet parkers and the bell boys, to the reception and the restarant, this hotel knows how to treat their guests! The rooms are enormous and provide more than enough space for two people. The hotel restaurant has a great menu at more than afforable prices, especially for a 5-star hotel. They gym and the pool facilities are great, and the spa provides numerous options as well. The only flaw is that there is no complimentary wifi available in the rooms. In addition, the hotel guests have to pay for the use of internet in the hotel lobby. In today's day and age, complimentary wifi access has become a service that guests have grown accustomed to. Even 2-star inns and motels now provide this service. So the Omni Los Angeles should definitly consider changing this feature.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, shabby room”
Reviews.Author: attytrav.
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights for a business conference, room 1225. The good - staff was uniformly very nice and helpful, food at Noe restaurant for dinner (not part of the conference) was outstanding, good location, nicely done common areas, very comfortable bed with nice linens. The bad - my room was in great need of rehab - very odd smell (maybe the cleaning supplies?), very noisy fan/ac unit, ancient tv with terrible picture. The hairdryer vibrated so much that was unusable. I called the front desk and they left a small hand held dryer in the room, which I appreciated. However it didnt work very well either. Please at least replace that hairdryer and find out about that funky smell! My other issue is that the food served as part of my business conference was mediocre at best. (despite the fact that Noe restaurant is fantastic) I had just come from Hotel 1000 in Seattle that served the same food at a business conference as the restaurant and it was fantastic. I understand that typically conference food is different from normal restaurant food but the Omni really needs to step it up here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service Disapointing Room”
Reviews.Author: travelgirls07
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m and avid reader of Trip Advisor and when I learned weâ€™d be staying for business at the Omni Hotel, I was super excited. I was greeted warmly by the valet, lobby is beautiful, front desk staff was super helpful and FAST -- love it. Then I got to my room with itâ€™s peeling wall paper, noisy bathroom fan, TV from the 1970s, and the just OK bathroom with the dated tile and super small tub and I was shocked . Was this really LAâ€™s #1 hotel????? Down for meetings in their conference rooms the following day, once again, the staff was seriously some of the best, most professional staff Iâ€™ve ever encountered, the bar area was amazing, food in the Noe Restaurant was heavenly -- our waiter was that rare mix of funny and attentive without being intrusive. Then back to my drab, just ok, nothing fabulous room. In fairness the room was clean and the bed very comfortable, but the dÃ©cor and the constant buzz from the ancient TV was disappointing. The final morning I had breakfast in the Grand CafÃ© and once again encountered the Omniâ€™s fabulous attentive staff and wonderful food. Because of the staff and everything else, food, drinks, service -- I really, really want to give the Omni a 5 as well, but if youâ€™re really into a lovely room, the Omni (or at least my room) was in serious need of some TLC. 5+ stars for the staff and everything else, but a 3.5 for the room.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pandafanLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Tripadvisor's reviewers for telling us about this hotel. It is everything that it's cracked up to be. We had a great corner room, large with wonderful view , comfy bed and luxurious linens. The hotel is pet friendly, the staff is incredibly gracious at every level. It has a fine gym and outdoor heated swimming pool. Re the two hotel restaurants: the food at the Grand Cafe for breakfast and lunch and Noe for dinner is very good and reasonably priced. Using our AAA discount, we paid about $190 a night including tax and parking for a weekend visit. Watch out for drink prices which tend to be steep. Within walking distance are some of Los Angeles best attractions; Disney Hall,The Dorothy Chandler Pavillion, the Museum of Contemporary Art and two architectural gems - The Biltmore Hotel and the Los Angeles Public Library. MOCA runs a shuttle from their Grand St. location in front of the Omni to the Geffen Contemporary branch which lands you in the center of Japan Town and many fine restaurants. Also within walking distance are the Water Grill, the best seafood restaurant in Los Angeles and Nick and Stef's a good steak house across the street. Be aware, that during the summer months, there are free evening concerts in California Plaza next to the hotel which last until 11pm. The decibel count is fairly high on same, so either request a room as far away from the Plaza as possible or bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “a really luxury hotel,excellent location,fantastic value!”
Reviews.Author: veropalumbo
Reviews.Content: we were in Los Angeles Omni hotel for 4 nights and we were surprised from the high level of this hotel.everything was perfect: 1)very elegant and high class hall. 2)fantastic rooms ,full of comforts,elegant and spacious. 3)staff very kind and avalaible,always ready to help you and satisfied all your expectations. 4)wonderful location,very close to Walt Disney Concert Hall,Moca and convenient to join very quickly all the most important and known places in L.A. 5)very good breakfast,we had the continental,rich and various for only 16 $. we have a very good souvenir of this hotel,well managed and with a fantastic staff.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the line in all respects”
Reviews.Author: puablo
Reviews.Content: Simply put, this is a luxury hotel. Very clean, very comfortable, excellent service. The room had one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept on in a hotel. Given the price, it lives up to expectations. We didn't really use the hotel's services for any more than the valet, which we used a lot. There is no self-park option, you have to use the valet and it is quite expensive at $30 a night. But it was one of the better valet experiences I've had. In the afternoon / early evening, the drop-off / pick-up location out front gets backed up into the street, but moves quicker than you would think. There was a few minute wait for someone to take your car from you, but they were working hard and each time I saw a manager or concierge helping out. As for pick-up, it was always faster than expected. You can call down with your claim number to make things faster, and when we did our car was usually waiting for us when we got there. Upon checkout, they packed our bags in our car faster than we even had time to tell them it wasn't necessary. The only reason why I might not stay here again is the location. Not the hotel's location specifically, it is in a nice, clean, and very easily accessible location downtown. The problem is downtown LA - unless you have a specific reason to be there, there's little point in staying there. There isn't much to do downtown, and the major highway corridors run through it such that you have instant traffic arriving or leaving the hotel. Next time I will probably stay somewhere else more centrally located to wherever it is I am going, but if I had any reason to stay downtown again, I can't imagine staying anywhere but here.

Reviews.Title: “centrally located, warm welcome and good bed”
Reviews.Author: bobw59
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel for a couple of nigjhts Friday and Saturday night, prior to starting a cruise from San Pedro.no problems at all. from the doorman to checkin desk both made us feel very welcome on arrival. one of the best points was the large high bed, which was so comfy. two free concerts in the plaza next door with hundreds of people tuning up dancing and just totally enjoying them selves.overall good experiance.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: aholmes
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotel staff I've encountered. Everyone was very accommodating and willing to help. This hotel is excellent for the museum crowd...within walking distance of numerous museums. Chinatown, Union Station, the Alleys and metro are nearby. They do not, however, provide transportation from the airports. Try to get a room with a view of California Plaza. Good hotel for business travelers. One of the best beds I've slept in. Unfortunately, the TVs need upgrading to flatscreens, but who's there to watch TV anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Omni far surpasses other downtown LA hotels”
Reviews.Author: Princesspanda56
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the LA Omni and were impressed every day at the service. I joined the Omni Select Guest loyalty program when I made the reservation, and it was well worth it, from the upgraded room, to the free morning breakfast beverages delivered to your room. Turn-down service was provided every night without asking for it. The staff was always helpful and genuinely nice. Only complaint was the courtesy car, we took it to USC, only to be told after we were in the car and away from the hotel, that the car could not bring us inside the gates of USC. I don't know why. I would have driven my car had I known before we left. However, perfect location for those visiting USC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, made up for mistakes.”
Reviews.Author: inspiration100
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice in the last week. Let it be known, I am not a picky with my hotels, you can check my other reviews. However, our first stay was less than desirable with some fairly serious cleanliness problems of the room. After contacting the front manager Robbie and sending some pictures about the issues, he assured me our second stay would be much better. He was right. Our second stay was next to perfect and I am pretty sure he personally made sure it would be better which was a nice touch. I always value the hotel's interest in their customers and this hotel puts that at the highest priority. Our second room made us feel like we were celeberties. Very clean, A/C was perfect, clean as a whistle and friendly staff. Bunker Hill is a great location with the Red Line to Hollywood just a few blocks away. The Omni Select program is superb with drinks delievered right to your door. They did forget the newspaper (or someone else took it), but I just went to the desk to get one. The only thing our second stay lacked was a DVD player that we could rent, but that is not a big deal, nor did they advertise they offer that service. Overall, the second stay was one of the nicest stays at a hotel we have ever had. Book here, it's the best in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jon-n-Kim
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a few days for business in the area. Nice clean room and great location that was convenient to downtown offices. Too bad the downtown LA area is a big disappointment as there are hardly any restaurants/shopping in the area. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel-value for money in a club room”
Reviews.Author: newreviewerEngland
Reviews.Content: Coming from England we stayed four nights at the Omni before moving on to Las Vegas. The hotel and staff were excellent. Friendly staff that went out of their way to give us information about the local area. Art in the club lounge was brilliant our first night there, even going so far as to get us a list of local restaurants as the one in the hotel was soon due to close. The club lounge is excellent value for money and is really under used. I hope by saying that they don't up the prices but we found staying in a club room really good value as our breakfast and evening drinks and munchies were included in the price of the room. Check out the bar in the hotel. Once again friendly staff and a really good piano player who made our stay extra special. They made time to have a quick chat and ask us what we did that day. They even seemed interested in our answer. Would not hesitate to say there again.

Reviews.Title: “Once upon a time, this was a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: thehups
Reviews.Content: In reading the reply from "OmniMgrLosAngeles, Executive Office" on June 7th from a less than favorable May 15th posting, I honestly had to laugh. As an upper level member of Omni Select, I can honestly say this hotel used to care. The staff used to make an effort which I have not seen during my past three visits and it was hit or miss before that. For them to state "Additionally, each of our associates is empowered to take ownership of any guest challenges of which they are made aware, in order to find a prompt, amiable resolution for him/her. We never wish for a guest to leave us unhappyâ€� couldnâ€™t be further from the truth in my experience. During my last visit was given the exact opposite of the room in my select guest profile. Running late for an event that evening, didn't have time to go back down to the front desk to deal with it and figured it would be ok. It was until during the middle of the night when the alarm in the elevator went off. When they showed up an hour later to fix it, guess where they stood to discuss their strategy? Directly in front of our room! When leaving the next morning, this was mentioned to a manager in the elevator who asked how our stay was. Their reply was "I didn't know how about that but how was the rest of your stay?" This was again mentioned to someone at the front desk who said "we thought that was resolved more quickly." Their select guest ambassador left a voice message two days later wanting to discuss why we had the wrong room....but has never returned an email that I have sent or phone call that I've placed in the past two months. No one ever made the effort to answer why there was stained carpet or the smell of smoke in our non-smoking room. Trip before? The complimentary pressing was late by three hours and then brought back a new shirt stained, a fire alarm went off all night (it was kids in the hotel according to management) and having to negotiate with the front desk how the movie my daughter tried to watch never worked and I was not watching the same movie twice. I sent a letter off to their corporate office to see if they are empowered to take care of their guests as I'm still looking for someone at this hotel who is.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and will definitely come back again!”
Reviews.Author: alittleangel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are from Sydney, Australia and visited LA for our first time in early May and stayed at Omni for 3 nights. We arrived late, yet our check-in was swift. The room was beautiful with very comfortable bedding and pillows (exactly how it's seen on the website)! It was clean and quiet. There was complimentary tea/coffee or other drinks every morning with delivery to your room door! As for the location, it's not in the most exciting town in LA, but it's very close to metro station (Pershing Square) which is only 10 mins walk away. So you can easily take the metro to Hollywood or universal studio (about 30 mins ride). We then returned to LA for our last night stay before returning to Sydney after travelling to other parts of United States as part of our 4 weeks holiday. We chose Omni again as we felt it was the best hotel we've stayed in so far. We had reserved for the same room (king), but upon arrival, we were upgraded to a private floor with our own private lounge! There were complimentary drinks, desserts, and breakfast served! We couldn't ask for more. Service was exceptional and it feels good to be treated as a valued customer! My husband and I will definitely stay in Omni again whenever we travel to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again... in an LA minute”
Reviews.Author: Zzamm
Reviews.Content: Very, very nice experience! From check-in to check-out, all was positive. Didn't get any hassle from the front desk re. our $120 a night (all taxes, etc included) priceline fee. In fact, got a very nice 17th floor king room. Room was very nice -- left nothing to be desired. Our Omni membership got us free in-room morning coffee Valets & parking was simple & cordial. Lots of facilities & very well maintained public spaces.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel rated 4 stars in Expedia etc...”
Reviews.Author: MikeRadio
Reviews.Content: This hotel rated 4 stars in Expedia etc. Well it is horrible and the service is worse than that. The beds are new and comfy and the toilet has a powerful flush, but that's the end of the good stuff. The rooms haven't been updated since the '70s. The TVs are old boxs with no sleep control. The furniture and carpet was stained and nasty. They even have a phone in the bathroom.... Very fancy in 1979. There was cakes of dust buildup in the air vent in the bathroom. The worst is they lost 1 of 2 packages I had sent there. They said it didn't come. Then finally found it under a different guest name. I warned them about the 2nd package. They called my cell when if arrived. Great. What I got back to the hotel they said no package came and nobody called me. I refused to leave the front desk after a heated discussion with the desk manager and finally they found it. This was after saying I was wrong about everything. Keep away from here. No more Omni for me.

Reviews.Title: “Solidly Satisfying Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tellurian
Reviews.Content: None of the hotels listed by the housing bureau for a recent conference in Los Angeles had consistently good reviews. When I found that the Omni had better rates as well as more raves than rants, I booked it independently. It proved to be a great choice from pre-arrival to departure. Ahead of time, I sent an e-mail with a special room request, since I would be arriving late in the day. I received a prompt, reassuring reply and when I arrived, all was in order. I was warmly welcomed by everyone at the front doors and desk and my Select Guest Folio was at the ready. (You would have to be nuts to not enroll in the Omniâ€™s loyalty program, as it delivers very meaningful perks from the first stay.) My room was terrific; everything was clean and in working order. Bedding was super-comfortable; the bath was spacious and all expected amenities were provided. Housekeeping did a fine job daily and the daily beverage service was a treat. The wireless service worked flawlessly (and was free for Select Guest Members.) While the Omni is about a half-hour walk to the Los Angeles Convention Center, public transportation and cabs were quick options as was a walk to a nearby hotel on the conference housing list that had continuous loop shuttle service. Close by I enjoyed the Grand Central Market, the Walt Disney Concert Hall and the Museum of Contemporary Art. It was a great stay, right through the sincere farewell from the front desk and I would not hesitate to choose the Omni again for future Los Angeles business or leisure stays. The Omni delivered a perfect balance of service, comfort and value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for exploring LA, business orientated but great for tourists”
Reviews.Author: rendesvouz99
Reviews.Content: In addition to all the great reviews here, some specifics: - Become an Omni Select Member (via their website) before booking and let them know you are a member when you check in. Benefits include free wifi, 2 free beverages each morning per guest, and a few other bits and pieces. - Great location for LA tourists...LA is a huge city: nearly all tours will pick up at the Omni, or it is only 5 minutes from a Metro station which gets you to Hollywood and Universal Studios. - The Big Blue Bus stops near the hotel and is a cheap and easy way to get to Santa Monica to spend a day at the beach. - Although this is primarily a business hotel, it is fantastic for tourists too...quier, spacious and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great room, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: jazzbass
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Omni, and were very impressed with the accommodations and the staff. The room was spacious (we had the good fortune to be upgraded to a suite). The desk staff and the concierge were extremely helpful and cordial. The hotel is close to Grand Central Market and the Pershing Square subway stop. There's a nearby Starbucks and convenience store just outside in California Plaza. I'm not certain that downtown is the best base of operations for a trip to LA, but it we were very pleased with the location and amenities at the Omni and feel confident recommending it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelXpert225
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a weekend getaway with my wife and we were truly amazed with the excellent service and added amenities. If you are a member of the Omni Club program, you receive plenty for your money. The room we got was spacious and clean overlooking the fountains on the Plaza. The hotel atmosphere is nice and the staff very friendly and welcoming. I recommend for weekend getaways, business travelers and families who want to be in the city center close to Hollywood and the underground.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful way to enjoy LA”
Reviews.Author: AventuraChica
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I stayed here for three nights and had such an unbelievable experience! Before we got to the hotel, I made sure to sign up for their â€˜Select Guestâ€™ program. When we got there, we didnâ€™t have to wait to check in, as we were able to use Express Check-in already had our card and mini bar key nicely packaged, waiting for us to collect it. As a Select Guest, we got a complimentary bottle of water on our first night. We also got to order morning beverages of our choice, and we had pots of hot chocolate and coffee and small bottles of water delivered to our room, free of charge. It was a nice touch to enjoy those as we were getting dressed to head out for the day. The entire hotel is very trendy and chic. The room was beautiful, with a beautiful view of downtown LA. The bathroom is quite spacious with a separate bath tub and shower enclosure. The hotel has an excellent location as itâ€™s within walking distance to restaurants and attractions such as the Staples Centre and the Grammy Museum at L.A. Live. It is also within walking distance of the Metro Station and it is easily accessible by buses as well. We ordered room service one night cause we were feeling too tired to go down to the restaurant. They were very prompt and told us within 30 minutes weâ€™d get our food, and it came exactly on time. The waiter actually brought an entire table into the room, so we were able to comfortably eat! It also shows you how very spacious the room is! The food was extremely good. On our second night, we had drinks in the NoÃ« Bar. The Bar had a wonderful ambience, service was excellent, and again, the food was amazing. Throughout our stay, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We asked a staff member at the check-in counter about getting around in the city, as we were prepared to use the public bus. However, she advised us against that and instead recommended that we use the Dash as that was much safer. She even gave us a timetable so weâ€™d know how to plan our trip and recommended that we use the complimentary town car to get around to nearby places. We were able to take the town car to get a lift across to the Metro Station, in order to take the train to Hollywood. The driver gave us a business card with his name and the hotelâ€™s number for us to call him upon our return, so that he could come back and pick us up. The valet was also so friendly that he offered to take some pictures of us both outside and inside the hotelâ€™s lobby. Overall, our entire stay was fantastic. It was our first trip to LA and staying at the Omni Hotel gave us a true flavour of what the city is all about. The hotel had all these little touches that made you feel very special. Itâ€™s something that you would expect to get at a more expensive hotel, but yet you get it for a very affordable rate. If you have to go to LA, Iâ€™d highly recommend that you stay at the Omni. The next time I travel to the USA, Iâ€™m definitely going to try and find another Omni Hotel to stay in!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ticoSanJose
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 2 nights when I arrived to LAX. It is located near the Disney Concert Hall and Downtown. There is a Starbucks, mini market and a Panda Express in the plaza right behind the hotel. The hotel offered fresh lemonade every evening at the lobby. The staff was very helpful, specially Abel the driver who took us with the complementary town car service to MacyÂ´s a couple of blocks away. It seems a luxurious hotel in the website, but it is an average hotel with some fancy details.

Reviews.Title: “luxurious and high quality rooms and professional classy employees, from reception area to cleaning personnel”
Reviews.Author: giigisnowflake
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my recent 4 nite stay at the OMNI in mid April. The reception area and interior design of the hotel is very attractive and friendly, cozy at the same time. The room was lovely, clean, QUIET!!, and well maintained. I very much appreciated the small shop near the breakfast area, in the shop I was able to buy great scones at a reasonable price. All of the employees , from the reception area, shop personnel, cleaning folks, were helpful and pleasant in responding to questions, they seemed to be happy to work at OMNI the hotel is in a newly restored area in L.A. and one can walk a few blocks and see architectural fantasy land if one is interested, especially the Disney Concert Hall which is an architectural gem. I visited family living in L.A. which took me to Laguna Beach, beautiful landscaping, flowers, beach walk overlooking the ocean, sensational!! who needs Hawaii?? also visited the LA arboretum and botanical gardens all in all I can't wait to stay at the Omni again Gigi

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for business trip!”
Reviews.Author: moviechic8
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in downtown LA for a business trip. It is everything I expect from a hotel I have to stay at for business - clean, modern, quiet, good location and hospitable staff. My MUSTS for work travel are clean rooms and quiet hotels and this hotel exceeded both expectations. Rooms are clean and very spacious! Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: McCann-Cheshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on the way to Las Vegas. Collected a hire car from LAX airport and it took us about 25 mins to reach the hotel. Valet parking was $30 per night and we booked our room direct on their website and got the best rate which included breakfast. The room was nice and clean with a reasonable view and nice coffee machine. the location was within walking distance of the staples center with nice bars and restaurants although we didn't feel safe walking back in the evening. A good hotel with good facilities, we had a drink at their bar which although nice service it was so dark I couldn't see my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property in Downtown L.A.”
Reviews.Author: slsiege
Reviews.Content: I came to L.A. to visit friends and family and to attend performances at the Music Center and the Walt Disney Concert Hall. The Omni is the closest hotel to those locations, and it was fortunate that I could get a reasonable weekend rate that included parking and their breakfast buffet, both of which are usually pricey. The hotel itself is wonderful. The public spaces are open and lovely. My king bedroom was spacious and clean, with a view of the Museum of Contemporary Art (next door) and the Disney hall. Service throughout was quiet, cheerful and exemplary. This extends to the breakfast room, where the cook at the omelet station will fix eggs any way you please. Things to note: the TVs have not yet been upgraded to flatscreen, and sheets are changed every third day unless you specify otherwise. They will try to nickel-and-dime you if you're not careful, not just at the mini-bar but with the snacks lying next to it and that bottle of mineral water in the bathroom. Also, the computers in the lobby are $6.95 for 15 minutes, plus more for printing. However, boarding passes are free, and the concierge will print out directions to local landmarks for you on request.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic stay at the Omni LA”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeMike
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 nights at the Omni LA for a family vacation (spouse, 9 and 13 year old daughters), and I would highly recommend it for business or pleasure travel. It was a fantastic value for such a high quality hotel, especially if you sign up for the Omni loyalty program before your visit, which gets you free in-room WiFi and a free morning beverage. Our destinations were all over the LA area - from Malibu to Westwood to Burbank to Pasadena - so the downtown location of the Omni was pretty convenient. The staff were accommodating, helpful and friendly without being in your face. The bathroom had both a tub and a shower; the beds were super comfortable; the room was clean and odor free and quiet. Check in and check out were effortless. The valet parking wasn't cheap, but it was convenient and fast and allowed us to come and go without worry.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, nice restaurant/piano bar”
Reviews.Author: Geeitsabigworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over a weekend in April. The rates were really cheap because it was the weekend. The room was luxurious. The beds were only doubles not queens so my son ended up sleeping on the armchair. The bar/restaurant had a great laid back feel to it and the piano player was terrific. There is a large convenience store under the hotel close to the plaza used by the weekday office workers. There is also a small Starbucks within the hotel. We discovered during our trip in the USA that this isn't unusual. Starbucks are everywhere and although I dislike their coffee in Australia I didn't mind it in USA. The hotel charges for internet but if you join the Select Guest program (free to join) one of the benefits is the internet is then free. The hotel is close to the inner city. We walked to the Staples Centre to get tickets to the ice hockey on the morning of the game and walked back there that night for the game. We felt safe walking around the city during daylight. One thing we wished we had done was every Saturday morning there are guided tours of the city http://www.laconservancy.org/tours/tours_main.php4 We walked past a group doing the tour and it seemed very popular. We also caught the train out to Hollywood. The train station is within walking distance of the Omni and the train station in Hollywood is right in the middle of Hollywood. Very convenient. It costs $1.25 one way.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the last time...and that's saying something”
Reviews.Author: lefty713
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last September and thought it was great. Stayed here this past weekend and it was even better. Upon check-in I was asked it was o.k. that my room was #1313. Since I was born on the 13th, I had absolutely issue with it, but was impressed that they asked. When I got to my room after leaving for a lite lunch I found a hand-written card thanking me for selecting the Omni, along with a nice bottle of boutique bottled water, another nice touch. This corner room had fabulous views of downtown L.A., and it was big, comfy and spotless. Love that there was a tub as well as a separate shower. Bed was firm but not too firm, and at the same time was soft but not too soft. Just right. Everyone I dealt with, from car park attendants, to doormen, to front-desk and concierge personnel was prompt, friendly and professional. It was a great night's stay at a brand that I am rapidly becoming more and more thrilled with.

Reviews.Title: “thumbs down”
Reviews.Author: sunsurfandsand
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed @ the Omni in LA. The room was not spacious. The housekeeping was lacking. My room was not cleaned until late afternoon. I was totally disgusted when I witnessed pool area being cleaned using the dirty pool water. The fitness area is okay but not inspiring. The television was not flat screen in our room. \Valet parking is $30 daily. On the plus side the staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: alih68
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights pre-cruise at the Omni. We really enjoyed our stay, the rooms were spacious and comfortable, the entrance and public rooms were beautiful, and the staff were friendly and accomodating. We didn't use the hotel's shuttle bus, but the area between the hotel and the subway could be a bit scary at night. We weren't sure about staying in Downtown LA, but public transport is brilliant and everywhere was really easy to get to. We didn't eat or drink at the hotel as we found both to be very expensive but there was a nice pizza/pasta place across the road which also sold great cocktails,

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: travelnow2009
Reviews.Content: on business in LA for 6 days, great stay at the Hotel, facilities top notch, and excellent staff, great housekeeping. fitness centre and pool clean and handy. Piano bar at night was busy with good atmosphere. will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Decent business hotel, rooms adequate but a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: ListenerLondon
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed five nights. Courteous and helpful staff, many useful amenities included in reasonable price (e.g. WiFi) as 'Select' guest. Quick check in and out. Car valet service was $30/night, which added up over a five-night stay, but was convenient and efficient. Comfortable bed, but room seemed a bit outdated. Downtown location is good for business, not so good for social ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Hotel in Bunker Hill Financial Area”
Reviews.Author: Nickalex
Reviews.Content: Upscale hotel in the middle of downtown on Bunker Hill. Close to many things and DASH bus is only 25c (10c if youâ€™re 65) for jaunts around town. Hotel offers town car service for trips within a 3-mile radius. DASH took me to Union Station for 10c; cab back at 9 pm cost $8. Cheerful Concierge helped me extend parking from $5 for 2 hours to $5 for all evening so friends could meet me for dinner at Noe Restaurant. Chambermaid always had a sunny smile. I was very happy to stay at the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the heart of downtown Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: uclady
Reviews.Content: The Omni is primarily a business hotel given that it is adjacent to many banks and office buildings; but my husband and I spent a lovely weekend there during a hobby convention. The service was top-notch and because we joined their loyalty program, every morning complimentary coffee and orange juice were delivered to our door. Everyone on the staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel restaurant is pricey, as we expected, but there are several more reasonable options nearby. The Omni is next to Angel's Flight and in walking distance of the Music Center, Museum of Contemporary Art, and the LA Subway.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: jax11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days while our daughter was touring USC. This lovely hotel met and exceeded our expectations. The staff, without exception, was helpful and warm; the room was large, clean and stylish and the free car service came in very handy! Easy access to the freeways and especially to USC. Hotel parking was a bit pricey but the service timely and accommodating. I'd recommend joining Omni's frequent traveler club, the amenities are a great value.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: kristinnoelle
Reviews.Content: stayed at the omni downtown LA feb. 2010. 2 rooms, adjoining for 2 nights. PROS: wonderful, large, clean rooms with floor to ceiling windows where we read and watched people around the fountains. beds were very comfortable. quiet. large bathrooms. room with 2 queens had a bath with tub/shower and also a separate shower. other king room with a tub/shower combo. took the free shuttle car to staples center twice. nice and quick service. my husband and i upgraded to the CLUB level status and THOROUGHLY enjoyed the buffet breakfast and drink hors de vours in the evening. the hors de vours were not just nuts and chips- lovely, shrimp- fruits, cheeses, and hot egg rolls one night- something else hot the other night. breakfast was very tasty as well. WELL worth the $50 per night cost. house red wine was GREAT! husband enjoyed his fill of Jack. fitness center was well equipped with equipment as well as medicine balls, etc. not busy at all- but we waited til 9am to work out (>: CONS: not many to mention. the tv's were the old, large models. they need to upgrade to flat screens. valet parking was $30 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for business meeting”
Reviews.Author: SF94597
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, however nothing stands out as exceptional. I was there for a business meeting so it met my needs for location. Bed was comfortable. I personally prefer more counter space in bathrooms & the sink had a crack in it. Gym had nice equipment, but all treadmills & eliptical machines were in use by a few minutes after 5am so seemed small for size of hotel. I liked that there was a little convenience store & a bunch of decent places to grab lunch within the block due to the business location. Hotel food was good. Since I'm not a regular at Omni hotels, didn't get the turn-down service -- saw the cart & looked like nice treats. Front desk was friendly & efficient.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience, will come back”
Reviews.Author: bluelava
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend our wedding anniversary at this hotel and were delighted with the experience. Everyone seemed every courteous and helpful. The kids were thrilled to receive their own Omni kids backpack filled with goodies. The room was adequate with a great view of the Water Court. We dined at the Noe and the Grand Cafe and received excellent services both times. The quality of food was way better than the normal "hotel food". The only imperfection would be the in-room TV not being updated to the flat panel one yet.

Reviews.Title: “Upper class hotel worth the money”
Reviews.Author: JandKQLD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel for 5 nights and throughly enjoyed our time. The staff were very courteous and professional, aswell as friendly. The check in was very easy and quick and they let us check in 2 hours early as we were very tired from travelling. Room was spacious and very clean. Bathroom was very good too. They have a town car that will drop you and pick you up as a courtesy within a 3 mile radius. The hotel is on the list of pick ups for most tour places. Has some fantastic food places around the hotel. Recommend it for business as it does have a very good conference area. Love it and will refer it to everyone. Do recommend getting onto the Omni website and signing up as a select guest, as it is free, to get free Wi-Fi and other services.

Reviews.Title: “Average business-oriented hotel. Not a top choice.”
Reviews.Author: Maast
Reviews.Content: Had to stay there for a few days during a big fair at LACC, so value for money was definitely not good. Very average hotel, not too bad but without any outstanding feature. Was upgraded, which was a nice gesture, so had access to the quite nice business lounge at the top of the hotel with a nice view. However the rooms were very average and the hotel has no charm. Ok for business, but very dull if it's for holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great room”
Reviews.Author: Nath85
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed stay at Omni, Parking was a bit of an expense and then the whole tipping the valet each time can become costly when your paying 35 dollars a day to park. Room and restaurant was great only issue we had was the tv remote was broke but they soon replaced it for us. If your looking for a classy hotel in a great location and close to the freeway to get to universal and other attractions this is it, we would stay here again if wanting to be in the center

Reviews.Title: “Best Place For A Meeting”
Reviews.Author: travelinbunny
Reviews.Content: I coordinated a small, one day meeting, with attendees from all over the country, at this hotel. The staff treated our small meeting like we were the most important people staying at the hotel, which was absolutely not true (especially since the NY Rangers were staying there that night, too, and meeting in the conference room right next to ours). The staff were amazing, super helpful and super friendly. The meeting rooms were great, with natural light and good acoustics. The food was good, too. My hotel room was fantastic! I was checked in upon arrival at 10AM. Turn down service was provided and I received a note and a tray of food from the hotel, thanking us for choosing to have our meeting there. The location is great for downtown. Right across the street is the Gehry designed Museum of Contemporary Art. The immediate outdoor area is a very peaceful and pleasant courtyard area with water features and restaurants. It took us about 30 minutes via cab to get to West Hollywood for dinner one night. But, it was only about a 15 minute walk from the Omni to The Standard Downtown for a dated and expensive rooftop scene. Although I'm pretty sure the Omni is outside my price range as a private citizen, I truly hope my employer sends me down to LA again so I can stay here one more time. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't meet my expectations”
Reviews.Author: mrdrinkle
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for valentines day with my girlfriend. We opted to get the Concierge Lounge Access. The room: Clean and roomy, but it had a musky smell that bothered me. I turned up the A/C so the smell disappeared. The room was missing it's robes and toothbrushes. I noticed that at the Hilton toothbrushes are available upon request and it was nice they had it in the room. Called the front desk and it took them 15-20 min to bring upstairs, which was much longer than expected. Bathroom: One bathtub and one shower, which I thought was very cool. The tissue box had some sort of nice setup of tissues on top, but once I took those off there was two tissues left on inside the box. This wasn't an issue until I needed them to blow my nose later in the evening. The bathroom is very clean and bright. Pool: The pool was pretty small and I think it was 3' 6" deep. After seeing the pool I walked away in my swimming trunks back to the room. It's understandable that hotels in downtown LA don't have the space for large pools. Lounge/concierge access: Well worth the extra cost! At 5-9 there are wines, beers, and spirits available. It's open bar so you can drink to your hearts content while relaxing in a large clean room with a nice view outside. The wine tasted okay, there was whiskey, vodka, and congac. Those basically cover my three favorite spirits. They had Heineken, Sapporo, and Corona. There was plenty of munchies to go along with all the alcohol. If you like to drink and relax then opt for this package. Service: For some reason I didn't like the front desk service. I wasn't greeted properly when checking in or checking out. Sort of felt robotic to me and I was almost offended that I didn't get the same greeting as the gentleman in front of me. It was almost as if my age or race had something to do with the level of service I would receive. On the other hand the valet staff and doorman was very friendly. I stayed here instead of at the Kimpton because I chatted with their online rep. She managed to convince me to give Omni a try, which I did and was a bit disappointed at their level of service. I understand that it was valentines day and it might be busy, but I stayed at the Hilton Huntington beach last Valentines day and the service was as good as any other day. Will I stay here again? It's hard to say no because the value was very good, but what turns me off was service, which I less than what I expected from the number one rated hotel in Downtown Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and comfort merit return trip”
Reviews.Author: Phoebe059
