Reviews.Content: The downtown location next to the Museum of Contemporary Art and the Disney Concert Hall was superb. They have a free shuttle service for trips within 3 miles, which we used to go to Union Station. The bed was extremely comfortable. The breakfast buffet, although expensive, was very good. Minor complaints include no reading light near the lounge chair, having to ask twice for a tourist map of the area and charges for parking when we didn't have a car. We plan to stay here again for our next trip to L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Difficult Location.”
Reviews.Author: va_sumners
Reviews.Content: This hotel was magnificent. From check-in to check-out I was treated like royalty. Make sure you sign up for the Omni Rewards before you go to receive complimentary drinks each morning. Also, make sure you try the strawberry water in the lobby. My husband left a special coin behind and the hotel located it and had it to us via Fed-Ex within two days. The bed was wonderful along with the couch and chair. The only negative thing about this hotel is the location. They will provide a car to go within 3 miles, but if you want to go to Beverly Hills or Rodeo Drive you have to take a $$ Cab $$ or ride the stinky bus. You can take a subway to Hollywood and Universal Studios which is a perk. Overall, the hotel is a wonderful place to stay if you want to enjoy yourself for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, will not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: jag79
Reviews.Content: We had a great couple of days at the Omni. Given the great price, this hotel is absolutely wonderful. The location is perfect and we found the staff extremely friendly/helpful. Would recommend without any qualms.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: tenenbaum
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Hotelopia which gave us the cheapest rate. It was very good value for money and I understand that it is the NO1 in LA but I would never want to pay the full price. The Lobby is very nice. The room was big, comfortable and clean. The staff was very friendly. The hotel is also fairly nice located in downtown LA. Shops and restaurants are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “My hotel home away from home!! I love this hotel and its staff!”
Reviews.Author: alwaysontheroad99
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Omni several times a month for well over a year now, and the quality, genuine care and attention they pay to me and every guest I've observed is simply outstanding! What fantastic service, with NO execeptions!! Front desk, all of the bell desk staff, including, management, concierge, electricians, housekeeping, restaurant and bar, who did I leave out?? The hotel is lovely, my room is always terrific, the location is convenient to everything, and I really look forward to seeing everyone whenever I return for another stay. Update those TV's and you'll be five star all the way!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: brachiopod
Reviews.Content: The best service and most helpful staff of any hotel I have stayed, period. From the concierge, to the desk clerks to the parking valets, everyone was friendly and generously helpful. Location is great, adjacent to the MOCA museum and close to Little Tokyo and Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: LelaM
Reviews.Content: Has everything the business traveller needs, comfy beds, good showers - it works.

Reviews.Title: “First class service”
Reviews.Author: Cherts
Reviews.Content: I recently stated at the Omni LA whilst on holiday in California. Had a great stay and would return to the Omni if I revisit LA. The hotel is really comfortable but the staff were superb. In all areas, reception, housekeeping etc they were really helpful, polite, and efficient. Whilst the hotel is downtown it is handy for a number of things such as the Staples Centre, Walt Disney Concert Hall, Olivera Street and Union St Station. There is a Metro Station nearby.which is cheap and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Plush relaxing peace in the center of downtown L.A.”
Reviews.Author: washbrol
Reviews.Content: The Omni L.A. is a plush comfortable peaceful oasis in the middle of downtown Los Angeles. Service is top quality, with polite, calm, pleasant and efficient staff that get you moving to your room with all speed. A smart cozy bar upstairs reminds one of a private social club's premises, with dark colors, ample use of wood and far from crowded. My room was spacious and centered around a wonderful big bed, covered in layer upon layer of soft linens and blankets. Quite bright and airy, the windows offered a view into the city streets below, and the hills in the distance (but as any hotel in downtown L.A., nothing remarkable). The room included the further top quality features to be expected of an Omni, such as large plasma tv, stereo, etc. A perfect high quality breakfast is available in your room, complete with little brewed pot of top coffee, fresh orange juice, pastries, and more. Valet parking is available in front and I believe a garage is available nearby. The overall style of the hotel is classical luxury with a modern touch. Very very nice. Despite it not being near anything that is particularly interesting to me (the Disney Music Hall/Opera/Symphony is next door), I would certainly enjoy staying at this Omni again.

Reviews.Title: “Best of 3 Downtown LA Hotels I Know, but LA Still Could Do Better”
Reviews.Author: EastBayTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night for business. The property's main entrance is pretty spiffy, the lobby is nicely done, and the front desk is easy to find. The check in was easy and pretty friendly, but not super warm (but it was after midnight). The room is good-sized, maybe a little above average. Great bed. Good desk. Plenty of light. Bathroom above-average size. Nice counter. Very good water pressure. Plenty of light. Towels and soap, etc. all pretty nice, and bonus points for real Kleenex. TV is old-style, but good-sized. Maybe a dozen movies to choose from, which is below-average. No key for the mini-bar, and I was too lazy to get one. Good selection of unrefrigerated snacks, maybe too good (and a few odd things thrown in, like bath salts). The bar, where I was for approximately sixty seconds, was pretty cheesy -- the piano guy was actually playing "Piano Man." Terrific location to towers along Grand and the Music Center is just a block or so away. I think I like it more than Biltmore and Checkers, and this is my downtown LA hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, great hotel in the heart of downtown L.A.”
Reviews.Author: Semantica
Reviews.Content: The Omni is an excellent hotel. The service is top-notch. The only thing keeping this hotel from getting an "excellent" rating is the pool and spa facility, it is dismal to say the least. That said, I am not much of a pool/spa person so it didn't affect the quality of my stay but I could see other people being dissappointed. I can't say enough about the staff at this hotel, they exceeded my expectations consistently throughout my week long stay. The food was excellent and reasonably priced the Noe bar and restaurant was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but the area that it is in isn't nice”
Reviews.Author: annfg2
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful and a great place to stay, but the only problem it is in the business area of downtown LA and you need a car to visit other areas. Not much to do here if you don't have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Omni!”
Reviews.Author: Bluegrove
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a business trip to LA and stayed at the Omni for four nights. While my husband was attending meetings, I was able to take advantage of some wonderful sights thanks to excellent advice from Amy, the concierge on duty! She was especially helpful in making suggestions for tours and restaurants that we would like and was so friendly whenever she saw me in the hotel! All of the staff went out of their way to be of service from the bellman to the housekeeping staff. I cannot imagine a more pleasant group of people to assist you on your business or pleasure stay in LA. Our room was perfectly comfortable in every respect. I would highly recommend this hotel and its location in downtown LA. We appreciated the services of the Omni driver when going to restaurants that were a bit too far to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Brings a Special Sparkle to your trip...”
Reviews.Author: sonia_london
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the wonderful Omni for 5 nights whilst visting LA for a jet-setting birthday trip from London. Our stay was flawless! I wouldn't normally announce such a bold statement; but having stayed at several places through business and leisure trips- I can truly say this hotel and it's team of endearing staff brought a special sparkle to our holiday. My top three highlights: Beautiful Rooms It is extremley spacious and cleanliness is spotless. The bed is divine and the most comfortable slumber I have had in a long while! The bathroom is again well-spaced and all the amenties are perfect. Beautifully kept by great housekeeping :-) Splendid Bell staff (located near the entrance of the hotel) This team is exceptional! Often the unsung hero's hence I feel it is important to make a mention :-) They look after everything from calling a taxi, collecting your car, greeting you from your night out, asking about your plans for the day. This warm welcome provides a special touch to the hotel experience. Outstanding Conceirge Team of one but a grand service to all guests. Amy provided regular programmes for our day trips around LA. Her recommendations are superb and never disappoint. If I knew earlier I wouldn't have spent so much time on my personal research!! She also organised a special birthday cake sent to our room on the actual day. A beautiful gesture and very touching. Amy's personal efforts and desire to ensure guests have a memorable visit have been the 'icing on cake'... Thank you so much and you are an absolute star to the Omni brand name.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nickinyorkshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel as part of a 3 day visit to LA before joining a Golden Princess Cruise to Hawaii. The Hotel is top quality and although we did not use many of the Hotel facilities, the overall ambience and staff that we encountered were extremely good and helpful. The Hotel is situated in the business district which is well documented but access to the Freeway is easy and I found driving quite easy despite the volume of cars that makes UK motorways look like empty country roads. Highly recommended and thank you Omni!

Reviews.Title: “solid business hotel”
Reviews.Author: sfca18
Reviews.Content: For business travelers, Omni seems to be the best hotel in downtown LA. I've stayed at Biltmore and Hilton Checkers, and had an all-day business meeting in a suite at Westin Bonaventure. Omni is best. As others have said, join the frequest guest program for free wifi and complimentary breakfast drinks delivered to door. Also, checking in and out becomes a breeze -- like Hertz #1 Gold. I had a corner room on low floor. Overlooked the street and plaza. It was surprisingly quiet. Spacious too. Room had well-appointed furnishings. Overall, a solid business travel experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Stay In LA”
Reviews.Author: CarlNova
Reviews.Content: My three-night stay at the Omni, one of my favorite hotel chains, was a high point during my first-ever visit to So CAL. The hotel was clean, quiet, and well kept. The staff was awesome. Rooms are spacious, and the beds...HEAVENLY. All I was to get during check-in was complementary Evian, but instead we ended up with chocolate-covered strawberries, a nice treat after 13-hours on the train. By far one of the better stays during our 3-week cross-country trip. And love the free newspaper, free morning beverage, and $3/$4 breakfast pastries that Omni offers. Top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for a better start to our trip”
Reviews.Author: IandNizz
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading the many favourable reviews on here and was not disappointed. We arrived in the late evening after along flight from the UK to be greeted by Gary on reception, who made us feel extremely welcome (his name was only one of a few we remembered from all our trip) and booked us into a fantastic room a Business premier room which we were not expecting, on finding out later that we were on a trip to celebrate our civil partnership (Honeymoon) he gave us access to Club facilities for the duration of our stay, which after having experienced would have gladly paid for. Everything about our stay from start to finish was faultless, staff exceptional in their approach to genuine customer service which made us feel valued. Concierge provided excellent advice and recommendations. Have to mention the Select Guest programme,this has to be the best one for the extras whilst staying at the hotel, the morning coffee, juice and papers the best start to the day you could get. I am aware that the hotel will be starting a programme of renovation and I look forward to seeing how this improves on a good product already ( Yes the rooms are a bit dated at the moment furnishing wise but this never detracted from our enjoyment - We wish them well during the programme) This was our first time staying at a Omni hotel and as Mandarin Oriental fans have now added a new hotel chain to our own preference list, I feel the Omni are a very understated chain and will and have been recommending others to give them a try. Thanks Omni for the best start to our 'honeymoon'.!

Reviews.Title: “great service & location to enjoy L.A.”
Reviews.Author: The_Roosters
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week en at Omni Hotel and I'll choose it again in future if I'll go back to Los Angeles. Spacious rooms and a great service, from the concierge (Daniel) who helped us in choosing the best bus guide to have a look at the most important sights of the city to restaurants (Ciudad is a Latin good one and it's in the neighbourhood) to the free shuttle service to move from the Hotel to some places close to the hotel. Then, you can go by walk to the Walt Disney Concert Hall and the Moma, they really are around the corner. The subway is 5 minutes by walk. I'd say it's excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Perks With Program Membership”
Reviews.Author: Bekkiz
Reviews.Content: We were had tickets to a concert at a near by theater, and the Omni stuck out as a great location near to the venue. They had some great rates through the website, so it was an easy decision! We also joined the Omni loyalty program because you receive free wifi as a member. The hotel was reasonably easy to find, and the valet was very prompt on both drop-off and pick-up. We were checking in quite late at night, and I had called ahead to let them know. Check-in took about 1 minute because they had everything ready for us. As a program member, you also get free morning beverages. They provide a little card for the doorknob, and in the morning we received orange juice and bottled water! The room service would have charged us about $15 for that! Certainly worth the five minutes it took to sign up. The room was quite comfortable and clean. And actually pretty spacious for a city hotel. We were very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Omni-Clean, central, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: VeganTraveler3
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights during a conference. Be sure to sign up for the free "Select Guest" online and you will get free wireless access while you are there as well as free coffee/tea/juice/newspaper each morning. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The hotel staff was great during the meals that were served and the doormen very helpful. I had a great massage and their staff was friendly and pleasant. And you can't beat being right in the middle of downtown. Museums all around you, great architecture everywhere. It is expensive, even with a the discount our group got. But hey, that's pretty normal for a big city.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: tootyfancy
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a Saturday night- my second time staying in downtown LA (the first was at the JW Marriott). Got a $85 deal from Priceline (4star/dwntwn). The hotel was great. The bed and linens were really nice. The window opened up a crack to let some fresh in. Even found a great deal on parking- free! Look around for a spot on the streets if you are staying on the weekend. It's metered, so read the signs, but you can get by without paying the $30 valet. There's also a pay-park down at the corner. Bus stop is close by- took it to Dodger Stadium. Drove into Chinatown, Little Tokyo (a must! and you could probably walk there), and the Arts District for Wurstkuche french fries and beer. Downtown has lots of great food choices. Moca is next door. Only negative was the price of drinks at the Noe bar. It will set you back $32 for 2 martini's. I'd definately stay again but BYO next time.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: megsmom4865
Reviews.Content: We are staying here now. We have stayed a few times before, years ago and my teenage daughter wanted to stay her again, instead of the other 4* hotel down the street. Last time we stayed here, they let me have the amenities of being a loyalty member even though we booked through priceline. This time I was told because I booked through priceline, I was not entitled to any of the amenities. We were not asked if we ]wanted 1 bed or 2, even though I have a 13 year old who would have rather gotten her own bed to sleep in. Also, when we got to the room there were used rags and towels on the bathroom floor. I was told someone would be right up to clean them up and this is true. But makes me wonder when I got the call that the plumber was fixing the toliet and forgot the rags, does that mean the floor wasn't cleaned??? I have always liked staying here because no matter how you got the room (direclty or through priceline) they treated you the same. This time I am feeling a little slighted by using priceline. Also, got an older room, where the bathroom sink has a crack in it and alittle worn. Hopefully, when we need to use the towncar tonight, we will not be told "no", because of the pricleine stigma. Also, do not know if there is an age limit on the kid's pack, but my daughter was miffed that she wasn't offered one. We will see how it goes today. Got to leave for Universal.....

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: JinxyCork
Reviews.Content: My first impression of this hotel on arrival was I had made the right choice. The room was amazing, so comfortable and large. It is so clean and modern (on the inside) with very professional and accomodating staff. The location is not great for nightlife but if comfort and good food is your priority then this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “The most attentive staff ever”
Reviews.Author: vanilla06
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Omni over the weekend. We have season tickets to the Ahmanson Theater so this time I thought about staying overnight instead of driving back late at night. This was a good time since the play lasted 3 1/2 hours! Well, we couldn't have picked a more appropriate hotel. The entire staff is to be commended. The doormen are on top of things....never had to open my own door once. And the valet service was quick and courteous. The courtesy car was great. Caught a ride to the theater but on the way back we decided to take a stroll back since it was a nice comfortable night. Upon arriving back at the hotel we had a cocktail at Noe's. What a very pleasant place. The next morning we had breakfast at the Grand Cafe. Beautiful restaurant and again great service. After breakfast we took a stroll around the hotel and took soe great pictures of the skyscrapers surrounding us and all the interesting architecture. The hotel has what seems to be a very high tech modern looking amphitheatre where we sat for awhile to take in our surroundings. The room itself was very nice.....comfy bed, bathrobes, wifi, and even tv speakers in the bath! That was great since I didn't have to miss the football game when I took a shower! All in all it was a very short getaway but one of the most pleasant stays we have had ever! Thank you Omni.....we shall return!

Reviews.Title: “Great, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: desert_red
Reviews.Content: Arrived early in Los Angeles. Was able to check in at hotel at 9 AM local time without a problem. Only stayed one night, but encountered friendly service from the time we arrived until we left. Had two meals in the Cafe and our waitress even remembered us on second trip as well as our drink order from the previous day! Close walk to subway stops allowed for convenient exploration into Hollywood. Makes for a great business or leisure hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: Erika28
Reviews.Content: The Omni Hotel in LA is a very welcoming hotel with spacious rooms & amazing beds! The staff were very helpful, especially the Conceierge and there is also a complimentary car which can be used to take you to a restaurant or complex within a couple of miles of the hotel. The only downfall of this hotel is that its not within walking distance of any restaurants and also it was on the wrong side of town for most of the areas we wanted to see!

Reviews.Title: “Great overall stay”
Reviews.Author: mbose
Reviews.Content: While perhaps a bit overpriced, I found the service and location hard to beat for this hotel. Everyone from the bell hops to the front desk clerks, especially Night Manager Gary Gutierrez who inspite of working by himself at night at the desk still manages to greet and acknowledge everyone professionaly. Awesome character. He's a keeper and an asset to this hotel. to the cleaning staff to be polite, pleasant and willing to help even when unasked. There is an abundance of safe, cheap , and accessible public transporation around, including a shuttle passing the convention center ( 10 minute trip). Gary was more than helpful finding out bus and train info for us. The only downside to the hotel is that it lies in a business area and on weekends, the only thing open are the hands of the many beggars on the street corners.But this is common no matter what hotel you stay at in such a city area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MzPicky
Reviews.Content: I am very picky when it comes to hotels and I felt very comfortable. You can tell the hotel rooms are in need of some renovations, yet it's still very nice. Signed up for loyalty program and glad I did, a little added delight with coffee and juice in the morning. I had a spa treatment (reflexology) it was not worth it, I have had it done before (not here) and enjoyed it. Even with the $30 parking with all the extras you receive was well worth it, especially when you call for your car it there within minutes. I will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “OK, but ageing badly”
Reviews.Author: grand-duc
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights mid-August. I share the views of previous reviewers that service at the hotel is really good! Rooms are OK - standard quality for business hotel, however the hotel (and especially rooms and bathrooms) start to show the signs of age - I guess a refurbishment is required rather urgently. Would I stay at the hotel again? The price was fair, service fair as well - I may consider, but a refurbishement would definitively be necessary....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: bobdealfinder
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my 5 day stay at the Omni. Service was always prompt and pleasant. Concierge (Daniel) was patient and helpful. As stated by other reviewers, join the loyalty program. The extras are nice. I knew that the hotel was due for a remodeling in 2010, So I wasn't disappointed by minor issues in the room, such a cracks in the enamel of the sink. I thought the room was very clean and that housekeeping was unobtrusive and excellent. Even though I booked through a discount site (Priceline) I never felt slighted in any way. The loyalty program was available and we got an excellent room. This is not always the case with other chains where I've gotten obviously smaller rooms or poor room locations. The only difference is you don't get loyalty points and this is fair and clearly stated. Tips. Book when there is no major convention at the convention center and you can bid aggressively on price. On weekends it's easy to find nearby parking inexpensively. The valet service is very quick and during the week it is probably the best if you want in and out privileges. I thought the downtown was very walkable to Little Tokyo, Union Station, Macy's, and the Staples Center. If you walk south, ie Staples Center, be sure and find the Bunker Hill steps and use the escalator coming back up hill. MOCA was nice and we had a free guided tour. The room full of Rothko's was worth the $10 admission. Don't pay more than $40 for seats at Dodger Stadium, The upper decks behind home plate are great seats. Have fun

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vigilanteviajero
Reviews.Content: Nothing to rave about but it was nice. The hotel is well maintained and service is good. Staff is helpfull and professional. Did not use any of their restaurants. Did use the Fitness Center quite a bit; rather small. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: wr943
Reviews.Content: The Omni is a very nice hotel in downtown LA. The service and staff are first rate - actually five star service. The rooms are nice but could use a little update. Beds very comfortable and the room is a great size. Downside there was no flat panel tv and it was on the small side. Another problem was that the hotel had problems with the fire alarm that kept us up half the night, however, the manager took care of us on check out. Overall the hotel is very nice and I would recommend to anyone wanting to stay in downtown LA.

Reviews.Title: “Omni's rooms are very clean, and very curtious, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: ModocCalifornia
Reviews.Content: When I stay at a hotel the main thing I am concerned with is how clean it is. I want my room to be spotless! I can't stand when there is someone elses hair in the tub drain or if the room has a funky smell and I don't want anything to be dusty. I'm very picky about cleanliness so if I stay in a hotel that has any of those things I will never go back! Omni was Great! Soooo CLEAN! I love this place. The beds are comfy, the robes are so cozy and the staff is amazingly friendly and helpful. Another plus, although it's pricey, room service is 24 hours. The only downside to this place is the very expensive parking. $30 a day, Ugh! I will stay here again even though the parking is outrageous. In LA all the parking is outrageous! Better to pay for parking then to get a ticket or leave your car in some obscure parking lot down the street for a few bucks cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Highly Recommended,”
Reviews.Author: kitty22217
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything going for it, good location,spotlessly clean, incredibly quiet and had the most friendly staff - they just didn't put a foot wrong. The entrance is impressive with freshly cut flowers. There are 2 large containers with fruit infused water - which never seemed to run empty -a very welcome refreshment when you arrived back at the hotel every day. Also there was a huge bowl of apples which you could help yourself to. There were 4 elevators so we only ever waited seconds each time. The rooms themselves were spacious , as was the bathroom. The room we had was well appointed overlooking the courtyard with the water fountain. The courtyard adjoining the hotel grounds has lots little food shops where there's a good selection to suit most tastes. Very handy for breakfast. The staff are incredibly friendly and take the time to get to know you ( unusual in a large 'chain' hotel). We ate in the restaurant and in the bar area and were not disappointed, the food was excellent. In the evening you can sit outside in the terrace area and the staff will offer to light the fires for you and they always stopped for a chat. We found them to be polite, courteous and genuinely friendly. If you have a hired car, the valet parking charges at the hotel can add quite a bit to your final bill, so you can opt to park in one of the numerous open air car parks which are nearby and easily accessable although they do not operate an in/out same day system. The concierge will gladly arrange for the complimentary hotel car to take you anyway within 3 miles . There is a good sized fitness centre which leads you through to the pool area which is fairly small but usually empty most days so that's not really a problem. Although the hotel is within easy walking distance of the shops at garment and toy districts, be aware that it is up a fairly steep hill so going is fine but coming back can be a bit tiring but certainly keeps you fit. Would definitely recommend this hotel and will look forward to staying there again in gthe future.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable.”
Reviews.Author: Exploratoria
Reviews.Content: An unforgettable stay in Feb '09. Wish LA was closer, we would visit more often and would always stay at the Omni. Location is great, everything is clean and prepared with love and zeal, like it should be. Concierge Amy Leland is very professional and helpful. We never tried any of the hotel restaurants. Look out for their Mayan hot cocoa in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and simple”
Reviews.Author: sardouk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni in April , and overall we had no complaints. Check in was very easy , the lobby had fresh flowers everyday and the scents were just magical. Our room was very spacious and comparable to some suites in other hotels, and the bathroom was clean with marble floors. We left our rental car with the valet service and they were always fast in bringing it up in the morning and taking it at night. If you are looking for the luxury of a leading hotel , then this is not the place to be, but if you are looking for courteous service, very spacious and clean room then you are at the right place. This is an excellent 4 stars hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: Essie16
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and would be my choice anytime I need to be in downtown L.A. on business. The hotel makes a good impression as soon as you enter: Efficient, polite check in and delivery of my bags. Fruit-infused ice water and apples available in the lobby â€“ pretty nice on a hot L.A. summer day. Free wireless internet and other perks if you join their rewards program. The room is pretty standard, with your typical hotel furnishings; the bed was very comfortable. The only two off-notes during my stay: usually at this price range you get a flat-screen TV these days, but here the TV was a regular TV, with only ok picture quality. I didnâ€™t watch it much, so it wasnâ€™t a problem for me. As another reviewer mentioned, the room had a bit of a sour smell â€“ it wasnâ€™t overpowering, but I wonder whether it was time to replace the carpet. Other than that though, everything was very clean and well-maintained. I didnâ€™t eat at the restaurant, but a breakfast buffet was included in my room rate. It wasnâ€™t over the top, but they offered a good variety of breads, cereals, fresh fruit, and tasty hot dishes, including made to order eggs. The bar offers a happy hour from 4-6 pm, with discounted bar menu. Even if you donâ€™t order food, the drinks come with complimentary peanuts (regular and wasabi), which were delicious and a nice touch. As with the rest of the hotel staff, the servers were excellent. An extra bonus is the fitness center. Iâ€™m used to hotels cramming a few pieces of equipment in a mirrored room and calling it a gym. At the Omni, the fitness room is large enough to fit several machines while still leaving space to walk around. Itâ€™s also well-stocked with towels, water, and even headsets for the individual TVs on the equipment. I was not expecting such a nice space. There is an outdoor pool as well. Budget $30/night plus tips for parking (valet), but honestly that seems to be the going rate at downtown hotels. I had no problems getting my car quickly when needed. There were some commercial parking lots nearby, but I preferred the convenience of having the car located on site. Which brings me to the location. Downtown L.A. is ok and has a few cultural attractions to see, but itâ€™s somewhat desolate (especially at night). There is a small shopping center / food court adjacent to the hotel, but it's mainly busy at lunchtime. So you will probably find yourself leaving the area pretty frequently, because much of the sightseeing, shopping and dining is located well outside downtown. There are buses and subway lines within a block or two, and the hotel provides a courtesy car that will take you within 3 miles of the hotel, so itâ€™s not absolutely necessary to have a car. But, as someone who strongly prefers to walk and rely on public transportation, I have reluctantly found it necessary to rent a car for any stays longer than a couple of days in L.A. Most of my trips to L.A. are for business though, so the downtown location was still convenient for me. If I were on vacation for beaches and shopping, I might choose to stay somewhere else, but thatâ€™s no knock on the Omni itself, which is an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad management”
Reviews.Author: webbit64
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni in downtown LA on a recent business trip. I was happy to be given a room before 11 a.m., and gladly dropped my bags in the room before I went off to a meeting. When I returned after dinner and settled in, I became aware of a funky smell in the room--was it something plastic that had melted or had someone in need of a shower been in my room? I didn't spend much time in the room, and was too busy to go through the hassle of changing rooms, so I ended up just living with it. On day 2, though, I did notice that no one had really been cleaning the toilet thoroughly--there was literally a black ring of gunk around the inside. Doesn't anyone check the housekeeping department's work? This would have been unacceptable in the lowliest of hotels, but this is supposed to be upscale. I shudder to think what else wasn't being cleaned!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel with a location that works.”
Reviews.Author: Noxley
Reviews.Content: Ample bedroom with twin double beds. Very comfortable and crisp linen giving a marvellous sleep. Very clean bedroom with a quiet and effective air conditioning unit. Sign up free of charge to the select guest programme on the hotel website and complimentary juices and hot drinks, as well as newspaper, will be brought up to the room when you wake. No problems at all about the standards of this hotel. In my opinion the Downtown location has far more plus points than negative ones. The attractions of the beaches and Hollywood are certainly some way away but buses and metro are both within 5 minutes walk and will deposit you onto Hollywood Boulevard inside 25-30 minutes. The Downtown district is full of architectural interest and highly impressive. Views from the top of the City Hall are splendid, a free treat that is often overlooked by visitors. Also nearby is the fantastic Union Station, with trains out to the valley towns. True that nearby Pershing Square and Skid Row are filled with transients after dark and are a bit challenging, but trains to Civic Centre metro stop bypass all of that and provide a more comfortable 5 minute walk to the hotel. The facilities nearby, particularly the cafes of California Plaza, make it pleasant simply to be around the hotel neighbourhood. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect...”
Reviews.Author: ZaiZaiLv
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on a July 4th weekend. As a member of their loyalty program, we were able to snag their BOGO night promotion. So, value wise, it was well worth it. Check in time was 3 PM, and we arrived around 5ish. No one was at the Valet when we arrived, so we had to wait for a few minutes before someone noticed us and greeted us. Not a good start, I must say. But since the Valet guy was so nice, I let it go. Check in took literarily 1 second. We went up to the check in desk, they asked for our name, we didn't have to wait, our room keys were already waiting. Again, we got certain perks for being a member. I highly recommend signing up for this. I'm a member of a few hotel loyalty programs, but so far, I must say, Omni has the best perks for their members, which include complimentary internet, two complimentary beverages each morning delivered to our room at requested time. We got *almost* everything we requested for: extra pillows, extra towels, extra hangers, slippers, high floor, etc etc. One thing they didn't get right was we had requested for New York Times, but got the local paper instead. Although the Mr. wasn't happy about it, it wasn't a big deal to me. Speaking of slippers, we only received one pair, even though it's indicated there would be two people staying. Again, not really a huge deal. The room was a good size. The bathroom was quiet big too: a tub and standing shower--not sure if this was available in all rooms. We had stayed here previously and we only had a tub in the room. While it's a nice comfy room, it does show its age quiet a bit. The sofa (see picture) in the room looked really old and dirty. Perhaps it's the color that makes it look unattractive. The TV was one of those tube-kind which I don't see in hotels this caliber anymore. It's not a big deal really, except the remote control needed to be replaced. We had to really push down to get it to register. It was a real problem, when we were checking out. We always opt out for TV check out whenever it's available. They didn't have a keyboard so we had to use remote control to type in our email address for the receipt to get sent to us. It took me about 5 mins to get one email address typed in. The Mr. had a chance to use the Fitness center. Good machine selections, although he had trouble with the TV turning off by itself a couple times. One thing that really annoyed me personally was on the first day, the room service that kept on knocking on our doors even though we had the privacy sign up. Location wise, it's not really that close to anything except concert halls. But again, it's very difficult to navigate around LA without transportation, so it's not really the hotel's fault. Just warning to people who may not be familiar with LA that this hotel is not a walking distance to anything exciting. If you do drive, be aware of the $30/night valet parking charge. Generally, everyone was friendly. No one really went out of their ways to do stuff for you, but they're all friendly enough that you didn't feel bad for asking if you happened to need something. Overall, it was a very nice stay. Despite minor annoyances we experienced, it really was almost a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: mstsc
Reviews.Content: Great stay and value for money. Rooms were great. Very helpful staff. Was there for a conference and stayed there for a week. No issues with this hotel. Except turn down service. Its great when you are not in the room but when you are in the room, they would open the room doors even after you have declined the service. Just remember to sign up for their loyalty program before you go. Good benefits.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and clean, comfortable rooms in downtown Los Angeles.”
Reviews.Author: freebiegrabber
Reviews.Content: My friends and I shared a room for a friend's wedding -- the staff provided us with a rollaway bed at no extra cost. The decor was tasteful, with bright lamps, plenty of pillows, a desk and a padded armchair. The bathroom was spacious and had all the necessary amenities (blow dryer, makeup mirror, plenty of toiletries, etc.). The room included a coffee machine, snacks and a mini-bar. The closet was wide and had plenty of hangers. The front desk staff, valet parking, bell chief and concierge were all friendly, attentive and helpful. We didn't have time to use the heated outdoor pool on the third floor. CONS: -Valet parking only (probably due to lack of space) -One of two phones in our room was broken, with no dialtone -Bar not open during morning / early afternoon hours -Wet parking circle / courtyard -- they were powerwashing the building's exterior -Narrow hallways on upper floors

Reviews.Title: “Did not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: Marquitos
Reviews.Content: With so many hotels in the city of Los Angeles it is no wonder why the Omni continues to be top ranked. It comes down to service. I do not live far and wanted to surprise my partner with this past weekend with a 'staycation' if only for a night, it was wonderful. We had a Club Level room overlooking the water court with the best views southeast views. I requested a room change with better views and without hesitation it was done. I had always been partial to Starwood properties until I stayed at Omni LA for one night and discovered the world of difference it is from any Westin property. It's a solid 4 diamond hotel with 5 diamond service. Every employee we've ever encountered from housekeeping to the door man have been a pleasure. Since my first stay here last year I now always try to stay at an Omni if it's available in the city I'm staying. You can not beat the amenities offered if you are a Select Guest. Now that downtown Los Angeles is ready to open two new hotels; The Ritz and JW Marriott I hope Omni LA has a plan in the works to upgrade it's rooms. I have no complaints with the bathrooms or beds but the wear in the upholstery, fixtures, and carpet is starting to show.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: PoblanoJ
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I stayed here for six nights during a conference. Although it was further from the Convention Center, we chose the hotel over others on the list because of the reviews we read on this site. We were not disappointed. (And our friends who stayed elsewhere were!) The room and bathroom were very clean, beds and pillows, were very comfortable, and service was very polished and professional. We joined the Select Guest program and received complimentary wireless internet and breakfast beverages (coffee and/or juice delivered to the room every morning -- a classy touch). The concierge (Amy) provided outstanding and highly professional service (from restaurant reservations -- we just started calling her from anywhere in the city when we were ready for dinner and she would recommend a restaurant for our needs at the moment and make us a reservation -- to phoning us before our arrival to let us know that a package had arrived and was being held for us.) The complementary fruit water in public places, and the on-demand courtesy sedan service (a late model Cadillac driven by very polite bellmen) that will take you short distances for a tip just completed the experience for us. The staff was so nice that we could easily overlook as comical that no matter what newspaper we checked off on our door hanging request each night, we still got the USA Today; that despite our trying four times, they never could get the second guest name into the reservation record in a way that the next person could find it; that the front desk staff told us that the Convention Center was at least 3 miles away and that there was no way we could walk there (it's about a mile and a half and it takes 30 minutes to walk); and that although we were given the complementary breakfast beverage door hanging signs, colleagues in three other rooms who also joined the Select Guest program were not given them until they asked for them part-way into their stay. Also, we wished they had shown a little more eco-friendliness (things like the plastic cups for one-time use with the fruit water and replacing our towels even if we left them hanging in the bathroom, etc.) Tips: 1) The taxi drivers who line up in front of the hotel can be rather expressive in their displeasure at being asked to take you what they consider to be short distances -- i.e., 2 mile, $10 fares; use the hotel sedan if you're not going far and save yourself being publicly berated... I recognize this is not the hotel's fault; it's probably why they offer the sedan service, but if they could solve this problem which at least 5 colleagues experienced during our week in town, it would really improve the guest experience. 2) Grand Central Market is a block away and is not to be missed for cheap eats and a colorful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Needs More Smile”
Reviews.Author: SKW66
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal at Omni through Priceline. Expected to see excellent service based on the previous reviews here and of course on the management's individual response. Front Desk Most staff members are friendly - but may I say a bit more smile from the front desk staff would make every thing better. I once called the front desk and I could hear the 'sigh' from the other end when he picked up the phone. Even though my issue was solved but seriously, people could hear whether the other party is smiling or not through the phone. Or may be I might just need to accept that the quality of service would be slightly discounted if I got a great deal from Hotwire/Priceline. Shower area only has room for one person - compared to the spacious room, this is disproportionately small! There was one night when there was a jet of water shot out from the shower and hit right above the shower glass door to the wall outside. This made the toilet paper all soaked and I had been glad that this did not ruin the TV speaker. But there was already a pond of water right outside the shower area. (But I like the TV speaker feature in the toilet - quite interesting! but it would be great to include the monitor as well - they might take reference from the Four Seasons in Hong Kong!) Room Choice: Since I booked this hotel through priceline, even though I have then joined their Select Guest program, I was not assigned to the King Bed room that I preferred. I had to call the next day to check but luckily I got to be transfered to another room on the same floor. Double room - smaller bathroom area: there was not enough space around the sink for 2 people's stuff. King room - bigger bathroom area: other than this, every thing else was the same. Be careful if you take snack from the mini bar as some of them are expired... TV As a 4-star hotel, it is really a wonder why the TV set is still CRT but not LCD. I've stayed in several Asian hotels (both small local and big international 3-4 star) and all of them had LCD TV in their rooms!! I don't understand why this is not the same in the states from the three 3-4 star hotels that I've stayed in in recent years. LCD TV makes the room looks much much much bigger without this huge CRT set in the middle of the room and it makes the whole in-room design style more modern, isn't it? Gym The gym room is very good - well-equipped with towels and water. Though several things could be improved: 1) might be good to add a Smith machine 2) might be better if the weight intervals of a machine could be smaller - more accomodating for females 3) fit balls need to be checked regularly as it felt like air has been leaking and dusty throughout Valet Closest parking to the hotel and more than 1 block away. So we chose to park out car through valet - which is $30 per day. With this rate, we expected pretty highly from the hotel. There was once that it took more than 15 min to retrieve our car during one afternoon where the staff did not appear to be on top of every thing's going on at that moment. And there was a big cloud of flies at the waiting area in the entrance!! Quite disgusting... One of the managers, though, was able to pick up my dissatisfaction and offered to take at least a night's valet charge off my bill - which is done more than what I expected! Final Tip: If you booked this hotel through Hotwire/Priceline, be sure you've tipped enough.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: jguillet
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni LA for a conference trip for a week. When I reserved the room through the conference I entered, "Selected the Omni based on TripAdvisor reviews. Upgrades appreciated." I was extremely pleased when I was given a room key to a two room corner suite, with two flat panel TVs, two large bathrooms, a bedroom with King bed and room with two sofas. Wow! The staff was extremely nice and the free Town Car service was fantastic. I highly recommend this hotel. Be sure to register online for the Select Guest Loyalty Program for other free perks, like free beverages in the morning, newspapers, robes, free wifi, etc. It's free.

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: duckfisney
Reviews.Content: I have been at the Omni on 4 recent trips and found them to be consistently exceptional. The staff are friendly, helpful and gracious. the rooms are very comfortable, and even though some are beginning to show their age, are far superior to any other LA area hotel I have stayed in over the past few years. the noe bar is also superb and the room service is well above average.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel - Great Value!!”
Reviews.Author: SoCalC8
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I decided to stay here one night when we went to a Dodger game. Found a great deal through their website and was able to utilize their AAA rate. We checked in without any problems, they gave us a room on the 15th floor and it was great. Valet was superb every time and we felt like we were treated like movie stars with the attention that was given to us. I left my phone charger in my room and the hotel sent it back to me without any problems! A great stay in downtown LA and will would recommend to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “I know why it is rated the best hotel in downtown LA.”
Reviews.Author: Taniquan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is everything it is advertised to be: a 4 star hotel in the middle of downtown Los Angeles. It is next to the Museum of Contemporary Art and there are restaurants and coffee shops all within a short walk. During my two night stay I found everything to be more than satisfactory, from checking to my room to valet parking to the free in room wifi to check out. Everything was flawless. One especially nice feature of the hotel is complementary town car transpiration to anywhere within three miles until 11:30 pm. I used it to go to the Pacific Dining Car for a late dinner. I told the driver I would be ready to return to the hotel at 11:15 and he picked me up at the restaurant on schedule. The restaurant and the town car service were great. And if you have not heard of the Pacific Dining Car restaurant-it has been in downtown LA for some 60 years . It is about 1.2 miles from the Omni. It is an upscale steak//seafood restaurant open 24 hours. So you can go there after the bars close or for breakfast and get a lavish prime rib dinner. The bottom line is that I would highly recommence the Omni Hotel and the Pacific Dining Car Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: gambit76
Reviews.Content: I would stay here if on business in LA or a short stay to attend events situated in downtown. Not a heck of a lot of activity in the evenings in the immediate area. You will need a car if staying in this hotel. Free wifi access in the lobby was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely lobby and rooms, friendly staff, would definitely recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Scoperta17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni in March for four nights at the start of a 5week road trip. We booked with alpharooms and only paid about Â£80 a night, which we were very pleased with. California Plaza is a pleasant location and close to the metro station and plenty of bus stops (we used the bus quite a lot and it was fine). Check-in was quick and the staff were very friendly. The bedrooms are a good size and very comfortable and clean. We used the hotel's concierge a couple of times- very helpful and knowledgeable. The hotel has a complimentary town car which is first-come-first-served, but we only had to wait 15minutes, and that's not a problem when the lobby is so comfortable. We really don't have any complaints- lovely hotel and stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: bestinn
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the Omni in LA. The rooms were clean and fresh. It's close to the new downtown which is very convenient. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are in the area!

Reviews.Title: “very good overall, though some minor complaints”
Reviews.Author: vonschwind
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni California Plaza for 6 nights in Feb. 2009 while attending a conference at the LA Convention Center in Downtown LA. I chose the Omni because I wanted a hotel in (reasonable) walking distance of the conference, and I found a very competitive rate through an online hotel broker. I was traveling with one colleague, and we had a room with two double beds. Our room was very spacious and well-appointed, with a large bathroom and extremely comfortable beds. The view was not spectacular-- 7th floor looking into more of downtown LA's corporate jungle. Lots of channels on the TV. Complimentary coffee and tea in the room (though re-stocking of this was very haphazard-- they kept giving us more and more decaf, and no regular coffee, and forgetting to leave cream-- I should have left notes to remind them). Room temperature was excellent and easy to control. The hotel guide said that our room would include bathrobes, but there were none, and I didn't bother calling the desk to have them sent up. The room was very quiet-- I heard no noise from neighbors and little from traffic. Colleagues staying nearby at the Millennium Biltmore, the Westin Bonaventure, and the Wilshire Grand all commented that they thought my room at the Omni seemed much larger and nicer than their rooms. The health/fitness center: I used this facility and was pleased by the amount and variety of equipment. The description of the center in our hotel guide stated that complimentary fresh fruit would be provided there, but I never saw any (only water, and once, small packets of almonds). Problem: on the first night, I arrived in the room to discover the shower handle broken off and was sitting on the floor. I immediately called, and a maintenance person came, "fixing" the problem after about 30 minutes of work. The shower remained very stiff and difficult to turn far enough to get much hot water, and I feared that it would break off again (but it didn't). I wish I had insisted that they move me to a different room altogether. Annoying, but not a major problem on the whole. Parking: Valet parking in the hotel garage was $30 per night, meaning that I paid more on parking my rental car than I spent on the car itself. However, I noticed that nearby hotels were charging $35 and $40, so I suppose I was lucky. The parking attendants were friendly and always retrieved my car very promptly when I needed to go out, with the exception of the final morning, which was VERY concerning. I was anxious to beat morning rush hour traffic to get to the airport, and that was the one occasion when they goofed and took half an hour to find my car. Not cool. Business services: wireless internet in-room costs $10 per day-- a bit steep. I think it's odd how budget hotels like the Comfort Inn routinely offer free wireless, and 4-star places make you pay a fortune. However, I paid anyway, and it was reliable. When you're 24 hours runs out, it switches off until you renew, so be warned, or you might lose work. The business center in the lobby charged $6.95 per hour to use its computer terminals. I needed to print some documents there, and when I saw what the cost would be, I went to Kinko's 4 blocks away and did all my printing for $1.50 instead. Business Center = major rip-off!! Downtown LA: unless you're attending a conference or have a specific reason to be downtown, DON'T stay in this part of the city. I had no choice. I found the LA Convention Center rather far (half-hour walk), but there are no hotels actually near the Convention Center, so this problem is unavoidable. There were very few eating options or convenience stores open at night in this area-- the Famina adjacent to the hotel closed at 8:30 or 9pm, I think. Others told me that it was dangerous to walk around at night. This is not the hotel's fault, of course, but be warned-- there's nothing in downtown LA. I'm glad that I had a rental car and was able to drive elsewhere to find food. On the whole, if I absolutely HAD to stay in downtown LA again, I would definitely return to the Omni. However, if I could find any excuse to stay in another part of the city, I would avoid the downtown altogether.

Reviews.Title: “Still the choice for Bunker Hill”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoLawyer1
Reviews.Content: Solid if unspectacular 3.5-4 star hotel in the best of Bunker Hill locales, across street from KPMG/Wells Fargo, just down the street from MOCA and Disney Hall ,on highest spot in downtown LA. Ask for the concierge level and enjoy the pampering, including a breakfast that beats the restaurant's more expensive fare. Another tip: ask for a spacious corner room.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: Bobcat 12
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this property while our son took an LA city Fire Dept. test. We booked on a search engine for a very resonable rate. I can't speak highly enough of the service! We were given a room and dropped off our luggage while we went sightseeing. Upon return I learned there was a better view facing the courtyard (ours was out over the front of the hotel). I asked if we could possibly change. The desk clerk was very helpful and readily upgraded our room to one with a loverly view of the water feature in California Plaza. The hotel's location was great for us! As hotel food and drink can be pricey, the Plaza had several restaurants and a Starbucks, as well a a mini-mart with prepared foods. There were tables outside by the water feature to enjoy coffee or read a book. Everyone we passed, greeted us! The check-in clerk greeted me by name every time I passed.......great memory! The valet parking is pricey, but there were at least 8 people out front opening doors and greeting guests as they parked cars. The room was clean and well appointed with both tub and separate shower. We were impressed with the hotel's restaurant Noe for evening cocktails. There was piano music and a relaxing vibe. I loved the bar snacks, so the waitress put some in a cup for me to nibble on back in the room. I just felt everyone went above and beyond...not something you see every day!

Reviews.Title: “Really superb hotel and very attentive staff. Deserves to be #1 in LA.”
Reviews.Author: Save-a-lert
Reviews.Content: Brilliant service from when I arrived all the way through to checkout. We stayed twice during February 2009 starting and ending our USA holiday in LA. Good location for getting around LA which is a big sprawling city. The public transport is great and very cheap using one-day rover tickets at $5 and buses run every 15 mins. We went to Hollywood and Santa Monica. The hotel has a complimentary Limo for trips up to 3 miles The parking is expensive at $30 per night but for a short stay have a snack in the cafe and get your ticket stamped it then costs $5 for 2 hours.... plus your snack. You do not really need a car so if you are staying more than a few days then return it to the Renter at LAX about 15 miles away and get the Super Shuttle for $16. Very quick and much better than Taxis. Join the Omni loyalty scheme on-line beforehand and you are entitled to complimentary room service beverage and paper on wake up, but you need to get a order tab from reception first. Gym is well equipped but under-utilised. Breakfasts can be pricey in the Hotel but in California Square, just adjacent to the Hotel at level 1 you can get a Starbuck's coffee and sandwich etc or if you need more the deli on the approach is open all hours and has a really great breakfast selection at reasonable prices. Eat this at the tables in the square outside - brilliant while watching the fountains and birdlife. Restaurants are not special and can be expensive as is the wine but do try the exception, Engine Co #28 in Figueroa St just 10 mins walk for a truly 'american food experience' at reasonable prices and a decent pint called Firestone. Staff and atmosphere are great. All in all an excellent hotel and location for business and pleasure - tipping a few $ for excellent service is appreciated and a way of life.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms; fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: madison0821
Reviews.Content: The room was nice, spacious, and clean. The bed was amazingly soft. We interacted with the valet and front desk mostly - extremely nice and helpful. For a business hotel in downtown area, it was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but not as perfect as you'd expect”
Reviews.Author: shesails
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the Leisure Package we got for $204 including breakfast, parking, private car shuttle, tax and stay. With the raves on Tripadvisor our expectations were probably too high. Small things like dirty cups with the morning beverage service, a sink stopper that didn't work, smallish spots on the carpet & furniture, drapery tieback fallen off the wall. The bed was comfy enough, if firm, but the shower needs a curved rod to avoid curtain cling. I'd stay again if I were attending something in the area. Be sure to reserve for dinner in advance. Definitely sign up for the Select Guest program in advance. Excellent customer service, except as noted.

Reviews.Title: “Still good but probably not at the price”
Reviews.Author: Cornucopia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni in December for the fifth or sixth time in three years. I'm on their frequent visitor register or whatever it's called. It's still basically the same comfortable place with the same excellent staff but the rooms are already showing the march of time with minor staining to carpets and fabrics, chips and scratches to furniture and fixtures and ageing apparent in the bathroom. Also we requested a plaza view but were put on the other side of the hotel for the first time. My real concern however is the escalation in price. Clearly all the traveller adulation is catching up with the Omni and no amount of ferreting about would get the room price below about US$200, which is way more than we paid in recent years. And it appears to have gone up from there! What happens when the economy recovers?? There are probably now better options, for us at least.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jaywallington
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. We paid Â£61 for this hotel and that has to be the best rate I have ever got for such a quality hotel. Location: Takes about twenty five minutes to drive to from LAX car rental. If you get nothing else all holiday, GET A GPS SYSTEM! It's easyish to find, just take your time on the exits etc. Situated right next to Gehry's Disney Philarmonic centre, a fantastic looking building and the MOMA there are attractions within walkable distance which for LA, is a huge exception. A convenient plaza is also close by that serves a few simple bites to eat and some small convenience shops. It's a nice place to relax. Service: Exemplary. The reception man of asian origin remembered my name on all consequent communications and was the example of personal service. The concierge, Daniel, was also excellent. We needed to check some exam results but didn't fancy paying the wireless charge so Daniel got us passes to the business centre to allow us to quickly check our mail. It was a very kind gesture and a hugely appreciated one. He printed maps of how to get to various places like Rodeo drive and the Hollywood sign which again proved useful. On the whole, great staff. Rooms: The most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Probably too comfy as you don't want to get out of it! Clean, spacious (very), good TV, nice bathroom - simply fantastic, and we only had a basic room. Parking: paying for parking is always a grind and the one quarm was the valet parking took forever to come. The tipping culture is stlll a hastle and paying someone $5 for driving a car you could have got yourself is an irritaiton but this is endemic across the whole country. Speak spanish and they seem to get it quicker for you. On the whole, you'd be mad not to stay here. Great lobby, great staff, great rooms. Google Omni LA and book it!

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality”
Reviews.Author: LeeLacey
Reviews.Content: GENERAL This is an excellent Hotel. That's the reason it is often voted number 1 by trip advisor members. Excellent quality 5 star hotel, very good value for money and in a central location for business and leisure. LOCATION Located in Downtown LA. 10 years ago, the thought of staying in downtown LA would send shivers down your spine. Not today. The area has been redeveloped and is safe and clean. Life has finally returned to downtown LA. The hotel is located next to California Plaza. The nearest rail station is a 4 minute walk. The rail connects you to various parts of LA, Southern California etc. Buses close by that go to Disneyland, LAX etc. Area is very safe and excellent for tourists and those on business. ROOM Fantastic. We booked a standard room which was huge. Bed very comfortable, mini bar, huge shower, seperate tub, free news papers. Floor to celling windows. One of the best (if not the best) hotel room I have ever stayed in. BAR This is a must. Dimly lit piano bar - very romantic and all with excellent service and good value for money. POOL AREA Not huge but one of the best in Downtown LA. OVERALL A very friendly 5 star hotel in an excellent location that will not break the budget. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: MattEcho
Reviews.Content: I stay in LA on business about 100 nights a year and the Omni is the best downtown LA hotel that I've stayed at. I've stayed at the Westin Bonaventure, Sheraton, Marriott, and Hilton. This one is the cleanest and most well kept. FYI, I do not use a lot of the amnenities, so I can't speak to everything. The location is good for business, but if you want to be near the newer downtown attractions (Staples Center), then you might want to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room”
Reviews.Author: valueformoneyplease9
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of nights and the room was great, really big and comfortable and I could see the Hollywood sign in the distance from my window. Staff were all friendly. Hotel was fairly near the subway for the train. The Restaurant I would imagine is great although a little above my budget! The bar was nice although the Bar Staff could be a little more friendly. Booked through skoosh.co and got a good deal. Location is good for business area but not so good for the tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni”
Reviews.Author: tobeginwith
Reviews.Content: With a great staff, clean, comfortable rooms with nice amenities and a large, comfy bed, The Omni is a great choice for those staying in downtown LA. The surrounding neighborhood is transitional but relatively safe and there's some great funky finds just down the hill on Broadway.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you expect from the Omni”
Reviews.Author: MaggieMaySc
Reviews.Content: It was lovely! Upper floor, upgraded room....all of the quality that you expect from the Omni!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At The Omni”
Reviews.Author: TRosel238
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at the Omni in downtown LA during a recent business trip. This was my first time to stay at an Omni and I was very pleased. The staff at the front desk and the bellhops were very courteous and efficient. The bellhop filled my ice bucket up for me without being asked. I was very pleased with my room. It had nice decor and was well maintained. The bathroom was very large and had a seperate shower and tub. The bed was extremely comfortable. I stay at Sheraton's quite often and this bed was more comfortable than the Sheraton heavenly sleeper. The pillows were the best I have ever slept on. The had a mixture of both firm and soft, and large and small pillows. I was very pleased with my stay here and would highly recomend this hotel to anyone who needs to be in the downtown LA area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: globalmouse
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Omni although I agree with the previous reviewer that the beds are way too high!! I've never had a bed that's so high up! The room was a really nice size as was the bathroom and the service was excellent the whole time - I especially liked the touch of the complimentary hot apple juice and biscuits in reception. One thing I was a bit annoyed about was that when we enquired about internet access we were told we could pay $9 a day for wi-fi in the room but then I remembered reading something on tripadvisor before we booked and we called back and were told if we registered online (for free) we would get free internet access...it was a bit annoying they didn't bother mentioning that and if I hadn't read it on here and remembered we would have paid for something they offer for free. Apart from that it was a nice hotel and there's a nice little shop down in the plaza next to the hotel where you can wander to buy snacks and drinks and also a starbucks and a few restaurants. I would probably stay here again if I was in LA, I would have like to have been in Santa Monica with more restaurants, shops etc but the prices there are much higher and from what I've read the standard of hotel not as good.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem”
Reviews.Author: LorenzSingapore
Reviews.Content: After the 25 hours flight across the Pacific (including long transit time), I am absolutely glad I made the right choice of hotel to stay the next 3 nights. The check-in staff (Maria, a Hispanic lady) was nice and granted me an upgrade to the club floor without charge. Of course I gave her a handsome tip. The Club Lounge was superb and 1 of the staff (Ignacio, if I rem correctly, a Mexican) who was always there in the morning was especially nice and always making sure everything is in order during our breakfast. The hotel provided a complimentary Lexus towncar for guest usage. 1 of e many drivers (they cross-role between drivers and valet) Robert, a Filipino, made my arrival very welcomed and recommended an excellent Japanese restaurant at the gate of Japanese Village Plaza, which I returned to have a meal twice later. Overall, this hotel made my arrival in Los Angeles an excellent experience. Somehow, the jet lag didn't kick in. Only 1 minor complaint though: the bed was too high, even my 10-year-old had to jump to get into bed... :)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tennessee-TRIP
Reviews.Content: The Omni is a good hotel. The rooms tend to be clean and comfortable. Staff tends to be responsive to customer issues. The gym is modern. The only real concern was there is a charge to use the computer at the business center. That is a little disappointing, considering the high tariff at the hotel. On the whole, I would say that this is probably one of your better options in Los Angeles. Hopefully, my main concern is resolved in the future so guests can have real business center access.

Reviews.Title: “Omni L.A.”
Reviews.Author: Winchesterpartners
Reviews.Content: If you have to stay overnight in the business section of downtown L.A., the Omni is a great choice, especially on the Club level. Nice touches, like a toilet kit in the bathroom containing razor, shaving cream, toothbrush and toothpaste (in case you forgot any of them). Very nice rooms. Good restaurant. Free drinks and cacapes in the Club Lounge. Internet access in your room and two computers available in the Club Lounge. Plus you're close to everything, both business and cultural.

Reviews.Title: “Omni Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: AgentSmithDC
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were in LA to visit USC. The Omni has a discount for campus-related stays, so we decided to try it. It is a beautiful property - California Plaza is an office complex plus Omni that surround a gorgeous plaza. The hotel itself is high-end without being stuffy. The staff, from the parking attendants to the bellhops to the folks at check-in were universally friendly and helpful. Our room was fresh, well-furnished, quiet and comfortable. Based on the quality to price ($175) ratio, I rate this hotel a 10.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 4 Stars Hotel”
Reviews.Author: benikana
Reviews.Content: The hotel area in downtown is very nice and quit. the hotel have a nice pool and spa, and gym area. the room and the bed are very confortable. the valet park is VERY EXPENSIVE ($ 30.00) a day. but you can find a 10.00 flat rate park one block from the hotel. But you can stay there for sure. very nice hotel .

Reviews.Title: “An excellent Downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: akarana
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located if you want the Downtown area of LA. The Pershing Square Metro station is only a few minutes walk away and the Downtown entertainment area in also close. The room and the bathroom was large and well furnished. The standard of house keeping was excellent. Unfortunately there were no Internet facilities in the room. The Concierge was helpful, but unfortunately the advice given was not correct. The hotel is quiet and there is a complimentary morning newspaper. I recommend you go to Starbucks in the Watercourt, next door, for breakfast. I would use the Omni again

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorite hotels”
Reviews.Author: kpnguyen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel 3 nights, and we are very impressed with the location, the room, the staff and their services. The front desk staff was extremely well trained, courteous, and helpful. Our Room was clean, nicely appointed, and with excellent beddings. With Omni's Select Guest membership, in-room wireless internet access is complimentary (for both of our laptops,) as well as your choice of 2 morning drinks, served at the time you select, to your room. There is a valet/parking charge. Omni is one of our favorite hotels for our domestic travel.

Reviews.Title: “Some good...some work needed”
Reviews.Author: FloridaSunandFun
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at this hotel. Overall, acceptable but some issue to make you all aware of prior to booking: 1) I needed to move to five different rooms before I had a WI FI signal strong enough to hold the connection. Very poor WI FI in most rooms. "Bridge" unit from the desk didn't boost or improve. Even in room I finally settled in still got kicked off repeatedly. 2) Coffee maker missing in room. All other items present, but needed to have new coffee maker delivered. 3) Carpet was VERY worn. It was clean, but very worn and really needed to be replaced. 4) Having only the NOE Restaraunt for PM dining limited choices for a lighter fare. Room service was only option other than going elsewhere. NOE dinner was excellent, but not a wide selection and a bit pricy if someone wanted a lighter touch.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent start to our holiday, care of The Omni!”
Reviews.Author: NottsDinkyDoo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great â€“ we got a great deal through Expedia by booking alongside our flights and were kind of spoiled as this set an early bar for the rest of our holiday! From dropping the car off with the valet, to check in (which was smooth and efficient) we had a first class experience here and would recommend it to anyone, with easy access to the subway links, which was a very inexpensive way for us to travel, without having to once use the car (itâ€™s a little dark around the entrance to the subway at night, next to the park but was ok to walk briskly past at night, back towards the hotel!) We used the subway to get to Universal and Hollywood Boulevard, from which we were able to walk to the Hollywood Bowl. The room was spacious, comfortable and felt new and was a delight to return to after a long day in and around various parts of LA; the bathroom was roomy and had a great shower â€“ we had breakfast in the restaurant the first morning but found it a little expensive to indulge in every morning, so we made do with the Starbucks which was onsite which was a great way for us to start the day. Sign up to Select Guest on their website before you go; this enables you to free wi-fi Internet access in your room. In conclusion, donâ€™t let the location of this hotel put you off, the subway was easy and cheap and we found it a lovely base, in almost five star surroundings!

Reviews.Title: “Roses have thorns”
Reviews.Author: Charli_R_87
Reviews.Content: Firstly i agree with all the other reviews about how nice this hotel is, the door men all welcome you in with a thousand smiles and everything in the room is always left in pristine condition. However on arrival me and my boyfriend were allocated a room with two single beds, an easy mistake to make we thought so we went down to try and fix this problem only to be told we couldn't! Not happy! Especially given the cost of the hotel! Which brings me onto my main point...if you're coming to staying at the Omni be sure to bring an elasticated wallet because you're gona need a whole lota money. $7 for 15mins on the internet. $30 for parking. and that doesnt even include all the tips you gota throw at them constantly all day long. the staff are nice...but most of them only when they know that they're bank balance will benefit from being nice to you. but if none of that bothers you you should have a really nice stay lol! the hotel is just as beautiful as the photos show!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great room, great trip.”
Reviews.Author: J_JHonolulu
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Omni for 2 nights and had a great time. After spending 4 nights in Hollywood, we wanted to experience the downtown area of L.A. and we were glad we booked our stay at the Omni. This place was a steal for the price we paid! Our room was ready upon our arrival and the room was spacious and clean. My girlfriend raved about the Spa (she had a massage and facial) and while she was being pampered, I enjoyed a few cocktails at the Noe Restaurant. The location was great as it was close to all the major throughfares. We parked our rental with the valet and it was quite expensive, but we never needed to jump back in the rental because the hotel provided a courtesy car which was free for any destination within a 3 mile radius of the hotel. We utilized the courtesy car (sleek Lincoln Navigator) to visit Chinatown, to take us to dinner at Arnie Morton's Steakhouse (excellent), in addition to a couple of other downtown destinations. I will definitely stay at the Omni during my next trip to L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Staying Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: shedeez
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights (8/31-9/02) at the Omni hotel. The hotel staff were very friendly - from the valet folks to the room service people. We booked the hotel directly through the website and used our AAA discount. We got a good price ($161.night) considering it was labor day weekend.
