We had a quick check in since we were "select guest" (it's Omni's hotel rewards program). I informed the front desk that we had a car so instead of including it in our bill, he waived it for us because we were select guests. The front desk gave us our keys and we were on way to the room. I noticed once we got to our room, all the preferences we had listed when enrolling into their program, were fulfilled (high floor room, in the corner, away from the elevator, non-smoking, with a king size bed). What other hotel will accomadate to all your preferences. The room was very roomy. The bed was very comfy along with the down pillows - it complemented each well and I slept like a baby both nights. It was quite and we even had turndown service. Also we enrolled into their rewards program (Select Guest) our WiFi connection was free and we received complimentary juice, coffee, or tea- which ever you prefer - every morning. This hotel will definitely be on my list to come back to when we are in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be more satisfied”
Reviews.Author: kmats808
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights in late August. I got this hotel through a package deal. I have to agree with those that gave the hotel great reviews. I utilized the Online check in and our keys were waiting for us upon our arrival allowing us to bypass checking in with the front desk. Like others, I highly recommend signing up for the Select Guest program; the complimentary beverages in the morning are a nice way to start off each day. And the turndown service is a nice way to end the day. Amy, their concierge was top notch. She was very helpful with suggestions and providing directions to places we wanted to go and she did this without us having to ask. And while it was $30/day, I wasn't too upset because frankly we were on vacation and that's come to be a normal expectation and they were quick and prompt; we never had to wait long for the car. On the last night, we weren't getting any hot water and I contacted the front desk. Upon our return from the evening out, the front desk manager Gary informed us that the problem was still not fixed. Taken proactive measures, he gave us access to another room to take a shower the next morning and comped up 2 days' parking for the inconvenience. Last but not least, it was in a great location, with easy access to the I-101 We stayed at the Omni San Diego as part of our trip as well and there is no comparison; Omni LA at California Plaza's service lived up to it's four-star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, super friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Chenling
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Omni for 3 nights while we were visiting LA. Before I booked the hotel I read a lot of reviews on Tripadvisor and on Expedia. The few complaints were about the size of the rooms, the area (nothing to do) and unfriendiness of the staff. Well, I can say that I have had none of those problems. People generally advise to get a hotel near Hollywood or Beverly Hills. I actually liked the quietness at night in Downtown LA and in the weekend there were shows in front of the hotel of which we were noticed of with a formal letter from the staff. Everything touristic to visit was in reacheable distance with car or with public transportation. So that wasn't a problem at all. The staff we encountered were super friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much to ask and they did something extra if you were just nice and friendly back (which is hardly anything to ask really). The size of the rooms were comfortable, again if you want a penthouse then get a penthouse to stay in. It's a shame if you want to live in your hotel room while you are in a place like LA really! The accomodations were excellent, I also loved the free newspapers every morning. I would definetly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Found the service wonderful”
Reviews.Author: crazyandcrazier
Reviews.Content: I found the staff at this hotel really lovely--polite and helpful at every turn. It's an expensive hotel and in downtown, which might not be where tourists want to stay (no walk to the beach, after all!), but for business purposes it really can't be beat. I slept SO soundly on the bed--I woke up in the same position I fell asleep in, and don't think I moved in the eight hours in between!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni”
Reviews.Author: Rjboys
Reviews.Content: This hotel was central to all of the attractions we wanted to see in LA. There were free nightly shows downtown for my teenage sons. They both loved the shows. I think Sesame Street World was showing. The hotel staff was very helpful. The beds were so soft I did not want to leave. My only complaint is the extra cost for refridge(pay extra) and no microwave. Other than the 30.00 per day in/out parking, I was very satisfied. By the way, you may be able to walk 1/2 block up Olive and get in/out parking much cheaper if you don't mind the 1/2 block stroll.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: LuciMa
Reviews.Content: The front desk service and the hostess for the Grand Cafe were rude. Simply posed questions easily confused the staff who responded with arrogance. Really, 80% of the staff could use a lot customer service training. The valet staff were the only decent people. The pictures are good but inaccurate. The room was simple and small. AND the water smells like sulfur. I would never stay at an Omni hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with pool”
Reviews.Author: catwings
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during Siggraph 2008 and enjoyed it. There is an outdoor pool which was really nice. It was outside the fitness center. I really enjoyed going in for a dip after a work out. You can get free Internet access if you sign up to be a member of the Omni hotel guest program. That was definitely a bonus. I had a room on the 16th floor with a King sized bed. It was very comfortable and quiet. Nice views from the windows and a comfortable visit all around.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Omni”
Reviews.Author: travelreviewer2000
Reviews.Content: I loved being here. This is a 4 star hotel, and it was a great experience. Everyone was very accomodating. Our first room had a view of the fountain - unfortunately in the afternoon I smelled cigarette smoke coming up through the air vents - it was not in the hallway, so it was not neighbors. I phoned the desk and we were immediately moved to another room. That room did not have a great view, and still had a sort of stale cig smell, so we moved again, back to the original floor, but, a corner suite, with fantastic views, and no cigarette smells whatsoever. From the moment we arrived, Charlie helped us out (make sure you tip everyone btw, bring dollars and fives, or more if you wish), we were treated like royalty. The maids were super sweet, the receptionists were great, the staff was amazing. Chocoalates and ice came in the afternoon as well as turn down. WiFi (make sure you sign up as a Select Guest on their website so you can get that free). There's in and out service with the parking system, so you are only charged for parking once a day. The bathroom is big - separate shower and bath. I asked for extra towels daily from the maid, she did this daily, without us asking which was great. BTW, the maids that we had were wonderful. One night we were at a restaurant and called for the courtesy car to take us back. Couldn't be happier! Great place to stay! Oh and the manager sent us up fruit and an apology about the other two rooms, so we were very very happy. Almost forgot this, we asked for a refrigerator for some of our personal things, and we had that in the room - no charge. There was also daily shuttle service to the convention center. Can you beat that? Nope!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, friendly service, great location, nice food”
Reviews.Author: vaj1111
Reviews.Content: We just got back tonight and I just wanted to tell everybody that this hotel was a great pick for us. I picked the Omni in L.A. after reading the user reviews from tripadvisor and it was right on the money. Our room was on the eighth floor overlooking California Plaza and featured two beds with thick down comforters. The beds was comfortable, the room was quiet and smelled nice. The staff was really friendly. I needed to make change and a staff member went and got her purse and made change for me out of her own money. From the bellman, to the waiter in the cafe, to the front desk clerk everyone went out of their way to make sure our stay was great. We ate in the cafe for breakfast. It's expensive but the waiter was really nice and professional. the food was outstanding and the coffee tasted excellent. The view overlooking the plaza gave us great views and on Saturday night we were treated to a concert in the plaza directly below us. It's walking distance to the Disney Concert Hall and the Museum of contemporary Art and a 2 minute drive to the 110 freeway. We went to the Santa Monica Pier in about 15 minutes and made a trip to Sunset Blvd and West Hollywood one day and a trip to Beverly Hills another day. We went on a weekend but I expect the area is entirely different during the week. I could see huge traffic problems during the week. Also, It's just minutes from the Staples Center, the jewelry district and the convention center. I used to work at the Four Seasons Hotel and this hotel reminded me of it, the decor, comfort and staff friendliness. I thought it was a great choice and I highly recommend it to anyone. Here's my tip. Join the select guest club (free) and get free wireless internet and a view room upgrade for nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Average - Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: mandy5034
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for 2 nights in August. Overall the stay was OK. The rooms were really big, felt like an apartment, but the location is terrible. If your in town to work in teh CBD, then fantastic, but if your a tourist, then there is NO point in staying downtown as everything is at least a 5-10 minute drive away and you have to pay for parking. I found the Omni dated, and felt like something more suitable for the elderly. It was old fashioned and the decor really out-dated. I wouldn't stay here again. We ended up forgoing out last night's prepaid accommodation and stayed in Beverly Hills, simply for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - not so great location for turism!”
Reviews.Author: Dolcelen
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in the Omni LA, it was a great experience, staff were friendly and helpful, breakfast was amazing and the room was comfortable - loved the bed!!! The only negative aspect was the location, if you are looking for a holiday it is really far away from all the LA attractions (apart from museums and concert hall). Won't come back due the location, but would recommend it for business trips to everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: jmjh02
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Omni for one night, as part of our trip to San Diego. LA was a good stop over point for us and allowed us to see The American Girl Store in The Grove--about 20 minutes away. We had stayed at this hotel a few years ago, and liked it then so we rebooked here without a second thought. Once again, we enjoyed our one night stay here. The staff are very friendly and helpful and make you feel very welcomed. The kids received a welcome goodie bag upon arrival. Our room was a standard size hotel room. We had plenty of room for our luggage. The room was clean. We had a great view from our floor to ceiling windows of California Plaza. One of the best things about this hotel was how quiet it is. We noticed this during our first stay a few years ago, and again during this stay. We could not hear any neighbors beside or above us. We ate the buffet breakfast at the hotel. It offered plenty of selection, and while it was not inexpensive, it was quick and helped us to get off to an early start. All in all, the Omni at California Plaza in Los Angeles is a great hotel, that I highly recommend and look forward to staying in again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: DundalkMouse
Reviews.Content: I could not fault this hotel. It was fabulous. Excellent location - I did not have a car and was alittle worried that this would be a problem, it wasn't. This hotel was expensive in comparison to other hotels I stayed in on my one month vacation in America, but by LA standards wasn't that bad and you definitely got value for money. The room was luxourious & spotlessly clean, food was great ( I didn't try breakfast though, it was a bit full on and pricey - I'm not a big eater in the morning), they have a well equiped gym ( headphones, towels, water & fruit all provided free of charge), outdoor pool with loungers and the staff could not have been more pleasant. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a vacation in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: VaTourist_8
Reviews.Content: After a disappointing stay elsewhere, we checked into the Omni. We got a corner room which was particularly spacious. It was so comfortable that we decided to add to our stay and cancel plans to stay elsewhere for our last few days. The room was very comfortable with many nice amenities. Each day the hotel lobby had bowls of apples for guests and, in the afternoons, a freshly-made iced tea/lemonade brew which varied slightly each day. Omni Select Guest members get additonal amenities, including free WiFi access. Unfortunately, it is not a secure network, so it's not good for business but it's still useful for checking restaurants and places to visit. The location is walking distance to a number of good restaurants as well as only a block to the start of L.A.'s music center complex. It is about a 20 minute walk to L.A.'s Old Mexico section and the hotel is a short drive to Dodgers Stadium and to the Staples Center. It is also very convenient to freeway entrances so within 30 minutes, you can be at the ocean in Santa Monica or enjoying the thrills of Universal Studios. All of this and very competitive prices as well! For our next L.A. trip, we will absolutely stay again at the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Special weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Djkwisdom
Reviews.Content: To celebrate my husbands Birthday we went round trip on Amtrak from Oceanside, CA. The Omni will pick you up at the Union Station complementary. The hotel is located in Down town Los Angeles with-in walking distance to all musical events in the Plaza area. During the summer there are free out door concerts in the Plaza. The Omni website offers special weekend rates and packages. We stayed on the Concierge Level and enjoyed complimentary drinks and appetizers in the evening. We ate dinner in the hotel at Noe Restaurant . This is a five star dinning experience. After dinner we enjoyed the concert. Then went back to the Concierge for additional desert and coffee. Sunday morning we had a huge breakfast in the Concierge room, everything you could imagine. After breakfast we went for our downtown walk. To walk downtown Los Angeles on a Sunday morning is a wonderful exploring experience. The streets are empty, no noise, cool breeze and a great photo opportunity. We took photo's of the Museum of Modern Art, Disney Hall, Dorothy Chandler Pavilion, the Courthouse, etc. Upon departure we were fortunate enough to have Robert as our driver. The Omni has a real jewel with Robert as one of their drivers. Thanks Omni Los Angeles for a great weekend get-a-way! Dona Tittle

Reviews.Title: “Omni - OK!”
Reviews.Author: Vic
Reviews.Content: Stayed six nights at the Omni as we got a great deal on Skoosh.com. It worked out at less than Â£75 a night. The room was typical of a large hotel, clean and functional. Service was good and efficiant. Definitely worth signing up to the Select Guest program - it is free. We got free wireless which otherwise is $10 for 24hrs, free beverages and newspapers in the mornings. We didn't eat in either of the restaurants nor really explore the area. We had a car and were travelling out of downtown to see other areas of LA. If you get a great deal then the hotel is worth it, otherwise as a tourist I would stay else where.

Reviews.Title: “good choice in downtown”
Reviews.Author: anilegna
Reviews.Content: LA was my home but this time we were only here for one night, just needed a place to sleep for a few hours before attending a funeral the next day, after getting off a 14 hour flight, was nice to get upgraded to the club floor (after I made a small fuss about not sharing a king size bed with my brother, especially since I requested two beds 2 weeks before hand & re requested/confirmed during the online check in process 2 days before arriving in LA) the hotel is older but comfortable, located on a quiet street in LA downtown, we left in a rush in the morning so didn't have a chance to eat there but I'd would go back the next time when I don't have a place to crash in in LA (although if this was a for pleasure trip I'd probably try some of the other boutique hotels in LA)

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior223
Reviews.Content: I was at the Omni on business for 5 days. The hotel itself was beautiful, with a nice restaurant, however management and the guest rooms left much to be desired. The first night I found a wierd eye drop applicator type device in my bed- which left me to seriously question whether or not the bedding was actually changed from the last guest. I requested a new room, but was given a hard time by the manager on duty who simply wanted to change the linens. I was given another room that had still not been cleaned from the last guest!!! My third room had a bed that looked like someone had received a hair cu on- literally had hair all over the comforter- how does housekeeping not see this??? Fourth room was fine but nothing special. The area around the hotel had nothing to do after 5 or 6 pm when the area businesses closed. I didn't feel safe in the area after dark and opted for room service most nights, which was very good. I probably wouldn't return to this hotel based on cleanliness issues with the room, and issues dealing with the management that was unaccommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Handsome Hotel--Great food and location”
Reviews.Author: superh50
Reviews.Content: The Omni hotel is definitely a standout hotel among the ones I've been too in LA. It's located right in downtown LA and the views from the room let you see all of it. Rooms are quite large and I feel like they are decorated like your own bedroom--not a standard, basic hotel room. There are two good restaurants, one is a little more luxurious, but both have really good food. There a huge pool outside with nice lounge chairs. Also, the fitness center is very nice and has a lot of machines. I'd say it's a great place for everyone, business travelers in particular. I took a video of my stay and it shows more of what I was talking about: http://www.tripfilms.com/Travel_Video-v64421-Los_Angeles-The_Omni_Hotel-Video.html

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at the Omni!”
Reviews.Author: LostinTX
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni LA during our tromp through Southern Califronia. Los Angeles was our first stop and we were more than happy with our stay at the hotel. The staff was amazing. Our kids loved the little back backs they received. The backpacks were more of a hit then the actual gadgets inside. The beds were heaven. I could have slept all day. We didn't get to enjoy the pool as it rained our entire stay in LA, but I saw that they had one. The only thing that could have gone better was our room service. We came in late one evening and ordered some hamburgers. That's pretty much what we got, hamburgers on a bun, no lettuce, cheese or anything. All in all it was a great stay in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Piccolo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while attending a convention at the L.A. Conention Center. Service is wonderful - we asked for a few things and got them almost immediately. There will always be an attendant to open the door for you. It is not the best location for the LACC as it is a mile and a half away. Fortunately we had shuttle service. There is also not much shopping or restaurants nearby as it is in the business district. But you can walk several blocks and get to what you need. The rooms are nice and comfortable however I agree about the entry way being awkward. The main door and bathroom door just inside almost bump together. The closet is roomy, but has no light. If you put your suitcase in there on the rack, you'll have a hard time seeing your belongings. TV does need to be upgraded. There were only about 10 channels available. But, those are minor things to me. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Winner in every category”
Reviews.Author: hmack
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly outstanding in every aspect. We were in a party of 16 people attending a convention downtown, and everyone of us were happy with the hotel. Service- Omni has a reputation in providing attentive service that is commonly found in Asia. This hotel provides a benchmark for good service that rivals that of Four Seasons or Mandarin Oriental but without the attitude. Staff is plentiful and they are everywhere.. They are also courteous and eager to help us whenever we encounter them. We had a small problem with room service and management was quick to correct the mistake. Rooms- clean and good size. Beds are very comfortable and provides good support. Bathroom is also spacious. Plenty of towels. They even provide a fresh pair of slippers. Location is good. However there are not much shopping close by. Complementary car is available within a 3 mile radius. Great hotel period. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay for downtown LA.”
Reviews.Author: sakio
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at practically every downtown hotel in L.A. and this one is up on top of my list. The service is absolutely spot-on for business travelers. They are quick, courteous and friendly. You just can't ask for much more than that. The rooms are standard business fare and you will find no surprises. It's clean and roomy enough to work. The restaurant does a good breakfast buffet with pretty much anything you need. The prices are typical business rates. I wouldn't recommend this hotel if you are a tourist due to it's location away from the rest of downtown. It's a good hike to the Staple Center and the Convention Hall, so if you need to go there, you may want to find another place. If you are there on business, it's the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as all the reviews say”
Reviews.Author: simhai
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, but not incredible. The restaurant is nice, but again not incredible. I would say that this is strickly a business travelers hotel. There is a nice pool, but no jacuzzi!!! For this kind of hotel, I am sorry but I expect a Jacuzzi!!! Room were very nice, and very big, with nice decor. This hotel is nice, but it is not amazing. I would recommend it for business travelers who need to be downtown, but not for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stopover - happy experience”
Reviews.Author: Bindoon
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel close to the Amtrak station for a brief stay in LA and Omni at California Plaza fitted the bill. The lobby was not over impressive and with check-in at the rear beyond the stair case. No one offered any help with bags but we were okay with that. The room was welcoming after a long flight with an attractive view from the window. The bathroom was especially nice, very spacious and well designed. The toiletries and towels were top quality. The bedroom was reasonably spacious with a very comfortable easy chair and ottoman - only for one per though. There was a big wardrobe but the lighting was poor when trying to find your garments in it. A walk around the Bunker Hill area in the early evening dusk felt quite safe. We had dinner from the room service menu and it was attractively served although not over tasty. We used the hotel town car next morning and received excellent service. We would recommend this hotel for anyone who is looking for accommodation in that area of LA.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: irishsnowbunny
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in downtown LA, room was spacious and clean and met all our needs. However, I do find it hard to believe that this is the number 1 hotel in LA as I have stayed in nicer properties in past. Ruben the barman made our stay - I must recommend his lemon frop cocktails...

Reviews.Title: “great service at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: Lora21
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Omni for the first few nights of our honeymoon and the staff were so helpful. My new husband had called in advance and we had champagne and few special extras ready when we arrived which was lovely. I would recommend for the service alone but the room was clean and spacious too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: atsirk69
Reviews.Content: My 8 year old and I are on a "alone" getaway to see Wicked in LA. The Omni got good reviews here, so I booked it. The "club level" room we got is $219 per night, cheaper than some of the regular rooms. I found the rate online, but called to confirm the ammenities. Join the frequent guest program for extra perks. Perks of the club level room are a room on the top (17th) floor (with key access to the floor), complementary breakfast (french toast, bacon, lox and bagels, fruit, etc etc), and complementary cocktail hour from 5-8 (alcohol, sodas, snacks). There was so much at the cocktail hour that it was dinner for us! Hotel ammenities: Small outdoor pool (too cold outside for us to go in but the pool was warm), nice workout room, COMFY beds, windows that open. When we checked in we were given a backpack of toys for my daughter. All good. Oh, and our rate included complementary valet parking (normally $30 per night). The only problem was that when we called the front desk last night at 9PM to ask about the circling helicopter a couple blocks away, we were informed that it was due to a movie being filmed (500 Days of Summer was being filmed in the park right outside the hotel during the day). Luckily, we decided not to go check it out, because it was actually the POLICE looking for a SNIPER shooting from another hotel into the street. I had a little chat with the front desk manager about this. She didn't seem to grasp the severity of the mistake. I suspect that as long as things go smoothly, this is a great hotel. And, except for the idiot at the front desk, things went very smoothly. The staff are not the brightest bulbs on the string, but they are very friendly. I would stay here again for sure, especially with the kids! I just wouldn't ask anyone here for advice.

Reviews.Title: “exceptional service, comfy bed (rqst a high floor for a view)â€Ž”
Reviews.Author: comowhat54
Reviews.Content: I received an excellent deal for this hotel from work, and I'm VERY glad I took advantage of booking my stay here. We got a 12th floor room and swear we were one of only another couple that was on the same floor out of over 20 rooms. It was a refreshing oasis of silence. Valet parking only, and it's a bit pricey at $30/day, but its nice that you can go in and out as often as you'd like. Sign up at the omnihotels.com for their preferred guest reward program (free) and then you are able to get free wi-fi in the room (otherwise it's $10/day), free morning bevs, etc. I highly enjoyed my stay here, and would totally return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Hotel with GREAT Location and GREAT service”
Reviews.Author: jmrubins
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of Bunker Hill, the cener of downtown Los Angeles. We chose it because of proximity to AMTRAK and the Disney concert hall. There were just soooo many other museums and attractions nearby we stayed two extra nights! The staff were friendly, fantastically helpful, and seemed more genuine than most four star staff. The price was also right because of hotwire.com. We have already booked more nights for the Fall. The rooms are large, bedding comfortable, bathrooms almost as large as the bedroom with separate shower and tub. The desk leaves a little to be desired and they charged $9.95/day for internet but otherwise it was a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel; Great Value”
Reviews.Author: kmjlhs
Reviews.Content: I stayed on a business trip for 2 nights. The room was spacious and clean and was a corner unit with windows facing in 2 directions. The beds had comforters and were very comfortable. Wireless internet access is available free to Omni Selected Guests. Bathroom was large with separate shower. A large safe was in the closet, big enough to store a laptop. The only issue was the presence of 3 very large moths flying around in the room. They must have entered through an open window when they aired it out prior to my arrival. They were difficult to eliminate, but I was successful with the use of a spare towel. The hotel staff is very responsive and friendly. Almost everyone I encountered asked if I needed anything, if my stay was enjoyable and if they could do anything for me. So, top notch service, beautiful and spacious rooms, all for $209 per night. That is a great value for a downtown hotel in a major city.

Reviews.Title: “Omni all the way”
Reviews.Author: maepetrson
Reviews.Content: The Omni Los Angeles is a safe place to stay in Los Angeles (and that's from a New Jerseyian) . It provides a classy atmosphere and is home to some of the most professional staff I've ever encountered. Their services and hospitality are unmatched. The conceirge was always willing to help decide where to eat, what to do, and even make reservations for us. The location is also within walking distance to the Disney Concert Hall, and surrounding coffee shops, casual eateries, convenience stores, and of course, Starbucks. The outdoor pool could use some work, but it's heated and even in April, LA was a bit chilly for the beach. Overall, the hotel was a steal for the price and location!

Reviews.Title: “#1 in LA??”
Reviews.Author: RaiderEd
Reviews.Content: Overall we had an enjoyable, problem-free stay at the Omni LA. I just find it hard to believe that this is the top-rated hotel in all of Los Angeles. LA hotels must really be in sad shape. The hotel staff was very friendly so I will give them props for that. The room was clean but just average overall (beds were nice but unfortunately my back didn't agree). The bathroom was large but had no counterspace and the shower water pressure was pitiful. For a hotel that welcomes kids (toy packs, cookies), their TV service did not have either Disney or Nickelodeon. Room service was tasty but quite expensive. No vending machines so you're forced to order drinks from room service. Valet service was slow, even slower when we called ahead. Biggest frustration was that we were in town for the Lakers game and hoped to have the car service take us to Staples Center. When we asked the valet to arrange it he told us that they didn't go to Staples Center. Huh? It's a mile away! He didn't even provide an explanation or offer to at least take us somewhere closer to the arena. Overall the Omni was a nice place to stay, just not what I would expect from the #1 hotel in the 2nd largest city in the country.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DJB21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked 2 nights at the Omni for a weekend stay. This was a nice property with excellent service. From the moment we checked in until the time we checked out the service was great. We arrived early and the hotel was able to make arrangements for us to check in an hour early. The gal at guest service was very friendly and helpful, she told us about different restaurants to eat at in the area. Everyone we dealt with at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. We went to a Lakers game on Friday which was a $10 cab ride from the hotel. The hotel is only about 7 miles from the Hollywood area so it was easy to get to from the hotel. We had some drinks at the Noe Restaurant which was nice and relaxing. The room was very spacious with a large bathroom, the bed was very comfortable. We were very impressed with Omni and would definately return if we are in the Los Angeles area.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UkZob
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, clean, comfortable and opulent, staff excellent. Only 2 minor complaints: Valet parking 30 dollars per day.........Expensive. Bar prices.............Expensive Otherwise fantastic,highly recommend this hotel if you are staying in downtown LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: croooc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Omni Los Angeles for the weekend of 21-23 March. It was a great experience, especially after a long flight from London! We had booked the room through a website different from the one of the hotel and they had given us a doble bed room. Upon arriving, we asked for a king sized bed, and they gave it to us without any addicional fare. And what a room! The bed was really big and confy, thouht you needed a stair to get to it... We registered to the Select Guest Service through their website and they gave us free wifi access and complimentary drinks in the morning. The service received was excellent. The hotel is located in a nice area, though there isn't much to do around! We found the valet service expensive (30$ per day) but they were nice and prompt. Overall, a really good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Omni downtown LA is very hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: DexterBarSinister
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni for 2 nights, and I have to say that this is one of the nicest hotel stays I've had in some time. I picked up a tip from this website, and signed up for Omni's SelectGuest program online. It's free and easy to do. If you sign up for that, you get free Wifi in your hotel room when you stay at an Omni, as well as a free newspaper of your choice every AM, and a free AM beverage of your choice, both delivered to your door. It's worth doing. The Omni emailed me a day before my trip, offering me the option of checking in online, which I did. As it happens, I got out on a flight that was earlier than I thought, and I arrived at the Omni at 2pm. I thought I would be too early to check in, but not so: my room was ready and all I had to do was pick up my room key in an envelope with my name on it at the front desk, and I was good to go. Very quick and easy. The room was very large, with bed, armchair + ottoman, desk, and a couch, as well as the obligatory TV/minibar armoir unit. The bathroom was also quite large, with a tub and a separate, glass-enclosed shower. The room was reminiscent of some stays I've at the Four Seasons, but not nearly as expensive. I stayed Thursday and Friday nights: the Thursday rate was $179, and the Friday rate was $249, so that averages to $215 per night, I think. There is a spa/gym on the 4th floor, with a pool long enough to swim laps in, which most hotels do not have. I'm guessing it was 45 feet x 15 feet. Everything was clean; everyone was polite, and everything went smoothly. I had dinner one night at a Japanese restaurant called Sai Sai, which is a couple of blocks away, and that restaurant has fantastic sushi. It was some of the best sushi I've had, rivaling even the superlatively great sushi restaurant of northern California: Sushi Ran, located in Sausalito. I can't think of anything negative to say about the Omni LA. If you need to be downtown, I don't think you can find a nicer hotel, even if you pay a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Off-line at the Omni, but Still In-Line Service”
Reviews.Author: Scubatripper
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni hotel for a conference and while I generally liked the hotel and the people there, there were a few annoyances. But first the good stuff, because I would definitely return to this hotel, despite the problems. Things do happen. This is a four star hotel and it is nicely, if not extravagantly appointed with pleasant, but sparsely decorated rooms that are big with large, airy windows. The hotel staff was very good and the facility is within walking distance of the Museum of Contemporary Art, the Frank Gehry-designed Walt Disney Concert Hall and, well, not much else. The high end hotel restaurant, Noe, is spectacular as was the service there. But there were a few rough edges you don't expect at a hotel like this. My wife and I got out of the shuttle with two large bags each and two carry-ons each, but no one came to take our bags. We dragged our luggage into the lobby ourselves. I thought a bellman would pick us up there and certainly once we checked in, but they never came. A surprise at a hotel of this rating. The Omn also needs to upgrade their TVs and cable reception, as both were substandard. But the real, but unusual disappointment was the complete loss of internet service. Ironically, I was attending an internet convention and on the first day, the hotel internet went down and remained down for two of our three days there. The Omni was very accommodating, and ultimately comped me on a night's room, but again, in a major hotel in a major city, you don't expect this lapse of service. Upon leaving the hotel, Bell service was very prompt, stored my luggage for the hour or so I had to kill and checked me out quickly. I would definitely stay at the Omni again. Ditto any other good things you read here.

Reviews.Title: “A superlative experience yet again !”
Reviews.Author: elpelso
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth time staying at this superlative hotel. I got a really great deal through a travel agent, and this only makes this stay more worthwhile. The staff are really friendly, the rooms are large and very comfortable. If you are looking for a hotel in downtown L.A., look no further...

Reviews.Title: “Great but not for us”
Reviews.Author: jaym6
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and i stayed at the Omni for 3 mights in early january. We had mixed reviews of this hotel. This is a very well maintained, clean, modern hotel. It was immaculate the beds are huge and bathroom was amazing. However we were aware that this hotel is chatered towards business stays and that there are a lot of confrences etc at this hotel and is not ideal for tourists which was our reason for stay. For a hotel that is based around business people the internet connection and cell reception was terrible. We spoke to hotel staff about this and they said yes it is pretty bad at times. Also another negative was that there was one terrible conierge at this hotel. He told us he didnt know the area that well and he also stuffed up a hire car booking we had made thru him. However there is a very capable female concierge there whom saved us on a couple of occasions. The location is okay once you figure out where you are and where everything else is but it was daunting at first. Overall the hotel is very nice one of the nicest we stayed in, but just wasnt for us.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: augieray
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant five-night stay at the Omni. We found the staff to be exceptional. The front desk staff was helpful and professional, the concierge provided great advice, and the bell staff was so attentive I don't think we touched a door entering or leaving the hotel in five days. The room was great and extremely quiet. The bed was very comfortable. We were also very impressed with the breakfasts at the Omni, which were typically expensive for hotels but very good and generous. Some people have noted that there isn't much to do in downtown LA, but we found plenty of restaurants and nightspots within six blocks. It takes a little walking or cabbing, but there are nice restaurants, bars and lounges nearby including Seven Grand, the Daily Grill, the Elevate Lounge, and the lounges at The Orchid, The Standard and the Biltmore. The Omni is highly recommended if you're looking to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Omni is the best in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: oysterhead
Reviews.Content: I love the Omni. From my experience, it's the best hotel in downtown LA, better than the Hilton Checkers or the Biltmore. The rooms are very nice, the staff are awesome. There's even a Starbucks on-site. And plenty of great restaurants within walking distance (e.g. Nick and Steph's).

Reviews.Title: “Strongly recommend the Omni!”
Reviews.Author: HappyCoupleMN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni the weekend of February 8th for the 50th Annual Grammy Awards. Here are a few of our comments: Transportation: You can take a Super Shuttle from the airport, just go outside by the taxi area and look for the guys in the red and blue jackets. The ride is only $15 per person. On the way back we took a cab ($42 flat rate plus tip) because we were in a rush, but the shuttle is also available from the hotel. We also took the metro (located a few blocks from the Omni) to Hollywood which was a little scary, I would definitely not take it after dark but is a cheap way to get around. Service: My husband and I both agree that we have never experienced such remarkable service as at the Omni! They are unbelievably helpful, friendly and professional. We never stood in the lobby for more than 1 minute without someone politiely asking to help! They were super helpful with any question or request we had. EXCELLENT! Rooms/Hotel Quality: The lobby is beautiful and the hotel is overall extremely clean and well kept. Our only complaint was the lack of counter space in the bathrooms (pretty tight for 2 people and all of our toiletries/hair dryer/etc..) But the bed is wonderful and comfortable and the rooms are very attractive. There is no refrigerator (only the mini bar) so we had to put our wine over ice which was fine. Dining/Location: We only ate at the Grand Cafe at the hoel for breakfast which was very good. We ate dinner at the restaurants in the Plaza which is adjacent to the hotel, both of which were very nice (steak restaurant was more expensive but good). There are also several stores in the plaza to buy snacks, coffee (Starbuck's) etc... which is convenient. We heard that room service was also excellent, but was a little on the pricey side. Overall we would strongly recommend the Omni, a lovely place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but...”
Reviews.Author: just...d
Reviews.Content: My two adult sons and myself stayed for just one night at the Omni. The check in, after doing the on line checkin, was great! Everything including my breakfast slips and room key were in an envelope with my name on it ready to go. The room was perfect and very comfortable. The staff was very helpful as we wanted to walk to Staples Center for a concert and they told us the safest and quickest way to go. The breakfast the next morning was my only complaint. We had a total of nine people, six of whom had stayed at other hotels in the area, that all arrived to eat together. The buffet was awesome! The food ordered off the menu was above average but the SERVICE was HORRIBLE! I had to leave the table, after requesting a coffee refill four times, to find someone who would bring us more coffee. (it was our FIRST refill, not fourth or fifth) Another one from our party also had to leave the table to obtain MINIMAL service. I own a restaurant, and tend to be sympathetic to overworked food servers, HOWEVER, this was not the case here. No more than six other tables in use in the entire restaurant, and our server stood talking to other staff for over twenty minutes while we waited. The room and the hotel is fabulous. Don't expect much from their breakfast service

Reviews.Title: “I Read the Reviews And It Was As Good As They Said”
Reviews.Author: ilovepianoconcerts
Reviews.Content: I flew to Los Angeles from Vancouver in November 2007 to attend a concert by legendary pianist Martha Argerich (and she showed up!!). I used Trip Advisor to look for a hotel since I don't know anyone in LA. I considered several less expensive hotels all within walking distance of the Walt Disney Concert Hall but was finally convinced to book at the Omni because the reviews are very favourable compared to the others. The hotel service and location was excellent and really made my stay a great experience. We ate at the hotel's award winning Noe Restaurant before walking across the street to the concert hall. After the concert, we had a drink at the hotel lounge. The following day we went to the Museum of Contemporary Art also next door. A taxi ride to the Beverly mall was $60 return, but it was premium shopping if you want to spend the money on taxi. Transportation to and from the airport and the door of the hotel was by Super Shuttle around $22-$30 each way so I saved on taxi money there. The room was clean and quiet and had all the usual amenities. The lady and man at the Concierge helping visitors were pleasent , knowledgeable and patient. It was a truly pleasurable experience. I would book at the Omni again and recommend it to anyone going to LA and want to stay in the nice and safe financial district.

Reviews.Title: “Four-star amenities at a great price”
Reviews.Author: siwanderwoman
Reviews.Content: I booked the Omni via Skoosh.com at an all-inclusive price of $122/night. The standard room was spacious and spotless. It had a king-size bed that was very comfortable, with soft comforters and an abundance of fluffy pillows. The bath had separate tub and shower. The only thing lacking that I would have wanted was a safety box. The room came with complimentary wi-fi, which was great because it helped me plan and book the rest of my trip online. I've heard a lot of good things about Omni's Noe restaurant so we had dinner there one night. The food was very good (I tried the chicken while my friend had the lobster) but quite pricey. I've read comments from everywhere that downtown LA is not a very good location because there's not much action going on there at night and during weekends. It is in a way true but it makes up for the lack of action through its proximity to public transportation. The Pershing Square train station is just two blocks away from the hotel, an easy walk. Or if you need a ride anywhere within the downtown area, the hotel offers a complimentary shuttle service. There's not a convenience store within walking distance so if you need to fill up the bar with your own stock, plan ahead. Service can be cold and impersonal but I expected that from a chain hotel. What mattered more to me was that I was attended to promptly and I got help when I needed it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: queendomcome
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights and 4 days in November. This hotel is very lovely. Location is downtown LA. The parking was complimentary which was AWESOME!! There really isn't a whole lot around the area, but we were driving so it didn't matter. The L.A. traffic wasn't even bad. I'm from NY so I know what hectic traffic can be like. The rooms: Nice size beds were A+, well stocked mini bar (of course some items were ridiculously pricey), beautiful bathroom. Everything was clean and lovely. Room service though it took a bit was absolutely scrumptous. Staff was wonderful. Bar is located on 3rd fl. This is a up class joint that was well worth the money. I would stay here in again in a heartbeat!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: KrisKros
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for two nights in September, and have to say that it was one of the best experiences Iâ€™ve ever had! It was a total delight to stay at Omni from check-in to check-out. The entire hotel is beautiful and the rooms are very nicely appointed. We had a king room and the bed was to die for â€“ really comfortable! The room was large and clean, and the bathroom enormous by European standards! A car in LA is a â€œmustâ€�, so staying downtown was not much of a problem for us. Just be sure to get directions or have a GPS, because Omni can be hard to find if youâ€™re not familiar with the area. We got a bit lost on the way over there one night and ended up in South Centralâ€¦which was a bit scaryâ€¦ Downtown LA is pretty dead on the weekend, but we enjoyed the quietness. Was great to be able to return to Omni, after a long day.. If you have the right expectations Omni is a great find! I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Tagesthemen
Reviews.Content: As it was our first time in LA, we booked a hotel downtown and the Omni seemed to fit the bill. However, we regret that we did not book somewhere hipper and livilier like in West Hollywood. We quickly learned that downtown is not somewhere that we wanted to walk around in the evening. It was all very depressing and souless and felt a bit dangerous. The hotel itself was fairly standard. The kind of place I like to stay in on business, but for pleasure I want something with more character which I have only myself to blame for as I had stayed in the Omni before on business and found it "efficient". However there were other problems: We were very unhappy with valet parking. There was an event on in the hotel one evening and we had to wait about 15 minutes on the street to drop our car OFF (!). Message to hotel: if you have an event on, you need to get more staff and put your hotel guests first. Another irritation was that there was no safe in the room. We had to desposit our valuables downstairs with the front desk which was inconvenient. Overall, the Omni LA is a "good" hotel but definitely not for us.

Reviews.Title: “Art in the Heart of L.A.”
Reviews.Author: smoovy
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to L.A., we decided to spend a night at the Omni based on reviews and proximity to the downtown LA art scene. We were SO happy with this hotel. From check-in to check-out this hotel surpassed our expectations. The rooms were gorgeous, and we had a view of the new Disney Music Hall. We were just behind MOCA and just down the street from the theater complex. We spontaneously booked tickets for a show at the Ahmanson Theater, and then stopped into the hotel restaurant NOE for a bite before the show. Of all the wonderful things I could say about the Omni, our experience at NOE was the best. The food is amazing. We ate our pre-show snack in front of a fireplace (it was a chilly night), and had terrific service. I would highly recommend this hotel to others, and even if you don't stay at the omni, check out NOE if you're in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: emma027
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Hotel in LA for two nights during our 2 week road trip in California. We choose this hotel based on the reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not at all disappointed. We booked through hotelsrus.co.uk and got a bargain rate of Â£56 a night which included tax. The hotel is in the business district, and it took us 20 minutes to drive to Hollywood Boulevard in the rush hour, which was not bad at all. We loved everything about this hotel, from the minute you walk in the staff are pleasant and canâ€™t do enough to help you. The whole hotel is immaculately kept to the highest standards; we did not see anything wrong the entire time we were there. You have to pay for Valet parking, but so do you in most hotels so itâ€™s not a big deal and the Valet staff brought the car round really quickly and were very helpful with loading of bags etc. The rooms were great, big comfy beds, with pillow top mattresses and all the amenities you could need. The bathrooms were huge with a separate bath and shower! The room was well set out, with a nice view and was spotless. As we were tired we ended up ordering room service both nights of our stay, which was reasonably priced compared with a lot of hotels. Especially considering they set you up a table for two in your room, not just on a tray, which was a lovely touch. The food was restaurant quality, and of course as with all food in the US the portions were huge. We did not have time to use the pool but it did look very nice and the equipment in the fitness centre looked brand new. After spending all day sightseeing in LA with all the crowds, it was certainly a relief to be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Comfortable Stay at the Omni”
Reviews.Author: kimonadragon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni for two nights on business travel. From the moment I arrived when the valet picked up my car, to the moment I departed when the valet returned my car, I experienced nothing but great customer service from Omni's staff. A first I was skeptical, thinking that the staff was being nice to perhaps make up for less adequate rooms, but when I opened the door to my room, I found it to be clean, comfortable and modern. No dust or crumbs around the baseboards. The mattress was high and firm. The sheets were white and the beds were decorated with accent pillows. The bathroom featured a separate shower and tub, complimentary toilettries and clean, white shower rugs. I also used the fitness center and was impressed with the number and condition of the cardio machines. Most hotels have one or two machines that are terribly outdated. The fitness center at the Omni was spacious and featured elliptical machines, treadmills with mini tvs, and some machine and free weights. The free weights were a little on the old side, but the overall fitness room was more than what I expected. Further, the Omni has a courtesy car that can take you to any business location in the city! I definitely recommend the Omni if service, cleanliness and amenities are of importance to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mommy77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for 2nights. The Location was great. Its in the downtown area close to chinatown, staples, shopping area and restaurants. The service was excellent, valet parking, checking in, room service, housekeeping etc. The flower arrangements in the lobby are so beautiful and refreshing. They also gave my son a bag of toys and goodies. The room is somewhat disappointing. It is small, the decor dated, room configuration is not done properly ( e.g. when you open the closet you cannot go to the bathroom or front door. Maybe its only our room but still this is an inconvenience) and the tub is really small. However the bed is comfortable. Over all it was a NICE stay and we will definitely come back to OMNI when we go again for a vacation in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but, not great .... Middle of Road Hotel for me.”
Reviews.Author: koolchas
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a business conference at the Omni thus, stayed at the hotel for two nights. I booked on Expedia with a good rate about 3 months before my stay. A few days before arriving, I was checking the Omni website for WiFi access and learned there is a charge of $9.95/day. But, if you sign up for "Select Guest" which is free and create a profile with your likes/dislikes, you get WiFi access for free as well as 2 morning drinks (oj, v8, etc....) and a daily paper of your choice. Also, if you book with the hotel, you can check in "Online" as long as give at least a two hour notice you are coming. Since I booked on Expedia, I could not do this. On arrival, check in was quick. You can only valet park which is $26/night. I got my requested high floor corner room on the 15th floor with a decent view. The room itself is a bit dated. The carpet showed signs of wear with stains. "Build Up" was around the shower door. The bathtub had a layer of sediment (or dirt) in it but, since it was late at night and I knew I would not use it (I used the separate shower), I just put a note the next morning to inform the staff the bathtub was "dirty." The TV is standard tube TV with a good representation of channels including HBO. The honor bar was well stocked and is a traditonal "dorm fridge" which I like since you can put your own things in it if you want (I just hate the new wave of honor bars that use motion sensors so you can't move anything or put in your own stuff). The big plus was the bed. It was very comfortable and pillows large and soft. On my first night, turndown service was not done. Turn down service was done for the second night. Each morning, I received two drinks and the LA Times left at my door which I specificed on the Select Guest door hanger. WiFi service in this hotel is very spotty both in my room and during my conference. In my room, it seemed like I had to sit a certain way in a specific part of the room to get a solid connection. Anywhere else, it would drop. For my conference, some areas had excellent connection rates while others had none which frustrated several attendees. But, for me the main focus was on my room and it was terrible. Although many rave about the location, I found it to be the complete opposite. There is really not much around the hotel within walking distance. I walked a four block radius and saw nothing in terms of good food, bars, etc... Looking out my window I could see the 110 freeway and of course, it's a parking lot at 5-6pm so, although I knew I could get somewhere in my car it was not worth the headaches to get it out of valet and fight traffic knowing I could only be out a few hours at most. But, the hotel bar; Noe, is really nice and they did have a small menu which I had dinner which was decent but, pricy. Check out was quick and easy but, I was not honored with a "late check out." My conference was all day until 5pm and lunch was after the check out time of 12:00. Having an extra hour would have been nice. But, I was able to give my suitcase to valet and they put it in my car. At the end of day, getting my car leave took a bit of time but, that was expected since everyone who attended the same conference as me was leaving as well as there were other meeting events ending which made a small bottleneck in getting out of the hotel. Overall, the Omni is not a bad hotel. Only few negatives but, the poor WiFi and bad location (for me) makes me rate it as "Middle of the Road."

Reviews.Title: “Nice property for the weekend warrior”
Reviews.Author: Meerkat92101
Reviews.Content: Aside from some minor inconvenience upon check in (were initially given the wrong room type as requested) - the front counter staff made accomodations to fix it right on the spot. The room was wonderful and hotel location was central. Nice to be downtown on the weekend when it's quiet. We used the hotel as a jumping point to the west side, which worked out nicely. The bathroom was exceptionally appointed and the beds were marvelous. The pool was small but enjoyable. Truly, the service made the difference here. I would recommend this place as a quick weekend get away.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the nicest hotel in Downtown LA.”
Reviews.Author: life_is_my_vacation
Reviews.Content: The Omni is considered the most upscale hotel in Downtown Los Angeles. Having stayed at a couple of other downtown hotels, I would say it is probably the best overall choice, if cost is not an issue. Aside from one rude front desk employee (who later called back to apologize, to his credit), the service is classy, the rooms are standard sized, with comfortable beds and nice bathrooms, and the spa/fitness center are very nice. The location is great, if you have a reason to stay in Downtown LA. TIP: When booking your room, request one with views of the much-talked-abou Walt Disney Concert Hall, designed by architect Frank Gehry.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni!”
Reviews.Author: TravelAdvice101
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni for 2 nights while on a business trip. Prices were obviously high, as expected for this hotel, but service was definitely up to par. Very friendly and helpful hotel staff. No complaints about anything at all. Food was great at both restaurants -- Noe (creme brulee is awesome!) and the Grand Cafe (french toast is wonderful!). Didn't use the gym facility, but it looked good. My room overlooked the pool and it was situated on a rooftop and looked nice (just too cold out to swim). The room was excellent. Very clean and beautiful bed. Nice bathrobes available to use as well. I did request a single king bed (my preference), but they only had 2 queens when I checked in. Not a major issue, but I did check in at 8am (regular check-in is 3pm I believe), so they were pretty accomodating. I highly recommend signing up for the Select Guest program that the Omni has (free to sign up on website). You get free internet access in your room (otherwise there is a charge) as well as your choice of newspaper in the mornings as well as 2 complimentary beverages each morning. A really great program for no charge, in my opinion. In addition, make sure to provide your mileage program number upon check-in so you earn mileage points for your stay. The location is okay for downtown access. It's connected to the California Plaza, so if you need to get to the Deloitte & Touche or KPMG bldgs, etc....this is the place to stay. Definitely easy access.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Here for a Dodger game”
Reviews.Author: tluvdodgers
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to go to a Dodger game and were VERY happy. Cab was less than 20 and the Dodgers won the game! We were there on the weekend and the little mall nearby was closed and there was not a lot to do within walking distance. We felt very safe walking at night. there was a mini concert at the nearby mall. the pool was awesome. Room service was a little pricey but overall we were very pleased. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We were impressed with the Omni”
Reviews.Author: jules43
Reviews.Content: Arrived exhausted after long, delayed flight. Impressive lobby area, creating a good first impression, efficient check-in. Room a fair size- bathroom also spacious-separate shower and bath. Went to bar to eat- a relaxing atmosphere with pianist, comfy leather sofas and low lighting. Service wasn't speedy, but felt O.K. not to rush in these surroundings. The outdoor tables overlooked the Plaza, where a free concert was taking place- we were just too tired to fully appreciate. Beds extremely comfortable-slept very well all 3 nights. Turndown service with chocolates and weather forecast first two days only. Teenaged son is a fussy eater, so didn't want anything on hotel menu for breakfast. Went to see Amy, the efficient bubbly concierge, who gave us a street map, phoned Hollywood Bowl about a concert for us, gave us Metro information, then went out to ask Robert [lovely man] one of the hotel car drivers to take us to IHOP for breakfast - excellent choice, very clean and great staff. We caught Metro to Hollywood, where we spent all day and evening. Back to IHOP in hotel car next day- had to wait a short while to go. However, coming back took one hour, from first phoning from IHOP to arriving back at Omni- not too impressed. Went to collect hire car from Union Street Station- wow, it's like going back in time-we loved it! Headed off to the beach. No problems with valet parking- except expensive, but we only had car for one night. Can't comment on either restaurant, except to say that Noe looked like a very spacial place for couples to share a romantic meal. Overall, we were impressed with the Omni. We were comfortable and treated well by all staff. The hotel car issue was really the only complaint, but we felt that was outweighed by far by all the positives. Location may have become a problem if we had been staying longer with no hire car. However, Metro station was not too far away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a bad experience with valet parking.”
Reviews.Author: gmx5050
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate through the hotel website. The people checking me in were nice and the room was just fine. Was glad to have a pool. If you're sound sensitive like me, though, you might notice that you can hear the vibration from mechanical things around the pool under (and, for that matter) above the water as it seems surrounded by big whirly-noise making things. Overall, I had a fine stay. Room service was yummy but they didn't follow through on my request to leave it outside my door and I wasn't happy about that. Biggest bummer was that I was only there 1 night and my car bumper got dinged from the valet parking. No response from management despite an attempt to contact them. This was my first time at an Omni and the car ding and non-response leaves a bad taste in my mouth. I might not return to this hotel or just park my car myself if I do. As for other Omnis, I'd consider it. Just hope they have their parking better worked out or a manager who is responsive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room romm service was bad”
Reviews.Author: SHERRY55
Reviews.Content: Room was nice and clean but did not get the turn down service and requests for breakfast juices was never picked up so we did not get that either. Front desk was sorry and did not charge for valet which by the way was $24 per day. Might look else where next time for better service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni!”
Reviews.Author: Lola09
Reviews.Content: The Omni Hotel was a lovely, clean friendly place, and a good nightly rate. I cannot find fault with the hotel at all, the only thing me and my family did'nt like was downtown Los Angeles, its boring, especially at night its dead!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Travellerforlife
Reviews.Content: We arrived earlier than check-in time and our room was not ready. So, we waited till check-in time and it still was not ready. Front Desk then gave us an upgrade to the Executive Suite - 1 King bed and 1 sleeper sofa, huge bathroom, desk and chairs. We valeted our car but the wait was quite long. It's a nice downtown hotel. We stayed there 'cos we wanted to go to the Greek Theatre. It was about 20 mins drive via the city rather than via the freeway. There was a restaurant at the hotel and the food was good. There was a buffet for breakfast on Sunday and we enjoyed that.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenandcraig
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni Hotel this past weekend (Aug. 24-27) and what a great place to stay! The location is right in the heart of downtown (about 5 min. for the Staples Center), it has great views from all around and from each room! You are greeted when you drive up with the valet and a plenty of friendly doorsman(s) to help you with your luggage. When you walk in, ahead is a beautiful atrium and mixture of flowers, grand stairs, and personable staff. The check-in was easy and now for the room.....I requested a room with double beds only because the room is usually bigger and I like the space. Anyways, warm decor and neutral colors used through-out, down-feather, crisp white fluffy beds, a nice closet (with a iron, but no ironing board??, kinda weird). The bathroom had a seperate shower and tub with marble floors and sink. It also has a speaker in the bathroom for you to hear the T.V. (which I thought was neat!) and a phone. It has 2 restraunts, one for breakfast and lunch (which I thought was a little pricey, for example, I had a cappachino and a belgum waffle for $15!!) and they have another restraunt (Japense fusion), smaller selection of food and again pretty pricey considering you could order the Chef's special and spend $100 a person (yikes). The only (disturbing) little issue that i have, is housekeeping would knock on the door and then open it to see how you are doing....I was trying to take a nap!! I thought it was rude.! a phone call would be suffcient. I didn't order room service, but it was available ( for you out there that would like a late night snack). All in all, what a very nice place to stay. I would definately stay again, minus the afternoon interuptions.....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WetAndCold
Reviews.Content: I write reviews because I use reviews to select the hotels I stay in. This is the first hotel where I give it an almost perfect rating; especially for the money. It's 5 star all the way on both service and comfort. There aren't many restaurants around the hotel (it's in a business district), so the food's a little pricey, but it's delicious and the service was great. In fact, the only suggestion I can give this hotel is to upgrade the toilet paper!

Reviews.Title: “"Excellent Stay in an Excellent Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Patricia048
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend stay at the Omni Los Angeles @ California Plaza....and I must say that I was hoping for the best, but was so pleasantly surprised that this hotel met all my expectations and surpassed them. I was traveling with 13 other ladies for a weekend get-away/shopping/relaxation trip and I was responsible for making the accommodations, so I was a little nervous and my hopes were that everyone would be comfortable. I am "very" particular about where I lay my head and I wanted to have the best for our getaway without breaking the bank. The Omni was magnificent, the service was grand, the rooms were beautiful with a neutral decor, marble baths with separate shower and bathtub, large closet space and larger than average room. The beds, well, let's just say that some of us wanted to stay just to sleep in the "heavenly" bed just one more time. The beds are big, fluffy with lots of pillows and ultra comfortable. The room service was excellent and very timely. A few of us ate at the Noe Restaurant in the Hotel on the first night, granted it is "very" pricey, but you get what you pay for. The service was par excellent and the food was wonderful. The swimming pool is a little small and there is no jacuzzi...I did not get an opportunity to visit the Spa, but the prices were quite high. The next day some of us ate in the Cafe, which was very nice and the food had a really nice flare to it. The location was perfect for us as we planned to go shopping at the Garment District which was a few blocks away. There aren't many places open around the Hotel during the weekend, but right outside the door of the hotel, there is a Day Spa where some of us went and had manicures and pedicures and there is also a Starbuck's that stays open on the weekends. In the same area right outside the Hotel in a Plaza there is nightly entertainment, i.e. bands, etc. And of course, you have the Museums and Disney Concert Music Hall right near the Hotel that is also open on the weekend. The Hotel is close to the freeways and Saturday evening some of us went to the Universal City Walk for dinner and fun, which was about 20 minutes away. The Hotel has a courtesy Town Car to take you and pick you up from anywhere within a 3 mile radius. The Valet was steep at $28/night, but there is no other place to park, oh well.....All in all, this is a great place to stay and the only place that I will stay when in downtown Los Angeles....I have stayied in downtown L.A. several times in the past and the other Hotels cannot hold a candle to the Omni....I have already booked another stay with them next month. My hat goes off to the Omni Hotel and Staff and a very much deserved "Thank You" for making our weekend so wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: Margazemmpaul
Reviews.Content: A group of 8, stayed at the Omni for 4 days,after having a short cruise and before moving on to Vegas. It was superb. The service we recieved was excellent. The hotel was lovely and the rooms clean and very comfortable. We didn't eat in the hotel, but had breakfast in the adjoining Plaza , which we loved. Although others have moaned about the location, we all really liked it- away from the hustle and bustle but with transport readily available to every area we wanted to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay!”
Reviews.Author: CAbeachbabe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with my fiance on his birthday weekend. GORGEOUS lobby with amazing flowers. Check-in was a breeze and the iced tea and cookies at the front desk were great. The bellman, doorman and front desk staff here were really on top of things. The concierge left a lot to be desired; she didn't know a thing. The doorman came over and whipped out a map and told us what to see, where to go, where to catch the metro. Our room was on the 7th floor and pristine, great view of a courtyard and adjacent art museum. There are free concerts in the amphitheatre in back of the hotel, and we went and listened to a great cabaret performance. Top notch! We did not eat at the hotel (L.A. has great restaurants!) but did have a drink in the bar and it was very nice. One thing to note: pool area is very small but we were in L.A. to check out the sights, so didn't spend any time at the pool really. Brilliantly located and easy to find as well. We'll stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “excellent room but in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: Charlesgate
Reviews.Content: As long as you know that this hotel is in downtown LA, which is not close to many major tourist spots, it's a very good choice. We had a good weekend rate and, without requesting, were upgraded to concierge level, including buffet breakfast and happy hour. The service and staff were very good. The bed was extremely comfortable, California king size, and the room quite large. We had a corner room with two windows - the design of the building is such that there are many more corner rooms than usual. It overlooked the plaza where a concert was being held - if you kept the windows closed, you wouldn't hear much. The windows did open if you liked. If you did plan to use the California metro, it was just a block away - although I wouldn't recommend it at night if you're not familiar with it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Relax and Enjoy”
Reviews.Author: Roddy_Rod
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, rooms were clean and spacious and the price wasn't all that bad - granted I got it at a copr price. It is right next to the Disney Hall of Music and some other attractions and is smak dap in downtown. Internet access sucked though and they put me in a business room. One would think that the internet access would have worked in that room. that pissed me off a bit

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Omni but not sure about its location”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Pie
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the recommendations on this website but I did not feel as strongly in its favour as other people had done. On arrival by car It was quite difficult to access because of the one way system. Our room was lovely. It was large with excellent amenities although the bathroom was showing its age. After checking in we went for a walk to have a look at the surrounding area. We walked downhill to the jewellery district and I did not feel safe in this area. There were several people sleeping rough on the streets and one was shouting abuse at passing pedestrians. I was glad to get back to the hotel and considered moving to another hotel the next night. On a plus side the hotel is very handy for the theatres (they are in the opposite direction) and we went to see Jersey Boys which was excellent. We found the staff very pleasant and the buffet breakfast was excellent. We also had a meal in Noe restaurant and this was excellent. The hotel is at California Plaza and there is an area where open air concerts take place. This is very enjoyable and many locals come along to enjoy the music. If this hotel had been situated in a different area I would have enjoyed it more but I did not feel comfortable venturing far from the hotel particularly at night.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: davidbruce
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni for one night for business in July 2007, and I definitely had a pleasant stay. I booked my hotel online and in the Special Requests section I asked for a room on a higher floor, and I was pleasantly surprised to see that the hotel actually read my request and honored it (so many do not!). The room was clean and nice but not incredible. The fitness center is small but nice, with new state-of-the-art equipment (not a lot of it but enough for an OK workout) and right next to a spa that looked quite nice (although I didn't get a chance to use it). The restaurant offered healthy and organic options for its breakfast buffet, which was nice to see. The location is good if you need to be downtown, close to many downtown attractions. Overall, I would have no problem recommending this hotel to others. My one complaint, which I have with so many hotels, is that it charged extra for Internet access in the room, which is particularly nonsensical given the fact that there's free wi-fi access in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Pullman1
Reviews.Content: There is a lot of potential here. The building is well located, within walking distance of the arts institutions on Bunker Hill and most of the office buildings in downtown LA. The public spaces inside the hotel and in neighboring California Plaza are attractive. But there is a real sense of fatigue. The facilities need renovation, and the staff seem disengaged. My room was spacious, but had all sorts of problems. For example, hot water in the shower was very slow (like 2 minutes!) to appear and the pressure was never strong; the air conditioning was weak; there was no light next to the reading chair; and the carpet was old, stained, and ugly. Food in the daytime restaurant was really bad: tough and tasteless. (I didn't sample the up-scale evening restaurant, Noe.) And everywhere -- the doormen, the check-in people at the desk, the attendant in the concierge-level lounge -- the staff were indifferent: lots of smiles, but no results. I am sorry to say this. I have stayed here before, and things seemed better then. That's why I returned. It is still an OK hotel, but no more than OK. If what I experienced on my recent trip is typical, one can do better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Best possible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kat824
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for 2 weeks and we loved every minute of it! I have nothing bad to say about this hotel, it has everything that you would ever want. The staff are so friendly, the room is immaculate, the location is excellent and safe and its near the metro and buses etc so its really good if you dont have a car. Stay here if you want a good holiday! If i ever get the chance to go back to Los Angeles then this is the only hotel that i will be staying in!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Getaway For Those of Us In the O.C.”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal2Anywhere
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni Los Angeles for a quick, weekend getaway from June 29 to July 1, 2007. Took advantage of a $119 per night weekend rate to celebrate our 23rd wedding anniversary. * Check-in/Check-out: The quickest, most efficient I've ever experienced anywhere in the world. Check-in was online a few days before our arrival. Our key, etc. was in an envelope ready for us to pick up from a predetermined area the moment we stepped into the hotel. We practically didn't stop from the front door to the elevator! Check-out was just as efficient--drop-off box for the keys, bill already paid. Our package included parking, which saved us $28 per night. The hotel inadvertently charged us for the two nights we stayed, but they promptly reimbursed us with no hassles when we pointed out the mistake.
